ibo: Onyeisi oche mgbanwe nke okpuru ọchịchị Osisiọma, Maazị Ugochukwu Nwaogu, sịrị na Okpuru ọchịchị ahụ ga-aga n' ihu inye aka ime ka ndụ dịrị ndị otu afọ efe ala nna ha na mpaghara ahụ mma.

en: Nwaogu, who was represented by his deputy, Mr Joseph Iguodo, said the council would seek ways to provide a lodge for corps members in the area.
ibo: Nwaogu, nke osote ya, Maazị Joseph Iguodo, nọchiri anya ya sịrị na Okpuru ọchịchị ga-achọ ụzọ inye ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha na mpaghara ahụ ebe obibi.

en: The council boss pledged N50,000 donation to support NYSC programmes in the area.
ibo: Onyeisi okpuru ọchịchị a kwere nkwa puku naịra iri ise iji kwado amụma NYSC na mpaghara ahụ.

en: The Local Government Zonal Inspector, Mrs Ruth Jacob, thanked the council for its support, while commending the corps members for their commitment in actualising the project.
ibo: Onye nlekọta mpaghara ahụ, Odoziakụ Ruth Jacob, kelere Okpuru ọchịchị ahụ maka enyemaka ya, ebe toro ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha maka nkwudosi ike ha n' iweta ọrụ ha ji n' aka ná mmezu.

en: Jacob said that the centre had taught the corps members how to produce many items that could enhance their economy and contribute to the nation's socio-economic development.
ibo: Jacob kwuru na ebe ọmụmụ ihe a akụzierela ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ka e si emepụta ọtụtụ ihe nwere ike ibulite akụnụba ha ma nye aka na mmepe akụnụba na mmekọrịta nke ala anyị.

en: (Updated) Supreme court removes prominent Oyo monarch, Eleruwa of Eruwa
ibo: (Emelitere) Ụlọikpe ukwu wepụrụ eze Oyo a ma ama, Eleruwa nke Eruwa.

en: Eleruwa of Eruwa, Oba Samuel Adegbola
ibo: Eleruwa nke Eruwa, Oba Samuel Adegbola.

en: By Adeola Badru
ibo: Nke si n' aka Adeola Badru

en: Twenty-one years after he ascended the throne of his forebears, the Eleruwa of Eruwa, Oba Samuel Adegbola has been dethroned by the Supreme Court on Friday morning.
ibo: Afọ iri abụọ na otu ka o rigochara oche eze ndị nna nna ya, Eleruwa nke Eruwa, ụlọikpe ukwu achutuola Oba Samuel Adegbola n' oche eze n' ụtụtụ Fraịdee.

en: Vanguard recalls that an Oyo State High Court had on January 26, 2011 removed.
ibo: 'Vanguard' chetere na ụlọikpe dị elu nke Oyo steeti na Jenụwarị 26, 2011 wepụrụla Oba Samuel Adegbola n' oche eze.

en: But not satisfied, he appealed the judgement.
ibo: Mana o jughi ya afọ, ọ wee chọọ mkpegharị ikpe.

en: The sacked monarch was installed the Eleruwa in 1998 by the Oyo State Government amidst protracted protests by members of the rightful ruling house after the last Eleruwa, the late Oba Bolanle Olaniyan, who is from the Akalako ruling house, passed on , on May 1, 1994.
ibo: Gọọmenti Oyo Steeti chiri oba a a chụrụ achụ Eleruwa n' afọ 1998 ka Eleruwa nke ikpeazụ, Oba Bolanle Olaniyan, onye si ụlọ ọchịchị Akalako, nwụrụ n' afọ 1994 n' agbanyeghi ganị ganị ụlọ ọchịchị o ruru ichi oba kpọrọ banyere ya.

en: Although his nomination and selection by the kingmakers were challenged by the Laribikusi house, which argued that he was not a member of the ruling arm, but belonged to Akalako where the previous king emerged, the state government went ahead to inaugurate him, prompting the present action.
ibo: Ọ bụ ezie na ụlọ Laribikusi, nke gbaghara na ọ soghi na ndị na-achị achị mana o si Akalako ebe oba nke gara aga si pụta, anabataghị nhọpụta na nhọrọ ya nke ndị na-eme eze mere, steeti gọọmenti gara n' ihu chie ya oba, nke kpalitere ihe a merenụ.

en: READ ALSO: Hit and run driver kills two vigilante operatives in Anambra, guns removed
ibo: Gụkwuazị: Ọkwọ ụgbọala na-akụ mmadụ gbawara gburu ndị ọrụ nchekwa abụọ, wepụ egbe.

en: Those who challenged the authenticity of Adegbola's claims to the throne are Mr. James Olatunde Idowu and Alhaji Ajao.
ibo: Ndị na-ekwenyeghi na ihe Adegbola kwuru banyere ocheeze ya ziri ezi bụ Maazị James Olatunde Idowu na Alhaji Ajao.

en: Joined in the suit besides Adegbola are: the Governor of Oyo State, the Attorney General, Ibarapa Local Government, Chief Jacob Adewusi, Chief Femi Atanda, Chief Idowu Okeowo, Chief E. Ojebisi and Mr. Kasali I.
ibo: Ndị kwụnyere Adegbola n' ikpe bụ Gọvanọ Oyo Steeti, okpuru ọchịchị Ibarapa, Ichie Jacob Adewusi, Ichie Femi Atanda, Ichie Idowu Okeowo, Ichie E. Ojebisi na Maazị Kasali I.

en: The plaintiffs, represented by the lawyer, Alhaji Lasun Sanusi (SAN) sought eight reliefs in their statement of claims which were all granted by the court.
ibo: Ndị gbara akwụkwọ, ọka ikpe nọchiri anya ha, Alhaji Las unu Sanusi (SAN) chọrọ 'relief' asatọ ha kwuru nke ụlọikpe nyere ya.

en: Having summarized all the submissions of the counsel to both sides, Justice Abimbola resolved all the issues in favour of the plaintiffs.
ibo: Ka Justice Abimbola chịkọtara ihe niile ndị ọka ikpe ndị gbara akwụkwọ na ndị a gbara akwụkwọ, ikpe o kere dabara ndị gbara akwụkwọ.

en: When Nigeria's slow wheel of justice caught up with Uzor Kalu
ibo: Mgbe ikpe ziri ezi Naijiria dakwasara Uzor Kalu

en: After a 12-year trial period, Orji Uzor Kalu, a former governor of Abia State and Chief Whip of the Senate, was yesterday brought to book for offences committed against his people.
ibo: Ka oge ikpe afọ iri na abụọ gachara, Orji Uzor Kalụ, onye bụbu gọvanọ Abịa steeti na Chifu wipu nke sineti, ka a mara ikpe ụnyaahụ maka iwu ọ dara megide ndị nke ya.

en: In the wake of Nigeria's return to democratic governance in 1999, Kalu was one of the governors elected to steer the affairs of the states of the federation and help fulfill the yearnings of the masses for purposeful governance and true development.
ibo: Na mbido Naijiria ịlọghachi azụ n' ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya n' afọ 1999, Kalụ bụ otu n' ime ndị gọvanọ a họpụtara iduzi steeti dị iche iche nke ala anyị na inye aka mezuo ọchịchọ obi ndị mmadụ banyere ọchịchị nwere ebumnuche na ezi mmepe.

en: But amid actions that simulated development and got praise singers christening him 'the messiah,' he plundered the state's till, grossly under-developed his people and set the tone for their sustained impoverishment.
ibo: Mana n' ime mmepe adịgboroja nke mere ndị otimkpu jiri gụọ onye nzọpụta, o zuru ego steeti, mee ka mmepe gbatoo aka n' ebe ndị nke ya nọ ma wetara ha ida ọgbenye.

en: Shortly after stepping down as governor in 2007, the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) took him to court on a 39-count charge bordering on diversion of about N7.65 billion from the state's purse.
ibo: N' egbughi oge o rituru dịka gọvanọ n' afọ 2007, 'Economic and Financial Crimes Commission' kpụgara ya ụlọikpe n' ihi ụzọ ihe iri atọ na itoolu gbadoro ụkwụ inweghara nde N7.65 n' akpa steeti.

en: And yesterday, after a drawn trial, he was handed a 12-year jail sentence at a Federal High Court in Lagos by presiding judge, Mohammed Idris, for money laundering.
ibo: Mana ụnyaahụ, ka e kpechara ikpe ogologo oge, onyeikpe nọ n' isi oche, Mohammed Idris, tụrụ ya nga afọ iri na abụọ n' 'Federal High Court' dị na Legosi, maka izupu ego.

en: In addition to the sentence, Justice Idris ordered that Kalu's company, Slok Nigeria Limited, be liquidated and its assets forfeited to the Federal Government.
ibo: N,' ịgbakwunye n' ikpe a, onyeikpe Idris nyere iwu ka e mechie ụlọ ọrụ Kalụ, 'Slok Nigeria Limited, ' ma were akụ ya nye gọọmenti etiti.

en: The senator, Slok Nigeria Limited and Udeh Udeogu, a former director of finance and accounts in Abia, were found complicit in the diversion.
ibo: Sinetọ a, 'Slok Nigeria Limited' na Udeh Udeọgụ , onye jibu ọkwa 'director of finance and accounts' n' Abịa bụ ndị gbakọrọ aka n' inweghara ego a.

en: Guardian
ibo: 'Guardian'

en: Zamfara NYSC gets new Coordinator
ibo: NYSC Zamfara nwere onye nchịkọta ọhụrụ

en: The National Youths Service Corps (NYSC) has appointed Alhaji Namalam Taura as new Coordinator of the Scheme in Zamfara state.
ibo: Òtù jikọtara ndị ji ótù afọ efe ala nna ha nke a kpọrọ 'The National Youth Service Corp (NYSC) na bekee ahọputala Alhaji Namalam Taura onye nchịkọta ọhụrụ amụma na Zamfara.

en: This is contained in a statement signed by the Public Relations Officer of the scheme in the state, Mr Philip Karayom and made available to newsmen in Tsafe on Monday.
ibo: Nke a dị n' okwu nke onye binyere aka na ya bụ onye nzisa ozi nke amụma a na steeti ahụ, Maazị Philip Karayom, ma mee ka ọ rute ndị nta akụkọ aka n' Tsafe n' ụbọchị Mọndee.

en: Karayom said Taura's appointment followed the retirement of the former Coordinator, Mr Dahunsi Muhammad.
ibo: Karayom kwuru na nhọpụta Taura bịara ka onye nchịkọta nọbu ya, Maazị Dahunsi Muhammad lara ezumike nka.

en: He said until his appointment,Taura was the Assistant Director, Corps Inspection and Monitoring at the state Secretariat of the scheme adding that the new Coordinator had since assumed duty.
ibo: Ọ kwuru na tupu ahọpụta ya, Taura bụbu 'Asistant Director, Corps Inspection and Monitoring' na seketeriet nke amụma ahụ kwuokwa na onye nchịkọta ọhụrụ ebidola ọrụ kamgbe.

en: Meanwhile, the state government has lauded the contribution of the scheme towards the development of the state.
ibo: Ka nke a na-aga n' ihu, gọọmenti steeti ahụ etoola amụma a maka mbọ ha na-agba n' iweta mmepe na steeti ahụ.

en: READ ALSO: NYSC registers 1,054 corps members in Abia
ibo: Gụkwuazị: NYSC denyere aha ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha 1,054 n' Abịa steeti.

en: Gov. Bello Matawalle stated this on Monday at the NYSC orientation camp, Tsafe while speaking at the swearing-in ceremony of the 2019 Batch C stream 2 corps members posted to the state.
ibo: Gov. Bello Matawalle kwuru nke a n ' ụbọchị Mọndee n' ebe nkụzi nnabata, Tsafe mgbe ọ na-ekwu okwu n' emume idu n' iyi ọrụ nke ógbè nke atọ (batch c) otu nke abụọ (stream 2) ndi ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha e zigara steeti ahụ n' afọ 2019.

en: Matawalle represented by the Secretary to the state government, Alhaji Bala Bello reiterated the state government's commitment to partner with the scheme for the development of various sectors of the state.
ibo: Matawalle, onye odeakwụkwọ nke steeti ahụ, Alhaji Baba Bello, nọchiri anya ya kwuputarakwa ọzọ mkpebi gọọmenti ahụ na ya na amụma ahụ ga-ejiko aka ọnụ iji mepee ngalaba dị iche iche na steeti ahụ.

en: He urged the corps members to be committed and face all camp activities with seriousness.
ibo: Ọ rịọrọ ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ka dị uchu ma were ihe niile ha na-eme ebe nnabata kpọrọ ihe.

en: He said that adequate security measures had been put in place by the state government in collaboration with the security agencies to ensure security of corps members.
ibo: O kwuru na gọọmenti steeti na ndị ọrụ nchekwa ejikọọla aka tụọ ezigbo atụmatụ iji hụ na ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha nwere ezi nchekwa

en: In his remarks, Taura said out of 1,000 corps members posted to the state, 840 reported in the camp.
ibo: N' okwu ya, Taura kwuru na n' ime 1,000 ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha e zitere na steeti a, 840 bịara n' ebe nkụzi nnabata.

en: News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reports that Magistrate Aisha Jibril administered the oath of allegiance to corps members deployed to the state.
ibo: 'News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) kwuru na Majie Aisha Jibril duru ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha e zigara steeti ahụ n' iyi ikwe nkwa nruwe isi.

en: 17 persons escape death in Anambra multiple crash
ibo: Mmadụ 17 gbanahụrụ ọnwụ n' ọtụtụ nkụkọ ụgbọala n' Anambra.

en: No fewer than 17 persons escaped death in a multiple crash involving three vehicles on the old Enugu-Onitsha expressway in Anambra.
ibo: Ọpekata mpe mmadụ 17 gbanahụrụ ọnwụ n' ọtụtụ nkụkọ metụtara ụgbọala atọ n' ụzọ awara awara ochie Enugu-Ọnịcha n' Anambra.

en: The accident occurred on the Nkpor/Umuoji stretch of the road.
ibo: Ihe mberede a mere n' ogologo ụzọ Nkpọ/Ụmụoji.

en: Mr Pascal Anigbo, the Public Enlightenment Officer of the Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) confirmed the crash.
ibo: Maazị Pascal Anịgbọgụ, onye mmepeanya ọha nke 'Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC)' kwuputara ihe nkụkọ a.

en: He said the vehicles included a red Mitsubishi bus with registration number JJT920ZW, a white Hummer bus without registration number and a truck marked KPE686XA.
ibo: Ọ sịrị na ụgbọala ndị ahụ gụnyere Misubishi bọsụ mmemme nwere akara ndebe JJT920ZW, Họma bọsụ ọcha n' enweghi akara ndebe na trọkụ a kara KPE686XA.

en: Anigbo attributed the cause of the accident to wrongful overtaking.
ibo: Anịgbọgụ sịrị na ọ bụ ụgbọala ịgbafe ibe ya n' ụzọ n' adịghị mma butere ihe mberede a.

en: He said 17 persons including 10 males and seven females were involved in the crash while seven persons were injured.
ibo: Ọ sịrị na mmadụ 17 nke gụnyere ụmụ nwoke 10 na ụmụ nwaanyị 7 ka nkụkọ a metụtara ebe mmadụ asaa meruru ahụ.

en: 'The Mitsubishi bus did wrongful overtaking and collided with an oncoming bus and the two buses collided with a truck.
ibo: Misubishi bọsụ mere ngafe n' adịghị mma wee kụọ ụgbọala na-abịa abịa bọsụ abụọ ahụ wee kụọ trọkụ.

en: 'The injured victims had been taken to Crown hospital Nkpor,' he said.
ibo: 'E bugaala ndị meruru ahụ na 'Crown Hospital' Nkpọ' o kwuru.

en: The FRSC officer also said efforts were on to recover the vehicles and valuables.
ibo: Onye ọrụ FRSC a kwukwara na a gbara mbọ ịnaghachi ụgbọala ndị ahụ na ihe ndị bara uru.

en: Betty Akeredolu: We'll not relent until women are treated fairly
ibo: Betty Akeredolu: Anyị agaghị ala azụ ruo mgbe ụmụ nwaanyị nwetara ezi mkpaso agwa.

en: The wife of Ondo State governor, Arabinrin Betty Anyanwu-Akeredolu, has vowed not to relent until women are given equal rights as their male counterparts.
ibo: Nwunye gọvanọ Ondo steeti, Arabinrin Betty Anyanwụ-Akeredolu, ekwela nkwa na ya agaghị ala azụ ruo mgbe e nyere ụmụ nwaanyị ikike ya na nke ndị ogbo ha ụmụ nwoke ha nhatanha.

en: Mrs Anyanwu-Akeredolu spoke on Wednesday during the 2nd summit of Forum for Women Officials of Ondo State and Female Appointees (FOWOSO) held at International Culture and Event Centre in Akure, the state capital.
ibo: Odoziakụ Anyanwụ-Akeredolu kwuru okwu n' ụbọchị Wenzidee na mmemme agba nke abụọ nke 'Summit of Forum for Women Officials of Ondo State and Female Appointees (FOWOSO) a chịkọbara n' 'International Culture and Event Centre' dị n' Akụrụ, isi obodo steeti ahụ.

en: 'We will not faint until we see women everywhere being treated with as much respect as their male counterparts.
ibo: 'Anyị agaghị ada mba ganye n' anyị àhù ụmụ nwaanyị n' ebe niile ka a na-akpaso ha agwa ka ụmụ nwoke ndị ogbo ha.

en: 'The pursuit of gender quality is definitely daunting, many rocks of stereotypes are particularly exerting, but when men join us, we are further strengthened to prevail quickly. But, whatever the case , we shall prevail,' she said.
ibo: Ịchụ nhatanha Okike na-enwe ihe nkụda ala doro anya, ọtụtụ echiche n' eseputa isi, mana ụmụ nwọke sonyere anyị, ọ na-abawanye anyị ume inwe mmeri ọsọ ọsọ. Mana n' ihe ọbụla, anyị ga-enwe mmeri, ' o kwuru.

en: She called for gender inclusiveness in all aspects of the socio-economic, saying that ' spectrum is still miles ahead. We know this and we are not going to relent.'
ibo: Ọ kpọrọ okwu maka njikọta Okike n' akụkụ niile nke mmekọrịta na akụnụba, na-ekwu na ụdịdị ihe dị iche iche ka n' ihu. Anyị ma nke a mana anyị agaghị ala azụ.

en: Anyanwu-Akeredolu, who is the founder of FOWOSO, noted that her motivation was not because she is a woman.
ibo: Anyanwụ-Akeredolu, onye bụ onye nchọpụta FOWOSO, kwuru na mkpalite ya abụghị na ya bụ nwaanyị.

en: She called for a society where continuous development was achieved and sustained.
ibo: Ọ kpọrọ okwu maka obodo ebe a ga-enwete mmepe ga adịgide ma bụrụ nke e jigidere.

en: 'We must come to the understanding that everyone, regardless of gender is needed for sustainable development.
ibo: 'Anyị ga-enweriri nghọta na onye ọbụla, n' agbanyeghi Okike ka a chọrọ maka ijide mmepe.

en: 'I have dedicated my life to driving gender equality, not because I love female folk more ,but because I seek the growth and advancement of humanity as a whole.
ibo: 'Etinyela m ndụ m ịchụ Okike ịha nhatanha, ọ bụghị makana m hụrụ ndị ụmụ nwaanyị n' anya karịa, ma makana achọrọ m otuto na ọganihu nke ndị mmadụ niile.

en: 'I am very delighted to know that I have infected every FOWOSO member with this positive virus that strives for gender equality in every aspect of our socio-economic spectrum,' she explained.
ibo: 'Obi dị m ụtọ ịma na m ebunyela onye ọbụla so na FOWOSO nje dị mma nke ịchụ nhatanha Okike n' akụkụ ọbụla nke ụdịdị mmekọrịta na akụnụba anyị.,' ọ kọwara.

en: Governor Oluwarotimi Akeredolu described as unquantifiable the training and empowerment of women in the state by FOWOSO.
ibo: Gọvanọ Oluwarotimi Akeredolu kọwara ọzụzụ na agbamume FOWOSO nyere ụmụ nwaanyị nọ na steeti ahụ dị ka ihe n' enweghi atụ.

en: He said the activities of the forum, particularly in the areas of training and empowerment of women across the 18 local government areas, had produced many entrepreneurs.
ibo: Ọ sịrị na ọrụ ndị otu a, ọ kachasị n' ebe ọzụzụ na agbamume nke ụmụ nwaanyị n' okpuru ọchịchị 18 steeti ahụ gba gburugburu, azụpụtala ọtụtụ entaprịniọ.

en: Speaking on the theme of the summit; 'Prioritising Women's Health and Well Being In Nigeria', Akeredolu said his administration had prioritised the well-being of women in the state.
ibo: N' okwu ya n' isi okwu ọgbakọ ahụ 'Ịhazi ahụ ike na ọdị mma ụmụ nwaanyị na Naijiria,' Akeredolu sịrị na ọchịchị ya ahaziela ọdị mma ụmụ nwaanyị n' steeti a.

en: He added: 'We have prioritised women health and well-being in Ondo State and that was what led to the Abiyamo Maternal and Child Health Scheme which we launched on Wednesday. All you need to access the free health care for pregnant women is your residency cards. Every child under 5 is entitled to free health care in Ondo State.'
ibo: Ọ gbakwunyere: 'Anyị ahaziela ahụ ike na ọdị mma ụmụ nwaanyị n' Ondo steeti nke butere amụma ahụ ike nne nwa na nwa nke Abiyamo nke e guzo were ụbọchị Wenzidee. Ihe I kwesiri iji wee nweta nleta ahụ ike ụmụ nwaanyị dị ime a n' efu bụ akwụkwọ ebe obibi gị. Nwa ọbụla n' erughi afọ ise nwere ohere nleta ahụ ike n' efu a n' Ondo steeti. '

en: 'Let me commend the efforts of the founder for this laudable initiative geared towards the development of womenfolk in Ondo State,' Akeredolu stated.
ibo: 'Ka m too mbọ onye nchọpụta atụmatụ a kwesiri otito a haziri maka mmepe nke ụmụ nwaanyị n' Ondo steeti,' Akeredolu kwuru.

en: The Chairman of 2nd FOWOSO Planning Committee, Mrs Mercy Femi-Idris, described the forum as significant to health and welfare of women, adding that it was about nurturing and empowering female folks.
ibo: Onyeisi Kọmitii chịkọbara FOWOSO nke abụọ, Odoziakụ Mercy Femi-Idris, kọwara otu ahụ dịka ihe dị mkpa nyere ahụ ike na ọdị mma nke ụmụ nwaanyị, gbakwunye kwuo na ọ bụ ịzụlite na ịgba ume nke ụmụ nwaanyị.

en: Prof. Modupe Adelabu, the Chairman of the occasion, noted that FOWOSO had given women voice of recognition.
ibo: Ọkammụta Module Adelabụ , onyeisi oche nke emume, kwuru na FOWOSO enyela ụmụ nwaanyị ọnụ okwu.

en: Adelabu, the former director governor of Ekiti State, said the forum had eliminated discrimination against women, noting that FOWOSO was a fun-making gathering but a life-impacful organisation.
ibo: Adelabụ, jibu ọkwa daịrector gọvanọ nke Ekiti steeti, sịrị na otu a ewepụla ịkpa oke megide ụmụ nwaanyị, na-ekwu na FOWOSO bụ ọgbakọ inwe obi ụtọ ma bụrụ otu na-emetụta ndụ.

en: Mrs Bisi Fayemi, the wife of Ekiti State governor, Dr Kayode Fayemi and Mrs Kafayat Oyetola, the wife of Osun State governor attended the summit.
ibo: Odoziakụ Bisi Fayemi, nwunye gọvanọ nke Ekiti steeti, Dọkịta Kayode Fayemi, na Odoziakụ Kafayat Oyetola, nwunye gọvanọ Osun steeti bịara ọgbakọ a.

en: How to boost cyber security – experts
ibo: Otu a ga-esi kwalite nchekwa saba - ndị ọkachamara

en: Stakeholders the Nigerian cyber security space under the aegis of the Information Security Society of Africa-Nigeria (ISSAN) have called for collaborations in boosting cyber security in the country.
ibo: Ndị nchekwa saịba metụtara na Naijiria a na-akpọ 'Nigerian cyber security space' site na nkwado Information Security Society of Africa-Nigeria (ISSAN) akpọ latest okwu ijikọ aka wee kwalite nchekwa saịba n' ala a.

en: They made the call while speaking at a Cyber Security Workshop Themed: 'DDoS Evolution – Staying Protected' organised by ISSAN in collaboration with 21st Century Technologies Limited in Lagos.
ibo: Ha kpọrọ okwu a ka ha na-ekwu okwu n' ọmụmụihe nchekwa saịba nke isiokwu ya bụ 'DDoS Evolution - Staying Protected' nke ISSAN chịkọbara site na njikọ aka nke '21st century Technologies Limited' na Legosi.

en: While welcoming stakeholders at the Workshop, President of ISSAN, Dr. David Isiavwe, decried the worsening state of cyber security in the country.
ibo: Ka ọ na-abata ndị o metụtara n' ọmụmụihe a, onyeisi ISSAN, Dọkịta David Isiavwe, katọrọ nkwanye njọ ọnọdụ nchekwa saịba n' ala a.

en: He said, 'Those who watch the cyber space closely, will all agree that there is a lot of happenings each and every day.
ibo: Ọ sịrị, 'Ndị tinyere uche na nchekwa mbara saịba nke ọma ga-ekwenye na ọtụtụ ihe na-eme kwa ụbọchị ọbụla.

en: New forms of attacks are being contrived and implemented by the bad guys, and all they need is one successful attempt.
ibo: Ndị ntorobịa ọjọọ na-echepụta ma na-emejuputa ụzọ mwakpo ọhụrụ, sọ ihe chọrọ otu nnwale gara nke ọma.

en: We hear of all the various attacks both on individuals and companies alike.
ibo: Anyị na-anụ maka ọtụtụ mwakpo ma na ndị mmadụ ma n' ụlọ ọrụ.

en: Indeed, even the cyber security gatekeepers are not spared.
ibo: N' ezie, ọbụrụgodu ndị na-echekwa ọnụ ụzọ nchekwa saịba anaghị ije a.

en: And huge sums of money are at risk each time there is a successful attack.'
ibo: Mana ọkpụrụkpụ ọnụ ego na-anọ n' ihe egwu mgbe ọbụla e nwere mwakpo gara nke ọma. '

en: Dr. Isiavwe who is also the Group Head Operations & Technology, Ecobank Nigeria Limited, further lamented the fact that everyone and every institution was susceptible to these attacks as social engineering attack is unrelenting.
ibo: Dọkịta Isiavwe onye bụkwu 'Group Head Operations & Technology, Ecobank Nigeria Limited,' gara n' ihu kpesa na n' ezioku na ọnye ọbụla na emumewu ọbụla ga-adanyenwu na mwakpo ndị a dịka injinia mwakpo mmekọrịta anaghị ala azụ.

en: He said data based manipulation-insiders and outsiders is on the rise, attack on card data and card processing technology infrastructure via rogue IT infrastructure, spear phishing attack and combination of different methodologies were rampant.
ibo: Ọ sị na njikwa ndị ọnọnime na ndị mbịarambịa dabere na data na-ebili, mwakpo na kaadị data na kaadị nhazi akụrụngwa teknọlọjị site na akụrụngwa 'IT' aghara, mwakpo 'spear phishing' na mgwakota usoro dị iche iche jụrụ ebe niile.

en: He therefore called on all stakeholders to be proactive, create customer awareness activities, continuous and automated monitoring of systems and infrastructure, employment of Artifucial intelligence and Machine Learning as well as robotics and data analytics.
ibo: Ya mere, ọ gwara ndị ọ gbasara ka ha mee ihe ndị ga-eme ka ndị ahịa mata, usoro ilebara anya nganihu na keaka akaghị na akụrụngwa, iji ọgụgụ isi aka mere na igwe ọmụmụ nakwa rọbọtiks na nchịkọta data.

en: He also called for collaborations among stakeholders.
ibo: Ọ kpọrọkwara okwu maka ịrụkọ ọrụ n' etiti ndị ọ gbasara.

en: Speaking on the theme of the workshop in a keynote address, Long Lee Shih – DDoS Security Expert, Nexusguard Ltd, also explained how individuals and organisations could avoid being victims of cyber attacks, including Origin Protection (OP) for large networks, among others.
ibo: N' ikwu banyere isiokwu nke ọmụmụ ihe a n' okwu bụ isi, Long Lee Shih-- ọkachamara DDoS, 'Nexusguard Ltd' kọwa kwara ka ndị mmadụ n' otu n' otu na ụlọ ọrụ ga-esi egbochi ịdaba n' ọnyá mwakpo saịba, tinyekwara 'Origin Protection' (OP) maka nnukwu netwọk, na ndị ọzọ.

en: His keynote address was followed by a robust plenary session that included Dr Wale Obadare, MD/COO, Digital Encode Ltd; Long Lee Shih, Ighoakpo Eduje, Chief Information Security Officer, Heritage Bank Ltd; Igboa Abumere, Chief Information Security Officer, Stanbic IBTC Bank; Bharat Soni, Chief Information Security Officer, Guaranty Trust Bank Plc and Dr. David Isiavwe.
ibo: Ka okwu ya bụ okwu bụ isi gasịrị ọgbakọ mmadụ niile sochiri ya nke nọ ya gụnyere Dọkịta Wale Obadare, 'MD/COO, Digital Encode Ltd;' Long Lee Shih, Ighoakpo Eduje, onyeisi ọrụ ọmụma chekwa, Stanbic I THINK Bank; Bharat Soni, onyeisi ọrụ ọmụma nchekwa, Guaranty Trust Bank na Dọkịta David Isiavwe.

en: Hit-and-run driver kills woman in Awka
ibo: Ọkwọ ụgbọala na-akụ mmadụ gbawara ọsọ gburu otu nwaanyị n' Ọka.

en: A yet to be identified woman was on Sunday killed by a hit-and-run driver in Awka.
ibo: Ọkwọ ụgbọala na-akụ mmadụ gbawara gburu otu nwaanyị a mabeghi onye ọ bụ n' Ọka ụbọchị ụka.

en: The accident occurred at about 11:05pm at Regina Caeli Junction on the Enugu-Onitsha expressway.
ibo: Ihe mberede okporo ụzọ a mere n' ihe dịka 11:50pm n' ụzọ mkpị Regina Caeli n' ụzọ awara awara Enugu-Ọnịcha.

en: According to Mr Andrew Kumapayi, the Sector Commander of the Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) in Anambra, the accident left the woman dead instantly.
ibo: Dị ka Maazị Andrew Kumapayi, onyeisi 'Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC)' nke mpaghara Anambra a, siri kwu ihe mberede a gburu nwaanyị a ozugbo.

en: Kumapayi said the corpse had been deposited at the Chukwuemeka Odumegwu Ojukwu University Teaching Hospital morgue, Awka.
ibo: Kumapayi sịrị na e dewela ozu ya n' ebe nchekwa ozu nke Chukwuemeka Odumegwu Ojukwu University Teaching Hospital, Ọka.

en: The sector commander reiterated the call for pedestrians to be careful on the road, especially during festive periods, because of increased vehicular movement.
ibo: Onyeisi mpaghara a kpọkwara ndị ji ụkwụ aga okwu ọzọ ka kpachara anya n' ụzọ, ọ kachasị n' oge mmemme, maka na ngagharị ụgbọala n' amụbanye.

en: 'My advice to road users especially pedestrians during this season is to be extra careful when crossing the road.
ibo: 'Ndụmọdụ nwere inye ndị na-aga n' ụzọ ọ kachasị ndị ji ụkwụ bụ ka ha kpachara anya nke ọma ma ha na-agafe ụzọ.

en: 'They should endeavour to use the pedestrian bridge provided for them if any, and if there is none, they should look left, right and left again to make sure that the road is free before crossing.
ibo: 'Ha kwesiri ịgbalị na-aga n' akwa a rụrụ ndị ji ụkwụ ma ọ bụrụ n' enwere, ma ọ bụrụ na e nweghị, ha kwesiri ile anya n' aka ekpe, aka nri nakwa aka ekpe ọzọ iji hụ na ụzọ tọgbọ nkịtị tupu ha gafere.

en: 'Let them wear reflective clothes when walking in the night so that they can be seen by oncoming vehicles,' he said.
ibo: 'Ka ha yiri ákwà na-egbuke egbuke ma na-aga n' abalị ka ụgbọala na-abịa abịa were na-ahụ ha,' o kwuru.

en: What Onitsha fire tells us about the petrol tankers from hell [Pulse Opinion]
ibo: Ihe ọkụ Ọnịcha gwara anyị banyere tanka petrolu si ọkụ mmụọ [echiche 'Pulse']

en: The Onitsha fire accident was totally avoidable. Yet again, Nigeria has killed citizens whose only crime was hustling in a country that never got their backs.
ibo: Ọkụ mberede Ọnịcha dị mgbochi kpamkpam. Mana ọzọkwa, Nigeria egbuola ụmụ amadị ndị sọ ihe ọjọọ ha mere bụ na ha na-agba mbọ n' ala na enweghi nchekwa nyere ha.

en: Onitsha, the Anambra state capital, is mourning. And all of Nigeria with it.
ibo: Ọnịcha, isi obodo Anambra, na-eri ụjụ. Nigeria niile sonyere ya.

en: On Wednesday, October 16, 2019, a petrol laden tanker rammed into buildings in an Onitsha market, spilled its contents in the neigborhood and sparked a fire that ravaged buildings, consumed goods worth millions of Naira and ended lives.
ibo: N' ụbọchị Wenzidee, Ọktoba 16, 2019, tanka petrolu juru suru ụlọ n' ahịa Ọnịcha, kwafuo ihe ọ bu na gburugburu ahụ ma nwuru ọkụ mebiri ọtụtụ ụlọ, gbarie ngwa ahịa ruru ọtụtụ nde naịra ma bibie ọtụtụ ndụ.

en: Onitsha was a ball of fire for hours and no one lifted a finger. The city is still counting its losses.
ibo: Ọnịcha bụ sọ ogidi ọkụ ọtụtụ awa ma ọ nweghi onye welitere aka. Obodo a ka na-agụkọ ihe o tụfuru.

en: The casualty figures from the incident are still hazy at the time of writing, but it has been confirmed that a mother and her child were among the dead;
ibo: Ọnụ Ọgụgụ ndị ihe a metụtara edochaghị anya n' oge a na-ede ihe a, mana o doola anya na nne na nwa ya so na ndị nwụrụ anwụ;

en: With the fire searing through their skins and leaving them locked in each other's arms until the very end.
ibo: Ọkụ gbara ha agba agba n' ahụ, ebe ọkụ kpọchiri ha n' ogwe aka onwe ha ruo n' ọnwụ.

en: The fire incident in Onitsha yesterday is sad and regrettable. I am profoundly touched by the sight of the charred remains of an innocent mother and her child, who are victims of this tragedy,' said President Muhammadu Buhari.
ibo: 'Ọkụ gbara n' Ọnịcha ụnyaahụ dị mwute. Ozu nne na nwa ọkụ gbapịrị n' enweghị ihe ọjọọ ha mere, bụ ndị ọdachi a metụrụ, wutere m nke ukwuu,' President Muhammadu Buhari kwuru.

en: Former Nigeria Vice President and presidential candidate in the 2019 elections, Alhaji Atiku Abubakar said: 'We've had many preventable fuel tanker tragedies.
ibo: Onye bụbu osote onye isi ala Naịjiria nakwa onye zọrọ ọkwa onye isi ala na ntụli aka 2019, Alhaji Atiku Abubakar kwuru: 'Anyị enwela ọtụtụ ọdachi tanka mmanụ ụgbọala dị mgbochi.

en: I received with sadness, reports of a tanker explosion in Onitsha, Anambra State, which caused massive destruction to lives and properties in Ochanja Market area.
ibo: Eji m obi mwute nata akụkọ mgbawa tanka n' Ọnịcha, Anambra Steeti, nke butere nnukwu mbibi nyere ndụ na akụ n' mpaghara ahịa Ọchanja.

en: My prayers and thoughts are with the families of the affected.'
ibo: Ekpere na echiche m nọnyere ezinaụlọ ndị o metụtara.'

en: TV personality Ebuka Obi-Uchendu said: 'Last night was a lot.
ibo: Onye a ma ama na 'TV' Ebuka Obi-Uche sịrị: 'Abalị ụnyaahụ dị ukwuu.

en: We really are on our own in this country.
ibo: Anyị nọrọ nnọọ onwe anyị n' obodo a.

en: Those images from Onitsha are still so heartbreaking.
ibo: Oyiyi ndị ahụ si Ọnịcha ka Na-agbawa obi.

en: May the departed Rest In Peace.'
ibo: Ka mkpụrụ obi ndị nwụrụ anwụ zuru ike n' udo.

en: One of the biggest takeaways from the tragedy is that the fire raged for hours with no fire service truck anywhere near the scene of the inferno.
ibo: Otu ihe kasị wee ju anya n' ọdachi a bụ na ọkụ gbara ọtụtụ awa mana onweghi trọkụ ndị ọrụ mgbanyụ ọkụ no nso n' akụkụ ebe ọkụ ọgbụgba a.

en: And like Atiku mentioned, this is one of several petrol tanker accidents in recent times across Nigeria that has led to loss of lives.
ibo: Ma dị ka Atiku kwuru, nke a bụ otu n' ime ọtụtụ mberede tanka petrolu na nso a butere ntufu ọtụtụ ndụ na Naijiria gba gburugburu.

en: Apart from the Otedola bridge fire incident of June 2018 in Lagos that led to loss of lives and the burning of cars, there have been several instances where a petrol laden tanker, flouting all known traffic laws in the land, goes ahead to inflict pain and misery on innocent families and ordinary Nigerians.
ibo: E wezụga ọkụ ọgbụgba àkwà mmiri Otedola nke Juun 2018na Legosi nke butere ntufu ọtụtụ ndụ na ọkụ ịgba ụfọdụ ụgbọala, enwere ọmụma atụ ụfọdụ ebe tanka petrolu juru, dara iwu okporo ụzọ niile n' ala anyị, gara n' ihu weta ụfụ na nhụjuanya nye ezinaụlọ enweghị ihe ọjọọ ha mere na ndị Naịjirịa nkịtị.

en: In Lagos where this writer resides, petrol tanker and articulated truck drivers derive immense joy from intimidating other road users, offloading their containers on busy roads and obstructing free flow of traffic.
ibo: Na Legosi ebe odee a bi, tanka petrolu na ndị na-anya ọkara trọkụ na-enwe nnukwu añurị n' iwakpo ndị ọzọ na-aga n' ụzọ anya, na-ebutu ihe akpati ha bu n' ụzọ enweghị ohere na igbochi ụzọ ịga nke ọma.

en: Articulated trucks and petrol tankers have been a menace in Nigeria for as long as anyone can remember and the regulatory agencies or authorities have largely looked the other way unperturbed for decades.
ibo: Ọkara trọkụ na tanka petrolu abụrụla nsogbu na Naijiria kamgbe dịka onye ọbụla nwere ike icheta mana ndị ụlọ ọrụ ma ọ bụ ikike usoro iwu nefuru anya n' ebe ọdị ukwuu.

en: Until the next disaster.
ibo: Ka ọ dị oge ọdachi ọzọ.

en: 'I call on the Ministry of Transport, the Federal Road Safety Commission and other stakeholders to urgently address the issue of safety standards in Nigeria, with a view to stemming the frequency of these tragedies.
ibo: 'Ana m akpọ ministri njem,' Federal Road Safety Commission' na ndị ọzọ ọ gbasara ka ha gbazie ụkpụrụ nchekwa na Naijiria, n' ụzọ iji belata ọdachi na-adapụta kwa mgbe.

en: May the souls of the dead rest in peace Amen,' President Buhari said, without stating how he will make sure the agencies he mentioned sanitize our roads and put the killer truck drivers in check.
ibo: Ka mkpụrụ obi ndị nwụrụ anwụ zuru ike n' udo Amen, ' Onyeisi ala Buhari kwuru, n' ekwughi ka ọ ga-esi mee ka ndị ụlọ ọrụ ndị ọ kpọrọ aha ga-esi dozie ụzọ anyị ma kwụsị ndị ogbu mmadụ na-anya trọkụ.

en: Without saying how he'll lead the charge in enforcing compliance.
ibo: N' ekwughi ka o siri dị njikere ime ka e huwe isi.

en: It is also a shame that a state as rich as Anambra has no functioning fire service department or emergency response units; and that when tragedy struck, Governor Willie Obiano was not on the ground to provide succour.
ibo: Ọ bụkwuazị ihe ihere na steeti bụ ọgaranya ka Anambra enweghi ngalaba ọrụ ọkụ na-arụ ọrụ ma ọ bụ ngalaba gbata gbata; na mgbe ọdachi dapụtara, Gọvanọ Willie Obiano anọghị ya inweta enyemaka.

en: At the risk of sounding like a broken record, the Onitsha inferno was completely avoidable. Yet again, we have lost lives to poor governance across all tiers. Writer Ayo Sogunro was right after all when he said 'everything in Nigeria is going to kill you.'
ibo: N' ịkọ akụkọ iberibe, ọkụ ọgbụgba Ọnịcha kwesiri mgbochi kpamkpam. Ma ọzọ kwa, anyị etufuola ndụ n' ihi amaghị achị n' ogo ọchịchị niile. Ọdee Ayo Sogunro kwuru ezi okwu n' ezie mgbe o kwuru 'ihe ọbụla na Naijiria na-ga igbu gị.'

en: TRAFFIC CONTROL IN FESTIVE SEASON, TRANSPORT MINISTRY LAUNCH ATMA SPECIAL MARSHAL VESTS
ibo: ỊGBAZI OKPORO ỤZỌ N' OGE EMUME, MINISTRI NJEM EGUZOWE 'ATMA SPECIAL MARSHAL VEST'

en: By Chukwuka Ugokwe /Ifunanya Ajukwu :
ibo: Nke si n' aka Chukwuka Ugokwe/Ifunanya Ajukwu:

en: Awka, Dec. 9, 2019 (MOI) Anambra State Commissioner for Transport, Dr Christian Madubuko has asked officers of the Anambra Traffic Control Agency(ATMA) and other stakeholders in the sector to intensify operations aimed at ensuring safety on the roads.
ibo: Ọka, Disemba 9, 2019 (MOI) Komishọna njem n' Anambra Steeti, Dọkịta Christian Madubuko, agwala ndị ọrụ 'Anambra Traffic Control Agency (ATMA)' na ndị ọzọ ọ gbasara na mpaghara a ka ha mubawanye arụmọrụ n' ịhụ na e nwere nchekwa n' ụzọ.

en: According to him, there is need for all traffic control agencies in the state to work together this festive period to facilitate free vehicular
ibo: Dị ka o si kwuo, ọ dị mkpa na ndị ọrụ mgbazi okporo niile na steeti a ịrụkọ ọrụ ọnụ n' oge emume a iji kwalite ụgbọala ịga nke ọma.

en: In a speech during the 2019 Drivers Seminar and Launch of ATMA Marshal Vests, held at the agency's office, at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat, Awka, the commissioner called on officers to be vigilant and more responsive to their roles as traffic managers.
ibo: N' okwu ya n' oge nzukọ ọmụmụ ihe ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala n' afọ 2019 na nguzo 'ATMA Marshal Vest, ' nke a chịkọbara n' ụlọ ọrụ ndị otu a, na Jerome Udeoji seketeriet, Ọka, onye Komishọna gwara ndị ọrụ ka ha mụrụ anya ma nabata ọrụ ha dịka ndị nchịkwa okporo ụzọ.

en: Dr Madubuko added that volunteers were needed to enlist into newly inaugurated ATMA Special Marshals to complement effort of regular officers for effective traffic control, especially at gridlock-prone points.
ibo: Dọkịta Madubuko gbakwunyere na a chọrọ ndị ga-eweputa onwe ha ịbanye n' 'ATMA SPECIAL Marshal' e guzobere ọhụrụ iji mejuo mbọ ndị ọrụ nọ ya mbe niile maka mgbazi okporo ụzọ dị irè, ọkachasị n' ebe ndị na-enwekarị mkpọchi.

en: He praised the dedication to duty by one of officers of the agency posted to Aroma Junction, Awka, Mr Obinna Ejeagwu, who was honoured in company of other officers during the event.
ibo: O toro nhara onwe nye n'ọrụ nke otu onye n' ime ndị ọrụ otu ahụ e tinyere n' ụzọ mkpị Aroma, Ọka, Maazị Obinna Ejeagwu, onye e tụnyere n' etiti ndị ọrụ ndị ọzọ n' ime emume a.

en: Dr Madubuko noted that as helmsman in the ministry, he often moved around to monitor the performance of officers at their various duty posts to assess their level of commitment.
ibo: Dọkịta Madubuko kwuru na dị ka onye no n' isi na ministri ahụ, ọ na-agagharị mgbe ụfọdụ ileba anya n' arụmọrụ ndị ọrụ n' ebe dị iche iche ha na-arụ ọrụ iji itule ogo agbam mbọ ha.

en: Managing Director/Chief Executive Officer of ATMA, Mr Pat Obiefuna, described the theme of the seminar: 'Drive Right And Save Time' , as apt, especially at this period of the year.
ibo: Daịretọ nchịkwa /onyeisi ọrụ nke ATMA, Maazị Pat Obiefuna, kọwara isi okwu nke nzukọ ọmụmụ ihe: 'Nya nke ọma ma Dewe Oge' dị ka ihe dabara adaba, ọkachasị n' oge dị otú a n' afọ.

en: He emphasised the readiness of the agency to partner with relevant stakeholders in the transport sector to curb challenge of road crashes often caused by drivers.
ibo: Ọ kwusiri ike ịdị nkwadebe ndị otu a na ndị dị iche iche ọ gbasara na ngalaba njem ịrụkọ ọrụ ọnụ iji belata ihe iche aka mgba nke nkụkụ ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala na-ebute mgbe ụfọdụ.

en: The ATMA boss commended Gov. Obiano for installing traffic control lights to assist in easing off traffic jams, stressing that road crashes could be avoided by drivers, who obey signs.
ibo: Onyeisi ndị ATMA toro Gọvanọ Willie Obiano maka iwunye ọkụ na-agbazi okporo ụzọ iji nye aka wezụga okporo ụzọ agaghị aga, na-ekwukwa na ọkwọ ụgbọala na-ehuewere mgbaàmà isi nwere ike ịgbalahụ nkụkọ n' ụzọ.

en: Assistant Corps Commander, Ike Egwuokike, who represented the State Sector Commander of the Federal Roads Safety Corps (FRSC), Mr Andrew Kumakpayi, called on motorists to undergo training at approved Driving Schools before plying the road.
ibo: Onye enyemaka onyeisi ndị agha, Ike Egwuokike, onye nọchiri anya onyeisi 'Federal Road Safety Commission' nke mpaghara Anambra steeti, Maazị Andrew Kumakpayi, rịọrọ ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala ka ha na-enweta ọzụzụ n' ebe a nabatara na-akụzi ịnya ụgbọala tupu ha agbawa n' ụzọ.

en: He enjoined them to present their vehicles for routine checks and abide by traffic rules and regulations to ensure safety on 'the Wheels'.
ibo: Ọ gwara ha ka ba gosi ụgbọala ha maka usoro ileru anya ma rubere iwu na-achị okporo ụzọ isi iji mee ka nchekwa dị n' okporo ụzọ.

en: In a goodwill address, the State Chief Vehicle Inspection Officer (VIO), Mr Emenike Atuegbunam, assured of readiness of his officers to contribute their quota toward guaranteeing accident-free Yuletide.
ibo: N' okwu ekele, onyeisi 'Vehicle Inspection Officer (VIO), ' Maazị Emenike Atụegbunam, kwere nkwa na ndị ọrụ ya dị njikere ịtụnye ụtụ nke ha iji hụ na enweghi ihe mberede okporo ụzọ n' ekeresimesi a.

en: He added that to achieve the objective of the event, motorists must update their vehicle documents, fix their vehicles to be roadworthy and obey all traffic rules. (MOI)
ibo: Ọ gbakwunyere na iji nweta ebumnuche emume a, ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala ga-enweriri akwụkwọ ụgbọala zuru ọkè, ruzie ụgbọala ha ka o kwesi ịgba n' ụzọ ma rubere iwu okporo ụzọ niile isi.

en: Former players of Sunshine Stars, Sunshine Queens, Rising Stars and Rising Queens on Tuesday in Akure, Ondo State, disrupted the training session of Sunshine Stars FC over the non-payment of their sign-on fees.
ibo: Ndị gbagburu 'Sunshine Stars', 'Sunshine Queens', 'Rising Stars' na 'Rising Queens' bọọlụ nọrọ n' ụbọchị Tuzdee n' Akure, Ondo Steeti, kpasa ọzụzụ egwuregwu nke òtù egwuregwu 'Sunshine Stars FC' n' ihi akwụghị ha ụgwọ ha kwekọrịtara.

en: The ex-players chased members of the team away from the Ondo State Sports Complex, Akure.
ibo: Ndị a gbagburu ha bọọlụ chụpụrụ ndị òtù egwuregwu a n' ama egwuregwu nke Ondo Steeti, Akure.

en: Former Sunshine Queens player, Esther Michael, told journalists that she got injured while playing for the club but was abandoned to her fate.
ibo: Onye gbagburu 'Sunshine Queens' bọọlụ, Esther Michael, gwara ndị nta akụkọ na ya nwere ihe mmeru ahụ ka ya na-agbara òtù egwuregwu a bọọlụ mana ha gbahapụrụ ya.

en: Michael added that she had remained without a job since sustaining a career-threatening injury five years ago while playing for the club.
ibo: Michael gbakwunyere na ya nọrọ n' enweghị ọrụ kamgbe o nwetara mmeru ahụ a na-echere ọrụ ya aka mgba afọ ise gara aga ka ya na-agbara òtù egwuregwu a bọọlụ.

en: She disclosed that no form of help came from the management of the Ondo State Football Agency since that period.
ibo: O kwuputara na onweghi ụdị enyemaka ọbụla si n' aka ndị nlekọta egwuregwu bọọlụ Ondo Steeti kamgbe ahụ.

en: She said, 'For almost five years after I was injured and spent my entire earnings on treating myself, I have had no job.
ibo: O kwuru, 'N' ihe dịka afọ ise m meruchara ahụ ma mefusie ego niile m nwetara n' ịgwọ onwe m, enweghị m ọrụ.

en: 'We are therefore appealing to Ondo State Government to help us out.
ibo: 'Ya mere anyị na-arịọ gọọmenti Ondo Steeti ka ha nyere anyị aka.

en: 'I played almost five years for this team, the injury I had, government and management didn't help me. So, they should pay us our money.'
ibo: Agbara m òtù a bọọlụ ihe dịka afọ ise, mmeru ahụ m nwetara, gọọmenti na ndị nlekọta enyeghiri m aka. Ya bụ, ha kwụọ anyị ego anyị. '

en: Former Sunshine Stars player, James Moses, said government should honour the agreement it entered into with the players and pay them their sign-on fees.
ibo: Onye gbagburu 'Sunshine Stars' bọọlụ, James Moses, kwuru na gọọmenti kwesiri ịsọpụrụ nkwekọrịta ha na ndị ọgba bọọlụ nwere ma kwụọ ha ụgwọ nkwekọrịta ha.

en: Moses, fondly called 'Okomu' in his playing days by fans, said the love they had for the team had prevented them from taking legal action against the management.
ibo: Moses, onye ọ na-amasị ndị ofufe ya ịkpọ 'Okomu' mgbe ọ na-agba bọọlụ, kwuru na ịhụnanya ha nwere banyere òtù a egbochiela ha ibu amụma ikpe megide ndị nlekọta òtù a.

en: He said, 'The state has been owing us sign-on fees for long and we have been begging for them to pay us.
ibo: O kwuru, ' O teela aka Steeti jiwara anyị ụgwọ nkwekọrịta mana anyị na-arịọ ha ka ha kwụọ anyị ụgwọ.

en: 'Sunshine was my first club, I love Sunshine so much. I want them to pay us our money that is due to us.
ibo: 'Sunshine bụ òtù egwuregwu mbụ m, ahụrụ' Sunshine' ya n' anya nke ukwuu. Achọrọ m ka ha kwụọ anyị ego ruru anyị.

en: 'We are calling on the state governor to help us because some of us have families to take care of.'
ibo: Anyị na-akpọkwu gọvanọ steeti a ka ọ nyere anyị aka makana ụfọdụ n'ime anyị nwere ezinụlọ anyị ga-eleta anya.

en: In his reaction, Tajudeen Akinyemi, Chairman, Ondo State Football Agency, said the previous government agreed to pay the money in 15 instalments but was only able to offset eight.
ibo: N' okwu ya, Tajudeen Akinyemi, onyeisi, ụlọ ozi egwuregwu bọọlụ Steeti Ondo, kwuru na gọvanọ pụrụ apụ kwetara ịkwụ ego ahụ ịchafụ ịchafụ ụzọ 15 mana ọ bụ ụzọ asatọ ka o nwere ike kwụọ.

en: Akinyemi said the file for the remaining seven months had been sent to the Head of Service, who had raised the issue with the governor of the state.
ibo: Akinyemi kwuru na e zigarala onyeisi ọrụ, onye gwarala gọvanọ steeti maka okwu a, faịlị ọnwa asaa fọrọ afọ

en: He promised that government would accelerate action on the file to ensure that the former players were paid.
ibo: O kwere nkwa na gọọmenti ga-eme ngwa ngwa na faịlị ahụ iji hụ na a kwụrụ ndị a gbagburu bọọlụ ụgwọ.

en: Ex-Ondo Governor, Mimiko, Loses Mother
ibo: Nne onye jiburu ọkwa gọvanọ Ondo steeti, Mimiko, nwụrụ.

en: The 88-year-old woman, Muyinat Mimiko, died in Ondo following a brief illness on Friday.
ibo: Nwaanyị a dị iri afọ asatọ na asatọ, Muyinat Mimiko, nwụrụ n' Ondo ka ọ rịachara obere ọrịa na Fraịdee.

en: The mother of a former governor of Ondo State, Olusegun Mimiko, has died.
ibo: Nne onye jiburu ọkwa gọvanọ nke Ondo Steeti, Olusegun Mimiko, anwụọla.

en: The 88-year-old woman, Muyinat Mimiko, died in Ondo following a brief illness on Friday.
ibo: Nwaanyị a dị iri afọ asatọ na asatọ, Muyinat Mimiko, nwụrụ n' Ondo ka ọ rịachara obere ọrịa na Fraịdee.

en: An aide to the former governor, Paul Akinduro, confirmed the incident on Saturday.
ibo: Onye enyemaka aka chịburu Ondo Steeti, Paul Akinduro, kwuru ihe a merenụ na Satọdee.

en: He said, 'Mama Muinat Mosekola Mimiko fondly called 'Iye Ruka' has gone to rest. We will miss her dearly.'
ibo: O kwuru, 'Mama Muyinat Mosekola Mimiko onye a na-akpọ 'Iye Ruka' anaala na ndokwa. Anyị ga-akwa ngaramara ya nke ukwuu.'

en: Mimiko was a two-term governor of Ondo State.
ibo: Mimiko bụụrụ gọvanọ Ondo steeti ugboro abụọ.

en: EXCLUSIVE: Davido: 'No Money Osun State Can Make In 40 Years That My Dad Hasn't Made'
ibo: SỌỌSỌ: Davido: 'Onweghi ego Osun Steeti nwere ike inweta n' afọ iri anọ nke aka m enwetabeghi.'

en: *Why I stayed away from Nigeria for 8 months
ibo: 'Ihe mere n' anọghị m na Naijiria ọnwa asatọ.'

en: Nigerian singer David Adeleke, aka Davido, says there is no money Osun State can make in the next 40 years that his father, Adedeji Adeleke, has not already made as the 'omo baba olowo' crooner revealed why he stayed away from Nigeria for eight months.
ibo: Ọgwụ egwu onye Naijiria David Adeleke, onye a na-akpọ Davido, sị na onweghi ego Osun Steeti nwere ike inweta n' afọ iri anọ na-abịa abịa nke nna ya, Adedeji Adeleke, enwetabeghi dịka onye kụrụ 'ọmọ baba olowo' kpughere ihe mere na ya anọghị na Naijiria ọnwa asatọ.

en: A similar controversial statement regarding the paltry financial capacity of Osun was made by the national leader of the All Progressives Congress, Bola Tinubu.
ibo: Ụdị okwu mgbagha a banyere enweghị ego nke Osun Steeti bụ nke onye ndu otu pati 'All Progressives Congress' ala anyị gba gburugburu mere.

en: Contrary to beliefs that Davido was away from the country to promote his music on the international scene, the singer said he had to leave the country of some time due to the fillers he was getting that the government was after him.
ibo: Nkwenye nke nupụrụ isi na Davido pụrụ n' ala anyị ikwalite egwu ya na mba ụwa, ọgwụ egwu a sịrị na ya hapụrụ ala anyị nwa oge maka ihe ya na-anụ na gọọmenti na-achụ ya.

en: According to him, he needed to protect his family and associates which he was why he left the country.
ibo: Dịka ọ siri kwuo, ọ chọrọ ịchekwa ezinụlọ ya na ndị ha na ya na-akpakọrịta ya mere o jiri pụọ n' ala anyị.

en: The singer made this known at his album private listening event, Wednesday night, which held at Landmark Events, Victoria Island, where he disclosed that if he had chosen to stay things would not have gone smoothly for him as the government were beginning to track his activities.
ibo: Ọgwụ egwu a mere ka a mara nke a n' emume abọm ya, n' abalị Wenzidee, nke e mere na Landmark Events, Victoria Island, ebe o kwuru na ọ bụrụ na ya họọrọla ịnọ na ihe agaghị agara ya ọfụma dịka gọọmenti bidoro inyocha ihe niile ọ na-eme.

en: The singer whose album, 'A Good Time', will be released in October while fielding questions from MTV Base TV host, Ehiz, said, 'With the whole politics thing it was first about family.
ibo: Ọgwụ egwu a onye abọm ya, 'A Good Time', ga-apụta n' Ọktoba ka ọ na-aza ajụjụ si n' aka onye nọ isi emume 'MTV Base TV', Ehiz, sịrị, 'Ihe ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị niile bụ maka ezinụlọ na mbụ.

en: Honestly, it was first about family.
ibo: N' eziokwu, ọ bụ maka e, ezinụlọ na mbụ.

en: I was in Osun with my guys.
ibo: Mụ na ndị òtù m nọ n' Osun.

en: We saw everything in plain sight.
ibo: Anyị hụrụ ihe niile hoo haa.

en: Let me tell you a story about my uncle.
ibo: Ka m kọọrọ gị maka nwanne nna m nwoke.

en: My uncle is the last born of the family.
ibo: Nwanne nna m nwoke bụ nwa ịkpazụ ezinụlọ ha.

en: The original politician of the family is Serubawon, my father's elder brother.
ibo: Onye ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị nsinambụ nke ezinaụlọ ha bụ Serubawon, nwanne nna m nke okenye.

en: 'He was the first governor of Osun state; came back then went for senator you know when everybody for the state knows that this is the next governor and then we just woke up one day and they said he went to eat somewhere and he died.
ibo: Ya bụ Gọvanọ izizi nke Osun Steeti; nachiere azụ gawa sineti.

en: 'Yoruba culture when somebody holds an office and he passes on they either give the bride or the close relatives.
ibo: Ị ma mgbe onye ọbụla na Steeti mara na onye a bụ Gọvanọ na-abịa abịa mana anyị biliri ótù ụbọchị ha sị na o jere iri nri n' otu ebe wee nwụọ.

en: The next in line is B red's daddy and he is just a happy person.
ibo: 'N' omenaala Yoruba mmadụ jide ọchịchị wee nwụọ, ha na-enye nwunye ya ma ọ bụ ndị ikwu ya dị ya nso ọchịchị.

en: He doesn't like politics but when you lose your brother everybody knows what's up.
ibo: Osote bụ nna B Red, ọ bụ onye obi añurị.

en: With that, they wanted to give my uncle automatically.
ibo: Ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị anaghị amasị ya mana mgbe nwanne gị nwoke nwụnahụrụ gị onye ọbụla ma ihe merenụ. N' ihi nke a, ha chọrọ inye ya nwanne nna m n' akpaghị ya akpa.

en: 'A day to them swearing him in as senator they said no we want to do re-election another guy has come up and my father doesn't like wahala so he said let's go to the other party if we lose we pack our thing and go.
ibo: Ka otu ụbọchị fọrọ ka ha duo ya n' iyi ọrụ dị ka sinetọ ha sị mba anyị chọrọ imegharị nhọpụta onye ọzọ apụtala mana nna m achọghị nsogbu ọ wee sị ka anyị gaa na pati ọzọ anyị daa anyị kwara ngwongwo anyị pụọ.

en: The next day we did election my uncle cleared 16 out of 17 local government areas.
ibo: Ụbọchị na-esote anyị mere nhọpụta nwanne nna m meriri okpuru ọchịchị 16 n' ime okpuru ọchịchị 17.

en: 'He became a senator in just a week.
ibo: 'Ọ bụrụ sinetọ nanị n' ime otu izu ụka.

en: His own journey to winning that governorship primary election was out of sight that was how we knew this one nah God.
ibo: Njem ya imeri nhọpụta praịmarị ndọrọndọrọ gọvanọ miri emi nke anyị ji mara na ọ bụ uche Chukwu.

en: 'It was painful and will tell everybody here that was the real reason I was not even in the country because of the politics.
ibo: 'Ọ bụ ihe mgbu mana m ga-agwa onye ọ bụla ebe a na ọ bụ ihe a n' ezie mere na anọghị m n' obodo a maka ndọrọndọrọ.

en: I have to watch what I say.
ibo: Ekwesiri m ịkpachara anya n' ihe na-ekwu.

en: If I was around he no go dey OK for me and my people.
ibo: Ọ bụrụ na m nọ ya ọ gaghị adịrị m na ndị be m mma.

en: So I had to be a man and say look let me stay away.
ibo: Ya mere m jiri mee ka nwoke wee sị ka m pụọ apụ.

en: 'We have Adeleke University all the roads that lead was done by my father.
ibo: 'Anyị nwere Adeleke University nna m lụrụ ụzọ niile gara ebe ahụ.

en: There's no money Osun wants to make in the next 30 to 40 years that my father has not made.
ibo: Enweghị ego ọbụla Osun chọrọ inweta n' afọ iri atọ ruo iri anọ nke nna m enwetabeghi.

en: The way things turned out was crazy.
ibo: Ka ihe siri gbata kwuru ezighi ezi.'

en: When asked if he got any backlash for doing what he did, he said no.
ibo: Mgbe a jụrụ ya ma ọ nwetara nkọcha maka n' ihe ọ mere, ọ sịrị mba.

en: According to him, he met an APC chieftain at a wedding in Paris wherethey both shared a joke.
ibo: Dị ka o kwuru, o zutere onyeisi APC n' agbamakwụkwọ na Paris ebe ha abụọ kparịtara amụ.

en: He said he 'felt shebi una don take am'.
ibo: Ọ sịrị' Ọ kwa unu enwerela ya.'

en: That's why I'm back, he explained.
ibo: Ya mere m jiri nachie azụ, ọ kọwara.

en: 'I'm praying every day for the country.
ibo: 'Ana m ekpere obodo anyị ekpere kwa ụbọchị.

en: Everybody is complaining why you talking about politics.
ibo: Onye ọbụla na-ekpesa na I na-ekwu maka ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị.

en: I have an American passport I could have chosen to stay there.
ibo: Enwere m akwụkwọ njem Amerịka enwere m ike ịhọrọ ịnọ ebe ahụ.

en: But this is home and I am comfortable here.'
ibo: Mana ebe a bụ ụlọ, obi ruru m ala ebe a.

en: EXCLUSIVE: EFCC Quizzes Ondo Poly Bursar, Registrar Over Funds Misappropriation
ibo: Sọọsọ: EFCC jụrụ onye ojide ego na onye ndeko aha Politeknik Ondo ajụjụ banyere iri ego.

en: SaharaReporters gathered on Wednesday that the two men were 'drilled' for authorising the sum of N68m from the treasury of the school without due process.
ibo: Sahara Reports' chịkọtara na Wenzidee na a tara ụmụ nwoke abụọ ahụhụ maka inye ikike ka e wepụ nde N68 n' akpa ụlọ akwụkwọ a n' esoghị ụzọ ziri ezi.

en: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission has quizzed the Registrar of Rufus Giwa Polytechnic Owo, Ondo State, Mr Sule Atiku, and the Bursar of the institution, Mr Matthew Adejuwon, over alleged financial impropriety.
ibo: 'Economic and Financial Crimes Commission' ajụọla odeko aha nke Rufus Giwa Politeknik Owo, Ondo Steeti, Maazị Sule Atiku, na ojide ego ụlọakwụkwọ a, Maazị Matthew Adejuwon, ajụjụ maka ebubo e boro ha banyere imefu ego n' ụzọ ezighi ezi.

en: SaharaReporters gathered on Wednesday that the two men were 'drilled' for authorising the sum of N68m from the treasury of the school without due process.
ibo: 'Sahara Reports' chịkọtara na Wenzidee na a tara ụmụ nwoke abụọ ahụhụ maka inye ikike ka e wepụ nde N68 n' akpa ụlọ akwụkwọ a n' esoghị ụzọ ziri ezi.

en: A source, who confided in our correspondent, said that, 'The Registrar and Bursar of the institution were at the EFCC on Tuesday and they were quizzed over the role they played in allegedly misappropriating the funds of the institution.
ibo: Onye nyere anyị ozi, nke tụkwasịrị obi n' onye mmekọrịta anyị, kwuru 'Onye ndeko aha na onye njide ego ụlọakwụkwọ a nọ n' ụlọ ọrụ ndị EFCC n'ụbọchị Tuzdee, a jụrụ ha ajụjụ maka ebubo e boro ha banyere imefu ego ụlọakwụkwọ n' ụzọ n' ezighi ezi.

en: 'They were there with their lawyers and brought some documents to defend themselves.
ibo: 'Ha na ndị ọka ikpe ha nọ ebe ahụ, ha wetara akwụkwọ ụfọdụ iji gọrọ isi onwe ha.

en: 'Our investigations showed that the Bursar had his authorised signature on some of the documents which also implicated him as an accomplice.
ibo: Nyocha anyị gosiri na ojide ego binyere aka ikike ya na ụfọdụ akwụkwọ nke gosiri ya ka onye aka ya adịghị ọcha.

en: Two of them (Bursar and the Registrar) were accomplices in the ongoing corruption and fraud perpetrated at the polytechnic.
ibo: Ha abụọ (ọnakọ ego na odeko aha) so n' ihe nrụrụaka na igwu wayo a na-aga n' ihu e mere na Politeknik a.

en: A senior management officer of the school also confirmed the questioning of the two men during a chat SaharaReporters.
ibo: Otú onye nlekọta ọkwa ya gbalitere n' ụlọakwụkwọ a kwetara na a jụrụ mmadụ abụọ ajụjụ ka ya ndị' Sahara Reports ' na-akọrị.

en: He said, 'Yes, it is true that the two men have honoured the invite of the EFCC and they have been quizzed but I don't know if they were detained.
ibo: Ọ sịrị,' Ee, ọ bụ eziokwu na ụmụ nwoke abụọ zara òkù EFCC kpọrọ ha na a jukwara ha ajụjụ mana amaghị m e jidere ha.

en: I noticed I did not see them in school today (Wednesday).
ibo: Achọpụtara m na ahụghị m ha n' ụlọakwụkwọ taa (Wenezdee).'

en: When contacted on Wednesday evening over the matter, spokesperson for the institution, Mr Ojo Samuel, could not be reached as his telephone line was switched off.
ibo: Ka a kpọtụrụ n' ụbọchị Wenzidee banyere okwu a, okwuchite ọnụ ụlọ akwụkwọ, Maazị Ojo Samuel, e nwetaghị ya dị ka ekwentị ya gbanyụrụ agbanyụ.

en: Recall that the EFCC had last month invited and quizzed both the Chairman, Governing Board of the school, Mr Banji Alabi; the Rector, Gani Ogundahunsi; Deputy Rector (Academics), and Mr Olorunwa Lawson after a petition was received by the agency.
ibo: Cheta na ndị EFCC n' ime ọnwa gara aga kpọrọ ma jụọ ma onyeisi ọche otu na-achị ụlọakwụkwọ, Maazị Banji Alabi, onyeisi ụlọakwụkwọ a, Ganị Ogundahunsi; osote onyeisi ụlọakwụkwọ (n' agụmakwụkwọ), na Maazị Olorunwa Lawson ka ndị ụlọ ọrụ a nata character akwụkwọ mkpesa.

en: Some aggrieved lecturers of the school had accused the management of the institution of allegedly diverting and using some illegal means to misappropriate the school's fund into private purse.
ibo: Ụfọdụ ndị nkụzi ụlọakwụkwọ a ọ na-ewute ebola nlekọta ụlọakwụkwọ ahụ ebubo na ha na-ewegharị ma jiri ụzọ n' ezighi ezi na-etinye ego ụlọakwụkwọ a n' akpa nke onwe.

en: Sources at the EFCC had earlier told SaharaReporters that there are documents linking the principal officers of the polytechnic to the financial misappropriation.
ibo: Ndị si EFCC eweta ozi gwara 'Sahara Reports' na mbụ na e nwere ụfọdụ akwụkwọ na-ejiko ndị isi ọrụ Politeknik a na ihe mmefu ego n' ụzọ n' ezighi ezi a.

en: EXCLUSIVE: Real Reason I was Assaulted –FUTA Student Brutalised By Colleagues.
ibo: SỌỌSỌ: Ihe kpatara e jiri manye m ọgụ mberede n' ezie - - nwata akwụkwọ FUTA ụmụ akwụkwọ ibe ya meruru ahụ.

en: She was attacked by her colleagues for revealing how one of their boyfriends forcefully tried to have an affair with her.
ibo: Ndị òtù ya wakporo ya maka ikpughe ka ótù enyi ha nwoke si chọọ ka ha nwee mmekọahụ n' ike.

en: Boluwatife Adekunle, the female undergraduate of the Federal University of Technology Akure, Ondo State, who was physically assaulted by two ladies and a guy all said to be student of the institution, has given more insight into why she was attacked.
ibo: Boluwatife Adekunle, nwaanyị na-agwụ na 'Federal University of Technology' Akure, Ondo Steeti, onye ụmụ nwaanyị abụọ na ótù nwoke e kwuru na ha ncha bụ ụmụ akwụkwọ ụlọakwụkwọ a, enyewanyela nghọta banyere ihe e ji wakpo ya.

en: The young lady, who says she wants justice served, told SaharaReporters on Tuesday in Akure, the state capital, that she was attacked by her colleagues for revealing how one of their boyfriends forcefully tried to have an affair with her.
ibo: Nwata nwaanyị a, onye kwuru na ya chọrọ ikpe nkwụmọtọ, gwara 'Sahara Reporters' ụbọchị Tuzdee n'Akure, isi ọnọdụ steeti a, na ndị òtù ya wakporo ya mana ikpughe ka ótù enyi ha nwoke si chọọ ka ha nwee mmekọahụ n' ike.

en: Adekunle revealed that she was assaulted in one of the private hostels outside the school campus by the group in a bid to be disgraced among fellow students.
ibo: Adekunle kpughere na ndị òtù a masoro ya ọgụ mberede n' ótù ụlọ onwe n' adịghị n' okirikiri ụlọakwụkwọ iji mee ihe ihere n' etiti ụmụ akwụkwọ ibe ya.

en: She said, 'The whole issue started few weeks ago.
ibo: O kwuru, 'Ihe a niile bidoro izu ụka ole na ole gara aga.

en: I and one of the ladies in the video called 'Faith' were roommates in a hostel outside campus.
ibo: Mụ na ótù n' ime ụmụ nwaanyị nọ n' ihe onyonyo a a na-akpọ Faith bikoburu ọnụ n' òtù ụlọ na-adịghị n' okirikiri ụlọakwụkwọ.

en: 'Her boyfriend began asking me out but I felt it was not proper for me to date him.
ibo: Enyi ya nwoke bidoro rịọwa m enyi mana e chere m na ọ zighi ezi mụ ịyịwa ya.

en: I rejected his advances.
ibo: Ajụrụ m mbọ ya niile.

en: 'But instead of him to leave me alone, the guy kept disturbing me, so I had to report him to Faith because I don't want trouble.
ibo: 'Mana kama ọ ga-ahapụ m aka, ọ kachiri ntị na-enye m nsogbu, m wee kpee ya n' aka Faith makana achọghị m nsogbu.

en: FUTA Female Student Brutalised For Calling Colleagues 'Runs Girls'
ibo: E meruru nwa akwụkwọ nwaanyị FUTA ahụ maka ịkpọ ndị òtù ya ndị achawo.

en: 'Before then, I had been having some issues with Faith as she had been living a wayward life on campus which I didn't like.
ibo: Tupu oge ahụ, mụ na Faith enwela ụfọdụ nsogbu dịka ọ na-ebi ndụ na-adabaghị nke mụ achọghị n' ụlọakwụkwọ.

en: 'From that point, she started seeing me as talking bad about her to people around our area.
ibo: 'Bido oge ahụ, o bidoro na-ahụ m ka m na-akọrọ ndị mmadụ nọ mpaghara anyị ihe ọjọọ banyere ya.

en: 'During this period, her boyfriend kept pestering me to date him but I refused.
ibo: 'N' oge a, enyi ya nwoke kachiri ntị na-enye m nsogbu ka m yịwa ya mana ajụrụ m ajụ.'

en: 'Instead of Faith to caution her boyfriend, she accused me of planning to sleep with her man.
ibo: Kama Faith ga-adọ enyi ya nwoke aka na ntị, o bo m ebubo na m na-akpa nkata ka mụ na ya nwee mmekọahụ.

en: 'On the day that I was assaulted, she invited me to a room in one of the hostels and boyfriend and other ladies were inside the place already.
ibo: 'N' ụbọchị a masoro m ọgụ mberede, ọ kpọrọ m oku n' ótù ọnụ ụlọ ebe enyi ya nwoke na ụmụ nwaanyị ndị ọzọ nọrọla tupu m bịa.

en: 'Immediately I entered the place, they locked the door and asked me to kneel down while the guy was asking if he ever asked me for a date.
ibo: 'Ozugbo m batara ebe ahụ, ha akpọchie ụzọ wee sị m sekpuruala ebe nke nwoke na-ajụ ma ya arịọnugo m enyi.

en: 'Since I refused to kneel down, they began to beat me and also tried to strip me naked.
ibo: 'Ebe m jụrụ isekpuala, ha bidoro tiwe m ihe ma chọkwa ịgba m ọtọ.

en: 'They used a stick to hit me on my head and punched me on my face.
ibo: 'Ha jiri osisi na-akụ m n' isi ma na-akụ m ọkpọ n' ihu.

en: The guy used horse whip to flog me several times.
ibo: Nke nwoke pịara m koboko ugboro ugboro.

en: 'They said they would make sure they disgraced me on campus, I pleaded with them but they refused and I was about to faint when they stopped beating me.
ibo: 'Ha sịrị na ha ga-ahụ na ha mere ihe ihere n' ụlọakwụkwọ, arịrịọ m ha mana ha jụrụ, ana m achọ ikubi ume mgbe ha kwụsịrị iti mkpu ihe.

en: 'As I speak, I feel pains all over my body due to the beatings.
ibo: Dịka m na-ekwu ana m enwe mmetụta ihe mgbu n' ahụ m niile n' ihi ihe ha kụrụ m.

en: Their plan was to kill me.
ibo: Atụmatụ ha bụ ka ha gbuo m.

en: I want them arrested and face the consequences of their action.'
ibo: Achọrọ m ka e jidere ha ka ha nara ntaramahụhụ dịrị akparamagwa ha.'

en: While condemning the attack on her daughter, the victim's mother, Mrs Florence Adekunle, said they wanted justice over the matter.
ibo: Ka ọ na-akọcha mwakpo a wakporo nwa ya nwaanyị, nne onye ihe a metụtara, Florence Adekunle, sịrị na ya chọrọ ikpe nkwụmọtọ n' okwu ahụ.

en: Former lawmaker, Shehu Sani, and rights activist, Segun Awosanya popularly known as Segalink, have condemned the expulsion of a student of Federal University of Agriculture, Abeokuta, over a Facebook post, an open letter to the Inspector-General of Police and his alliance with pro-democracy and human rights activist, Omoyele Sowore.
ibo: Onye bụbu ọmebe iwu, Shehu Sani, na 'obuagha' ikike dịrị mmadụ, Segun Awosanya nke ọha ji Segalink wee mara, akatọọla ọchụchụ a chụrụ nwata akwụkwọ Federal University of Agriculture, Abeokuta, maka ihe o tinyere na 'Facebook,' akwụkwọ ozi e zoghi ezo nyere onyeisi uweojii ala anyị na ndọnye ukwu ọ dọnyere obuagha ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya na nke ikike dịrị mmadụ, Omoyele Sowore.

en: Shehu Sani, who took to his Twitter handle to express his grievance, said, 'Expelling students and sacking workers over Facebook or Twitter postings is likely to intensify in view of the growing culture of intolerance to criticisms and the establishment discomfort with the social media.'
ibo: Shehu Sani, onye jiri ebe nzisa ozi 'Twitter' ya kwupụta ka obi dị ya, sịrị, 'Ịchụ nwata akwụkwọ n' ụlọakwụkwọ na ịchụ ndị ọrụ n' ọrụ maka ihe ha tinyere na' Facebook' na' Twitter' nwere ike isiwanye ike n' ụdị mmụọ enwe nnabata nyere nkọcha na iguzogide mgbakasị ahụ nyere ntụsa ozi soshịa midia.'

en: Also reacting to the issue, Segalink wrote, 'By the grace of God, we shall be taking up this case.
ibo: N' itinye kwa ọnụ n' okwu a, Segalink dere,' Site n' amara Chukwu, anyị ga-ewere okwu.

en: The level of impunity in our citadel of knowledge is astronomical.
ibo: Ogo enwetaghị ntaramahụhụ n' ajọ ihe n' ebe mmụta anyị dị ukwuu.

en: An example will be made of this abuse of power by people who should know better.
ibo: A ga-eji mmetọ ike nke ndị kwesịrị ịma nke ka mma a wee mere ọmụma atụ.

en: Kindly advise Ifemosu Michael to reach out, so we can be properly briefed and take up the matter for justice to be served.
ibo: Nye Ifemosu Michael ka ọ kpọtụrụ anyị, ka anyị nwe ike mata ihe na-eme ọfụma ma were okwu a iji hụ na o nwetara ikpe nkwụmọtọ.

en: He is no longer alone.
ibo: Ọ bụghị sọ ya so.

en: However, despite the outcry the expulsion of Ifemosu by on the orders of the Vice Chancellor, Prof Felix Salako, the university's management are yet to give any statement on the issue.
ibo: Ka o sina dị, n' agbanyeghi oku na-aga maka ọchụchụ Ifemosu site n' ihe onyeisi ụlọakwụkwọ ahụ, Ọkammụta Felix Salado, kwuru, nlekọta ụlọakwụkwọ ekwubeghi ihe ọbụla banyere okwu a.

en: Expose Prostitutes In Your Locality, Hisbah Tells Kano Residents
ibo: Gbakpo ndị akwụna nọ n' gburugburu gị, Hisbah gwara ndị bi na Kano.

en: Commander-General of the Board, Sheikh Harun Ibn-Sina, was said to have made the call while addressing women apprehended for roaming the city at night.
ibo: Ọchịagha nke òtù a, Sheik Harun Ibn-Sina, ka e kwuru kpọrọ oku a ka ō na-agwa ụmụ nwaanyị e jidere maka ikwụgharị n' obodo n' abalị.

en: Kano Hisbah corps
ibo: Ndị agha Hisbah nke Kano.

en: Residents of Kano have been urged to expose prostitutes in their localities so that immoral activities can be curbed.
ibo: A gbaara ndị bi na Kano ume ka ha gbakpo ndị akụna bi na gburugburu ha ka e wee belata omume rụrụ arụ.

en: In a statement on Wednesday by its Public Relations Officer, Alhaji Lawan Ibrahim, the Kano State Hisbah Board said that the move would lead to speedy development of the state.
ibo: N' okwu ya n' ụbọchị Wenezdee site n' ọnụ onye mmekọrịta ọha na eze ya, Alhaji Lawan Ibrahim, òtù Hisbah nke Kano steeti sịrị na nzọ ụkwụ a ga-eweta mmepe ngwa ngwa na Steeti ahụ.

en: Commander-General of the Board, Sheikh Harun Ibn-Sina, was said to have made the call while addressing women apprehended for roaming the city at night.
ibo: Ọchịagha nke òtù a, Sheik Harun Ibn-Sina, ka e kwuru kpọrọ oku a ka ō na-agwa ụmụ nwaanyị e jidere maka ikwụgharị n' obodo n' abalị.

en: He said, 'Those apprehended during the Hisbah corps patrol were young girls.
ibo: O kwuru, 'Ndị ahụ e jidere n' oge ngagharị ndị agha Hisbah bụ obere ụmụ nwaanyị.

en: 'The raids were carried out at Church Road Sabon Gari, Railway quarters, Tukur Road in Nassarawa GRA and Sarkin Yaki Road in Kano.
ibo: 'Mbuso agha a were ọnọdụ na' Church Road Sabon Gari', 'Railway quarters', Tukur Road na Nasarawa Grant na Sarkin Yakima Road, Kano.

en: 'To achieve optimum result in its set programmes and policies, the board had set up 24-hour desk officers to handle any form of security report from the general public.
ibo: 'Iji nweta ezigbo mpụtara atụmatụ na amụma ha, òtù a ahọpụtala ndị ọrụ ga-anọ ọrụ awa 24 iji leba anya ụdị mkpesa nchekwa ọbụla ndị mmadụ wetara.

en: 'All reports will be treated with utmost confidence and urged people in the state to always be law abiding citizens.'
ibo: 'A ga-eji okwukwe gbasiri ike wee so mkpesa ọbụla ma na-agba ndị mmadụ nọ na steeti a ume ka bụrụ ndị na-erubere iwu isi.

en: Ibn-Sina however, said that the arrested women would be counselled before being handed them over to their parents.
ibo: Ibn-Sina ka o sina dị, sịrị na a ga-adụ ụmụ nwaanyị ndị e jidere ọdụ tupu e nyefee ha n' aka nne na nna ha.

en: FC Ifeanyi Uba Players Attacked By Armed Robbers Along Kabba Road
ibo: Ndị ohi wakporo ndị òtù bọọlụ Ifeanyị Ụba n' ogologo ụzọ Kabba.

en: Driver of the bus conveying the team was said to have been shot while some members of the coaching crew and players were critically injured.
ibo: Ọkwọ ụgbọala ụgbọala bụ ndị òtù a ka a sịrị na a gbara egbe ebe ụfọdụ na ndị ọrụ nchịkwa na ndị ọgba bọọlụ meruru nnukwu ahụ.

en: Players of FC Ifeanyi Uba have been attacked by armed robbers operating along Kabba Road near Lokoja in Kogi State.
ibo: Ndị oji egbe ezu nọ n' ogologo ụzọ Kabba dịdebere Lokoja na Kogi steeti awakpoola ndị ọgba bọọlụ nke òtù egwuregwu Ifeanyị Ụba.

en: A statement by the management of the club on Friday said that the players were travelling to Kano for their scheduled NPFL matchday 6 fixture against Jigawa Golden Stars when they ran into a group of armed robbers dressed in NYSC uniforms.
ibo: Okwu a kwuru, ' Nke a bụ iji mee ka ọha na eze mara na n' ihe dịka 1:30pm taa, ndị bọọlụ òtù egwuregwu Ifeanyị Ụba na-aga Kano maka asọmpi NPFL nke 6 e yiwere ha na Jigawa Golden Stars ka zutere òtù oji egbe ezu yi uwe ndị NYSC n' akụkụ Lokoja na Kogi steeti.

en: Driver of the bus conveying the team was said to have been shot while some members of the coaching crew and players were critically injured.
ibo: Ọkwọ ụgbọala ụgbọala bụ ndị òtù a ka a sịrị na a gbara egbe ebe ụfọdụ na ndị ọrụ nchịkwa na ndị ọgba bọọlụ meruru nnukwu ahụ.

en: Some of the victims were said to be receiving treatment at an undisclosed hospital in the state.
ibo: Ụfọdụ ndị ọ metụtara ka a sị na-ara ọgwụgwọ n' ụlọ ọgwụ a kpọghị aha ya na steeti ahụ.

en: The statement reads, 'This is to inform the general public that at about 1:30pm today, players of FC Ifeanyi Ubah travelling to Kano for their scheduled NPFL matchday 6 fixture against Jigawa Golden Stars ran into a group of armed robbers dressed in NYSC uniforms near Lokoja in Kogi State.'
ibo: Okwu onye nlekọta òtù egwuregwu a n' ụbọchị Fraịdee kwuru na ndị ọgba bọọlụ ahụ na-aga Kano maka asọmpi NPFL nke 6 e yiwere ha na Jigawa Golden Stars ka zutere òtù oji egbe ezu yi uwe ndị NYSC.

en: The club called on the government as well as football regulatory bodies including the Nigerian Football Federation and League Management Company to intensify security on roads across the country.
ibo: Òtù egwuregwu a kpọkuru gọọmenti nakwa òtù dị iche iche nchịkwa egwuregwu bọọlụ dị n' aka nke gụnyere 'Nigerian Football Federation' na 'League Management Company' ka kwalite ọnọdụ nchekwa n' okporo ụzọ na Naijiria gburugburu.

en: Federal Polytechnic Ado Ekiti Bans Students Unionism Over Protest
ibo: 'Federal Polytechnic' Ado Ekiti machiri òtù ọchịchị ụmụ akwụkwọ maka ịkpọ ganigani.

en: The students' body had accused the school's management of plotting to install a stooge, who would do the management's bidding as their leader.
ibo: Òtù ụmụ akwụkwọ a ebola ndị nlekọta ụlọakwụkwọ ebubo na ha chọrọ itinye onye ga-eme ebumnuche ndị nlekọta ka onye ndu ha.

en: The management of the Federal Polytechnic, Ado Ekiti, Ekiti State, has shut down the school following students' protest over the interference of the school's authorities in the running of the Students Union Government.
ibo: Ndị nlekọta 'Federal Polytechnic' , Ado Ekiti, Ekiti steeti, emechiela ụlọakwụkwọ maka ịkpọ ganigani ụmụ akwụkwọ n' ihi itinye aka ndị na-achị ụlọakwụkwọ na ọchịchị gọọmenti òtù ụmụ akwụkwọ.

en: Consequently, the management also banned all SUG activities in school until further notice.
ibo: N' ihi nke a, ndị nlekọta ụlọakwụkwọ machikwara mmemme gọọmenti òtù ụmụ akwụkwọ niile ganye n' ọdịnihu

en: The students' body had accused the school's management of plotting to install a stooge, who would do the management's bidding as their leader.
ibo: Òtù ụmụ akwụkwọ a ebola ndị nlekọta ụlọakwụkwọ ebubo na ha chọrọ itinye onye ga-eme ebumnuche ndị nlekọta ka onye ndu ha.

en: According to the News Agency of Nigeria, the protest by the students disrupted normal academic activities and vehicular movement in and out of the school.
ibo: Dị ka 'News Agency of Nigeria' sịrị kwuo, ịkpọ ganigani ụmụ akwụkwọ a gbochiri agụmakwụkwọ na ọpụpụ na mbata ụgbọala n' ụlọakwụkwọ a.

en: Some valuable facilities in the institution's School of Engineering were also destroyed.
ibo: E mebiri ụfọdụ ngwa bara uru na ngalaba ọmụmụ nkanụzụ ụlọakwụkwọ a.

en: The institution's Director of Protocol, Information and Public Relations, Adeyemi Adejolu, in a statement issued in Ado Ekiti on Sunday, denied the students' claims that authorities were interfering with the union's affairs.
ibo: Onye nhazi ihe omume, nzisa ozi na mmekọrịta ọhaneze nke ụlọakwụkwọ a, Adeyemi Adejolu, n' okwu o kwuru n' Ado Ekiti ụbọchị Ụka, gọrọ ihe ụmụ akwụkwọ kwuru na ndị na-achị ụlọakwụkwọ na-etinye anya n' ihe òtù ụmụ akwụkwọ na-eme.

en: He also described as needless and unwarranted the violent protest by the students, saying their action was based on mere rumour from unreliable sources, adding that the school's management had nothing to gain from imposing candidates in students' union election.
ibo: Ọ kọwakwara ganigani ike ụmụ akwụkwọ mere dị ka ihe na-enweghị isi na ihe na-ezighị ezi, na-ekwu na omume ha gbadoro ụkwụ n' akụkọ asịrị si ebe adịghị ntụkwasị obi, na-agbakwunye na onweghi ihe ndị nlekọta ụlọakwụkwọ ga-erite n' iweta mmadụ na ntụli aka òtù ụmụ akwụkwọ.

en: According to him, the decision to shut the polytechnic was arrived at during an emergency joint meeting of the Academic Board and Management Committee held on Saturday.
ibo: Dị ka o kwuru, mkpebi imechi Politeknik pụtara na ọgbakọ mberede bọọdụ ọmụmụ na Kọmitii nlekọta nwekọrọ ọnụ na Satọdee.

en: For Femi Falana and Kunle Ajibade: Sixty Hurrahs to Courage and Conviction By Ogaga Ifowodo
ibo: N' ebe Femi Falana na Kunle Ajibade nọ: Huree iri isii maka obi ike na nkwenyesi ike nke si n' aka Ogaga Ifowodo.

en: These two tribunes of truth and justice recently marked their sixtieth anniversary in a beautiful land made almost unliveable on any proper index of healthy living, where the average life expectancy is a bleak fifty-four years, placing us behind 215 other countries in the world and 15 in Africa.
ibo: Ndị ọchịagha nke eziokwu na ikpe nkwụmọtọ abụọ a mere emume ncheta iri isii ha na nso a n' ọmarịcha ahụ ike zuru oke nke sịrị nnukwu ike nweta n' ịgụkọ ndụ ahụ ike, ebe ihe a tụrụanya ibi bụ afọ iri anọ na ise edochaghị anya, nke mere ka anyị na-agba ndị nke 215 n,' ụwa niile na ndị nke 15 na mba Afrịka.

en: They can't hear me, but I am shouting sixty hurrays in the first instance, and sixty more (for I wish them a very long life), in tribute to their extraordinary courage.
ibo: Ha enweghị ike ịnụ ihe m na-ekwu, mana ana m eti huree iri isii na mbido, na iri isii ọzọ (makana achọrọ m ka ha nọọ nnọọ ogologo ndụ), ụtụ nyere obi isi ike pụrụ iche.

en: Dr. Ogaga Ifowodo
ibo: Dr. Ogaga Ifowodo

en: I was twenty-three and in the first semester of my final year as a law student at the University of Benin.
ibo: 'Adị m afọ iri abụọ na atọ ma nọrọ na simesta nke mbụ nke afọ ikpe azụ m dịka nwata akwụkwọ na-agụ maka iwu na Mahadum nke Benin.

en: He was thirty and already a rising star in the legal profession, though still under the wing of the urbane but ever battle-ready Alao Aka-Bashorun.
ibo: Ọ dị afọ iri atọ ma bụrụ onye chapụrụ achapụ na-awalite n' ọrụ iwu, ọ bụ ezie na ọ bụ ọkaibe mana Alao Aka-Bashorun dị njikere mgbe ọbụla.

en: I had recently ceased to be Secretary-General of the Students Union and Opeyemi Bamidele (now literally taking the bullets of enemies of democracy in our land) newly sworn in as the Chairman of the Caretaker Committee, pending the election to constitute a new executive.
ibo: Akwụsịcharala m ịbụ odeakwụkwọ ukwu nke òtù ụmụ akwụkwọ ma Opeyemi Bamidele (ugbua na-aghọ mgbọ ndị iro ọchịchị onye kwuo uche ya n' ala anyị) ka e duru n' iyi ọrụ ọhụrụ dị ka onyeisi Kọmitii nlekọta, ruo mgbe e mere ntụli aka iguzobe ndị ezekutivu ọhụrụ.

en: And it was the matter of the election that led to my 'indefinite suspension' — along with Bamidele and two others, in the first instance (eight more followed suit, besides the president of the union) — thereby almost confirming my father's fear the day I informed him of my intention to run for a Students Union office: that I did not intend to graduate!
ibo: Ma ọ bụ ihe gbasara ntụli aka a kpatara nkwụsị akwụkwọ enweghị mgbe o jedebere m'--tinyere Bamidele na mmadụ abụọ ndị ọzọ, n' izizi (mmadụ asatọ ọzọ sochikwara, ma e wezụga onyeisi nke òtù) - - n' otu a ọ fọdụrụ obere ịmezu egwu nna m tụrụ ụbọchị m gwara ebumnuche m ịzọpụta ọkwa òtù ụmụ akwụkwọ: na ebughi m n' uche ịgụsị akwụkwọ!

en: Still smarting from our victory in the fight for the restoration of the union at Uniben — following the unconstitutional ban on student union activities in the wake of the nationwide protests sparked by the murder of four Ahmadu Bello University students by anti-riot policemen precipitately called to quell a peaceful protest (Professor Ango Abdullahi, the vice chancellor, would further outrage the nation by announcing that 'only four students died' as if one were not too many) — Professor Grace Alele-Williams sought to pacify her campus for General Babangida, the reigning military dictator, by issuing intolerable election guidelines.
ibo: Ka ọ ka na-eri ahụ ụfụ mmeri anyị meriri n' agha inweghachi òtù ụmụ akwụkwọs n' Uniben-- ka a machiri emume òtù ụmụ akwụkwọ n' ụzọ n' adanyeghi n' iwu ka e mechara ngagharị iwe n' ala anyị gburugburu nke ogbugbu ndị uweojii mgbochi ngagharị iwe a kpọrọ ka kwụsị ngagharị iwe udo gburu ụmụ akwụkwọ anọ nke Mahadum Ahmadu Bello (Ọkammụta Ango Abdullahi, vaịs chanselọ, gara n' ihu kpalite iwe ndị mmadụ site n' ikwuputa na 'sọọsọ ụmụ akwụkwọ anọ nwụrụ' ka a ga-asị n' ótù abaghị nnukwu ụba)--- Ọkammụta Grace Alele-Williams chọrọ imedara Onyeisi agha Babangida, onye agha na-achị ọchịchị aka ike, obi ụlọakwụkwọ ya, site n' inye usoro ntụli aka adịghị nnagide.

en: Candidates were to submit their manifestoes for vetting; were not to use university policy as a campaign issue;
ibo: Ndị na-azọ ọchịchị gara iweta ihe ga-eme maka nnyocha; agaghị eji amụma mahadum mee ihe ịchụ nta votu;

en: must not belong to campus associations (this aimed at disqualifying members of the 'banned' League of Patriotic Students, resurrected as the Cultural Awareness Club, our group);
ibo: agaghị esonye n' òtù ọbụla n' ụlọakwụkwọ (ebumnuche nke a bụ iwezuga ndị so n' òtù 'League of Patriotic Students,' a machiri amachi e mechara tute dịka 'the Cultural Awareness Club,' òtù anyị);

en: possession of a minimum Grade Point Average of 2.75; and disqualification without reason.
ibo: inwe opekata mpe akara gredi 2.75; na mwezuga n' enweghi ihe e ji aka.

en: Why call it an election, you might ask, but we were then in the early years of Babangida's political witchcraft, hence his dying need to pacify the campuses by emasculating the National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS), as well as the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU), arguably the only organised opposition at the time to the burgeoning military terror. Our suspension was punishment for rallying the students against the obnoxious guidelines, for calling 'on students to boycott' the elections and — of course, they had to add this — 'incit[ing] them to violence and demonstration.'
ibo: Gịnị mere e ji kpọọ ntụli aka, i nwere ike ịjụ, mana mgbe ahụ anyị nọ mbido ọtụtụ afọ ọchịchị nchigbu Babangida n' ihi ya ọnwụ ya medara ụlọakwụkwọ dị iche iche obi site n' ịnapụ 'National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS), nakwa' Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) ihe ha ji dị ebube, nke dị mgbagha bụ sọ òtù a haziri ahazi maka mbusoagha nyere mmenye ụjọ ndị agha na-etolite etolite. Nkwụsị akwụkwọ anyị bụ ntaramahụhụ maka ịkpọkọta ụmụ akwụkwọ megide usoro jọgburu onwe ya, maka ịkpọ 'ụmụ akwụkwọ ka ha jụ' ntụli aka ná ----eleghị anya, ha gbakwunyere nke a, 'ịkpali ha imesi ike na ngosiputa.

en: But that was hardly our only crime.
ibo: Mana nke ahụ abụghị sọ ihe ọjọọ anyị mere ma ncha.

en: At the time of the second petrol price increase by Babangida from 39.5 kobo to 42 kobo per litre — yes, the national currency did have value once upon a time! — the union had barely been inaugurated and so we lacked the platform for an effective protest, with the University of Jos, I believe, leading the way then.
