ibo: O kwuru na ntọala ahụ amatala na ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ enweghi ike ịkwụ ụgwọ ụlọọgwụ.

en: This he said compel them to patronise quacks, thereby increasing the mortality rate of people living in most rural communities.
ibo: Nke a ka o kwuru ịmanye ha ịtụnyere ndị adịgboroja, wee na-abawanye ọnụọgụgụ ndị mmadụ na-anwụ bụ ndị bi n'ọtụtụ ime obodo.

en: Dr Chukwudozie noted that the inauguration of the scheme in Okija in collaboration with ASHIA was in line with Social Corporate Responsibility of the Dozzy.
ibo: Dr Chukwudozie kwuru na mwepụta nke atụmatụ a n'Okija na njikọta ya na ASHIA bụ n'usoro Social Corporate Responsibility nke Dozzy.

en: He solicited state government assistance in providing medical personnel, as well as equipping Okija General Hospital with necessary basic amenities.
ibo: Ọ rịọrọ maka enyemaka gọọmentị steeti iweta ndị ọrụ ahụike, yana ịkwadebe ma tinye ihe ndị dị mkpa n'ụlọọgwụ Okija.

en: Some of the enrollees expressed their joy, describing the programme as a good development that would help prolong their lives.
ibo: Ụfọdụ ndị ahụ nwetara ọzụzụ gosipụtara obi ụtọ ha, na-akọwa mmemme ahụ dịka ezigbo mmepe nke ga-enyere aka gbatịkwuo ndụ ha.

en: CRIMINALISE BUSH FIRES NOW -- LIVESTOCK FARMER
ibo: MEBIE IWU ỊGBA ỌHỊA ỌKỤ UGBU A - NDỊ ỌRỤ UGBO

en: Dr Ugochukwu Okpalaeke, Managing Director (MD) Eagle Food Processing Industry Ltd., has called on government at all levels to criminalise bush fires to save forest reserves in the state.
ibo: Dọkịta Ugochukwu Okpalaeke, onye nlekọta 'Managing Director' (MD) Eagle Food Processing Industry Ltd., akpọkuola gọọmentị n'ogo niile imebie ịgba ọhịa ọkụ iji chekwaa ọhịa na steeti ahụ.

en: Those who can afford it should pay without delay for their indigent relatives, friends and community members the way philanthropists like Dr Chukwudozie of Dozzy Foundation have done for their people.
ibo: Ndị nwere ike ịkwụ ụgwọ kwesiri ịkwụrụ ndị ikwu ha dara ogbenye, ndị enyi na ndị obodo ụgwọ n'egbughi oge dịka ndị ọrụ enyemaka dịka Dr Chukwudozie nke Dozzy Foundation meere ndị ha.

en: Okpalaeke made the call while interacting with information officers, in his office at Ozalla Akokwa Umuchu, on Jan.
ibo: Okpalaeke kpọrọ oku ahụ mgbe ya na ndị ọrụ ozi na-akparịta ụka, n'ọfịs ya n'Ozalla Akokwa Umuchu, na Jan.

en: Dr Okpalaeke said that bush fires constituted sabotage against governments at all levels.
ibo: Dr Okpalaeke kwuru na ọhịa ịgba ọkụ bụ mmebi iwu megide gọọmentị n'ọkwa niile.

en: This is a matter that should be treated with dispatch.
ibo: Nke a bụ okwu e kwesiri itinye ọnụ na ya ozigbo.

en: He explained that that certain people he classed as lazy hunters' were those in the habit of setting fires in a bid to hunt for bush meat' –rabbits, antelopes.
ibo: Ọ kọwara na ụfọdụ ndị ọ kpọrọ dịka 'ndị dinta dị umengwụ' bụ ndị na-amụnye ọkụ iji chụọ 'anụ ọhịa' - oke oyibo, ele.

en: According to him in the process they only succeed in destroying forest reserves and their habitats.
ibo: Dịka o kwuru, ha na-aga n'ihu ibibi oke ọhịa na ebe obibi ha.

en: When fires destroy bush, the nutrients in the land, animals, birds and insects that cross fertilize plants are also destroyed in the process; this also results into poor harvests of crops, high mortality rate among animals, with hunger as another direct consequence.
ibo: 'Mgbe ọhịa gbara ọkụ, ọ na-emebi ihe ndị na-enye nri dị n’ime ala, ụmụanụmanụ, ụmụ nnụnụ na ụmụahụhụ nke na-enyere ahịhịa/osisi aka ito; nke a na-ebute owuwe ihe ubi adịghị mma, ọnụọgụgụ ọnwụ dị elu nke ụmụanụmanụ, na agụụ.

en: So, government has no option than to deal decisively with bush fire perpetrators, so as to stem negative consequences,' he said.
ibo: 'N'ihi ya, gọọmentị enweghị nhọrọ karịa imeso ndị mpụ na-agba ọhịa ọkụ, iji kpata rezọọtụ adịghị mma,' ka o kwuru.

en: According to him, it is an ill wind that blows no one any good, calling on the media especially radio and television to develop jingles to sensitise the general public on dangers of bush fires.
ibo: Dịka o si kwuo, ọ bụ ihe dị njọ na-emetụta onye ọbụla, na-akpọ oku na mgbasa ozi ọkachasị redio na televishọn ka ha gbasaa ozi iji mee ka ọha na eze mara ihe egwu dị n'ịgba ọhịa ọkụ.

en: He urged Churches, Primary/Secondary Schools, market leaders, Igwes, president's generals and village heads to launch crusade against fire menace.
ibo: Ọ gbara ụka, ụlọ akwụkwọ praịmarị na nke sekọndrị, ndị isi ahịa, ndị igwe na ndị isi obodo ume ka ha bido ịlụ ọgụ megide ihe egwu dị n'ịgba ọhịa ọkụ.

en: The MD said that since December 2019 to date, he lost nine native cows (Efi Igbo) as a result of bush fires that cleared all vegetations around his ranch.
ibo: Nke MD kwuru na kemgbe ọnwa Disemba afọ 2019 ruo taa, na ehi Igbo itoolu funahụrụ ya n'ihi ọkụ ọgbụgba nke kpochapụrụ ahịhịa niile dị na gburugburu ya.

en: The Efi Hausa is survives it because they eat prepared animal feeds while Efi Igbo finds it difficult to survive as feed mainly on green leaves,' he said.
ibo: 'Ehi Hausa dị ndụ n'ihi na ha na-eri nri a kwadebere maka anụmanụ ebe ọ na-esiri Ehi Igbo ike ịdị ndụ ka ha na-eri akwụkwọ ndụ akwụkwọ ndụ,' o kwuru.

en: Okpalaeke used the opportunity to congratulate Gov. Willie Obiano on his recent award as Knight Commander of the Pontifical Order of St. Gregory the Great.
ibo: Okpalaeke jiri ohere ahụ kelee Gov. Willie Obiano na nzere o nwetara nso nso a dịka onye Knight Commander nke Pontifical Order of St Gregory the Great.

en: There can hardly be a better demonstration of solidarity with the human family than participation in initiatives like the Anambra State Health Insurance Scheme.
ibo: O nwere ike isi ike inwe ngosipụta dị mma na mmekọrịta mmadụ na ibe ya karịa ikere òkè na atụmatụ dịka atụmatụ Anambra State Health Insurance Scheme.

en: Anambra State Commissioner for Diaspora Affairs, Indigenous Artworks, Culture and Tourism, Mrs Sally Mbanefo has appealed Anambra State Association (ASA), Madrid, Spain to strive invest in the state.
ibo: Kọmịshọna steetị Anambra Steeti maka Diaspora Affairs, Indigenous Artworks, Culture and Tourism, Oriakụ Sally Mbanefo arịọla otu Anambra State Association (ASA), Madrid, Spain ka ha gbaa mbọ tinye ego na steeti ahụ.

en: This is an honour well deserved and a reward for hard work.
ibo: 'Nke a bụ nsọpụrụ kwesiri ekwesi na ụgwọ ọrụ maka ịrụsi ọrụ ike.

en: Obiano has achieved excellence at every life endeavour, from his school days to his days in the banking industry/personal businesses.
ibo: 'Obiano enwetazuola ihe dị mma na ndụ ọbụla, site n'ụbọchị agụmakwụkwọ ya rue ụlọọrụ ụlọakụ/ahịa nke onwe.

en: He called on Anambra youths to emulate Obiano, emphasising that award did not come through shortcuts, but rather from hard work.
ibo: Ọ kpọkuru ndị ntorobịa Anambra ka ha ṅomie Obiano, na-ekwusi ike na nzere abụghị site n'ụzọ dị mkpirisi, kama ọ bụ site n'ịrụsi ọrụ ike.

en: If anybody wanted an award of excellence, he should discharge his duties creditably wherever they found themselves.
ibo: Ọ bụrụ na onye ọbụla chọrọ ka e nye ya onyinye/nzere kachasị mma, o kwesịrị ịrụ ọrụ ya nke ọma ebe ọbụla ha hụrụ onwe ha.

en: I have not less 40 awards as a farmer.
ibo: 'Enwere m opekata mpe onyinye iri anọ dịka onye ọrụ ubi.

en: So, awards are available in every discipline; it is only hard work and sincerity of purpose that are rewarded,' he said.
ibo: Ya mere, nzere dị n'ọzụzụ ọbụla; ọ bụ naanị ịrụsi ọrụ ike na ezi obi nke nzube ka a ga-akwụ ụgwọ,' o kwuru.

en: The MD emphasised that it was better to rear animals in ranches than rearing them wandering about.
ibo: MD ahụ mere ka ọ pụta ìhè na ọ ka mma idobe ụmụanụmanụ n'ebe a na-azụ ụmụ anụmanụ karịa ime ka ha na-awagharị n'ọhịa.

en: This he said had enabled them to grow faster, bigger and produce more.
ibo: O kwuru na nke a na-enyere ha aka ito ngwa ngwa, buo ibu ma mepụta ihe karịa.

en: Those that purchase cows from us testify to generating more meat as they slaughter them,' Okpalaeke said.
ibo: 'Ndị zụrụ ehi n'aka anyị na-agba akaebe na ha-enweta ọtụtụ anụ ma ha gbue ha,' Okpalaeke kwuru.

en: We maintain good relationship with crop farmers because we buy their products such as cassava peels, leaves, to feed our animals.
ibo: 'Anyị na ndị ọrụ ugbo na-enwe ezi mmekọrịta n'ihi na anyị na-azụ ihe ubi ha dịka azụ akpụ, akwụkwọ nri, iji zụ ụmụanụmanụ anyị.

en: They also buy animal faeces as manure to grow crops.
ibo: 'Ha na-azụkwa nsị anụmanụ dịka ahịhịa nri (manure) iji mee ka ihe ubi too.

en: Okpalaeke said that they also undertake palm kernel processing for animal feeds, buying as much as anybody could bring to them at attractive prices.
ibo: Okpalaeke kwuru na ha na-arụkwa nhazi mkpụrụ akị maka nri anụmanụ, na-azụta ihe onye ọbụla ga-ewetara ha ọnụ ahịa mara mma.

en: A staff member of Eagle Food Processing Industry Nigeria Ltd.
ibo: Onye ọrụ nke Eagle Food Processing Industry Nigeria Ltd.

en: , Mr Samuel Ezennia said that their MD was a good employer.
ibo: Maazị Samuel Ezennia kwuru na MD ha bụ ezigbo onye na-ewe ọrụ.

en: He pays salaries promptly; maintains good relationship with workers who are known to be hard working.
ibo: Ọ na-akwụ ụgwọ ọrụ n’oge; na-enwe mmekọrịta dị mma n'etiti ndị ọrụ a maara na ha na-arụsi ọrụ ike.

en: He punishes lazy ones.
ibo: Ọ tara ndị umengwụ ahụhụ.

en: CONDUCT INTEGRITY TESTS BEFORE REBUILDING -- AGUPUGO URGES VICTIMS OF MARKET FIRE DISASTERS
ibo: MEE NNWALE IGUZOSI IKE N’EZI IHE TUPU ỊMALITE IWUGHACHI- AGUPUGO NA-AGBA NDỊ ỌDACHI ỌKỤ ỌGBỤGBA NKE AHỊA METỤTARA UME

en: Executive Director, Anambra State Emergency Management Agency (SEMA), Mr CY Agupugo has directed shop owners affected by Mgbuka Obosi Market fire disasters to conduct integrity tests before rebuilding their burnt shops.
ibo: Onyeisi nchịkwa, nke Anambra State Emergency Management Agency (SEMA), Mazị CY Agupugo agwala ndị nwere ụlọ ahịa nke ọdachi ọkụ nke ahịa Mgbuka Obosi metụtara ka ha nwalee iguzosi ike n'ezi ihe ha tupu ha ewughachi ụlọ ahịa ha ọkụ gbara.

en: Agupugo gave the directive when the panel set up on recent Mgbuka Obosi Market fires conducted assessment visits to affected parts of the market.
ibo: Agupugo nyere ntuzi aka ahụ mgbe ndị otu e guzobere n'ọkụ gbara n'ahịa Mgbuka Obosi na nso nso a mere nleta n'akụkụ ahịa ahụ ọkụ gbara.

en: The executive director, who doubled as secretary of the panel noted that it was wrong to start rebuilding shops and malls without integrity tests by the State Physical Planning Board and other relevant bodies.
ibo: Onyeisi ụlọ ọrụ ahụ, bụ onye jikwa ọrụ dịka odeakwụkwọ nke otu ahụ chọpụtara na ọ bụ ihe ọjọọ ịmalite ịrụ ụlọ ahịa na nnukwu ụlọ ahịa na-enweghị ule iguzosi ike n'ezi ihe nke ga-esite n'aka Physical Planning Board nke steeti ahụ na ndị ọzọ dị mkpa o metụtara.

en: We all have to take proper measures before we commence rebuilding of shops.
ibo: Anyị niile kwesiri ime ihe kwesiri ekwesi tupu anyị ebido iwugharị ụlọ ahịa.

en: I know that we are in a hurry to rebuild, so as to get back to our businesses, but we have to do the right thing first,' he said.
ibo: Amaara m na anyị na-eme ngwa ngwa ịrụghachi, ka anyị wee nwee ike ịlaghachi n'azụmaahịa anyị, mana anyị ga-ebu ụzọ mee ihe ziri ezi,' o kwuru.

en: Managing Director Anambra State Fire Service, Mr Ben Chiobi noted that the market was of great relevance to Ndi Anambra, as investors from different parts of the world come there to do business.
ibo: Onyeisi nchịkwa ụlọ lọrụ Anambra State Fire Service, Maazị Ben Chiobi kwuru na ahịa ahụ dị ndị Anambra ezigbo mkpa, ebe ndị ntinye ego sitere n'akụkụ ụwa dị iche iche na-abịa ebe ahụ ịzụ ahịa.

en: According to him, it was of importance that challenges faced by the market be addressed immediately and accordingly.
ibo: Dịka o si kwuo, ọ dị mkpa na a ga-elebara ihe ịma aka ndị dị n'ahịa anya ozigbo.

en: Chiobi also condemned indiscriminate dumping of waste engine oil and other combustible materials in and around the market.
ibo: Chiobi katọrọ ikpofu mmanụ ụgbọala mebiri emebi na ihe ndị ọzọ adịghị mma n'ime na n'akụkụ ahịa ahụ.

en: He said that state government through agencies like fire service, SEMA and related bodies would aid the market leaders to see that state laws would be enforce.
ibo: O kwuru na gọọmentị steeti site n'ụlọ ọrụ dịka ụlọọrụ ọkụ, SEMA na ndị metụtara ya ga-enyere ndị isi ahịa aka ịhụ na a ga-etinye iwu steeti ahụ.

en: It is in the interest of government to see that whatever challenges they face are solved as the state government will always come to your aid.
ibo: Ọ bụ mmasị nke gọọmentị ịhụ na e gboro nsogbu ọbụla chere ha ihu dịka gọọmentị steeti ga-enyere gị aka.

en: In order to avoid future occurrence of disasters in the state, there is a process for erecting buildings and that process requires that you must get government approval,' Chiobi noted.
ibo: 'Iji zeere ihe ga-eme n'ọdịnihu na steeti ahụ, e nwere usoro maka iwu ụlọ ma usoro ahụ chọrọ ka i nweta nnabata gọọmentị,' Chiobi kwuru.

en: Chairman of Mgbuka Obosi who is also a member of the panel, Mr Samuel Okey Ezeobodo, while sympathising with the fire victims, commended the state government for showing concerns toward them.
ibo: Onyeisi oche Mgbuka Obosi, onye bụkwa onye otu a, Maazị Samuel Okey Ezeobodo, mgbe ọ na-enwere ndị ọkụ dakwasịrị ọmịiko, kelere gọọmentị steeti maka igosipụta nchegbu ha.

en: He urged market leadership to ensure that the people put up better structures that would benefit the traders and government.
ibo: Ọ gbara ndị isi ahịa ume ka ha gbaa mbọ hụ na ndị mmadụ hiwere ezigbo ụlọ nke ga-abara ndị ahịa na gọọmentị uru.

en: MGBACHU NKPOR ELECTS NEW EXECUTIVE By Uzo Ugwunze
ibo: MGBACHU NKPOR HỌPỤTARA NDỊ NDU ỌHỤRỤ site n’aka Uzo Ugwunze

en: A New Executive has been elected to pilot affairs of Mgbachu Village, Nkpor, Idemili North Local Government Area, Anambra State, for the next four years.
ibo: A họpụtala ndị isi ọhụụ ga-arụ maka ọdịmma ógbè Mgbachu Nkpor, Idemili North Local Government Area, Anambra Steeti, afọ anọ na-abịa.

en: Heir apparent to Odu position in the village, Mr Godwin Onwukwe after dissolving the former village leaderships that were running parallel government, noted the need to operate in with the village Constitution.
ibo: Onye nketa ọkwa Odu n'ime obodo, Mr Godwin Onwukwe, mgbe o kposasịrị ndị isi mbụ obodo ahụ na-arụ ọrụ yiri ọchịchị gọọmentị, kwuru na ọ dị mkpa iji iwu obodo rụọ ọrụ.

en: We want to follow our Constitution and bring about lasting peace to the leadership and promote progress in Mgbachu.
ibo: 'Anyị chọrọ iso iwu anyị ma weta udo na-adịgide n'ọchịchị ma kwalite ọganiihu na Mgbachu.

en: I hereby dissolve the former executives on both sides,' Onwukwe said.
ibo: 'M wee si otu a kpochapu ndị bụbu ndị isi na mpaghara abụọ,” Onwukwe kwuru.

en: He commended Chairman of Mgbachu Elders Forum, Mr Oboli Joseph Okolo, the Nkpor Development Union (NDU) team, Chairman Nkpor Taskforce, Mr Augustine Udoh and Nkpor Central Vigilance Security, DSS and Police.
ibo: O toro onyeisi ndị otu okenye Mgbachu, Maazị Oboli Joseph Okolo, ndị otu Nkpor Development Union (NDU), onyeisi Nkpor Taskforce, Mr Augustine Udoh na ndị ọrụ nche Nkpor Central, DSS na ndị uwe ojii.

en: The former village Chairman, Mr Sunday Udoh pleaded with NDU to postpone the election to give him more time to prepare for re-election but he was told that his appeal was belated.
ibo: Onye bụbu onyeisi oche obodo, Maazị Sunday Udoh rịọrịrị ka NDU yigharịe nhọpụta ahụ iji nyekwuo ya oghere iji kwado maka ntuli aka mana a gwara ya na arịrịọ ya abịaghị n'oge.

en: The election was conducted through option A4 – the open ballot system.
ibo: A na-eme ntuli aka site na nhọrọ A4- usoro vootu gho oghe.

en: Arinze Idemili polled 66 votes to defeat his opponent, Sunday Muoghalu who polled 23 votes.
ibo: Arinze Idemili nwetara vootu iri isii na isii iji merie Sunday Muoghalu onye nwetara vootu iri abụọ na atọ.

en: The executive comprises Mr Arinze Idemili, Chairman; Mr Sunday Muoghalu Vice Chairman; Mr Felix Adibe, Secretary; Mr Ikechukwu Ejikeme, Assist Secretary; Mr Nzube Anikpe, Fin Sec; and Mr Chukwuka Obidigbo,Treasurer.
ibo: Ndị isi ahụ gụnyere Maazị Arinze Idemili, onyeisi oche; Maazị Sunday Muoghalu osote onyeisi oche; Mazị Felix Adibe, odeakwụkwọ; Maazị Ikechukwu Ejikeme, inyeaka odeakwụkwọ; Maazị Nzube Anikpe, odeakwụkwọ ego; na Maazị Chukwuka Obidigbo, oji ego.

en: Others are Nnanna Nwosu, Pub Sec; Ekene Ezeabata, Provost; Mr Nwachukwu Okolo Assist Provost and Amaechi Onwukwe as Auditor.
ibo: Ndị ọzọ bụ Nnanna Nwosu, odeakwụkwọ mgbasa ozi; Ekene Ezeabata, Provost; Maazị Nwachukwu Okolo Assist Provost na Amaechi Onwukwe dịka onye nyocha.

en: In his acceptance speech, Arinze Idemili thanked everyone for giving him the opportunity to serve his people and promised to attract developmental projects to Mgbachu village.
ibo: N'okwu nkwenye ya, Arinze Idemili kelere onye ọbụla maka inye ya ohere ijere ndị ya ozi ma kwe nkwa na ọ ga-adọta mmepe n'obodo Mgbachu.

en: The new executive was inaugurated by Mr Onwukwe in the presence of NDU Team, and the returning electoral officers, Mr Innocent Ilechukwu and Mr Chinedu Obidigbo (MOI).
ibo: Ndị isi ọchịchị ahụ bụ nke Maazị Onwukwe guzobere n'ihu ndị otu NDU na ndị ọrụ ntuli aka, Maazị Innocent Ilechukwu na Maazị Chinedu Obidigbo (MOI).

en: HEALTH MINISTRY TO COLLABORATE WITH NDLEA TO FIGHT DRUG TRAFFICKING, ABUSES TOO
ibo: MỊNỊSTRỊ AHỤIKE NA NDLEA JIKỌRỌ ỌNỤ IBU AGHA MEGIDE ỊTỤ MGBERE ỌGWỤ ỌJỌỌ NA MMEBI IWU

en: Anambra State Commissioner for Health, Dr Vincent Okpala says his ministry will collaborate with National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) to fight drug trafficking and abuse in the state.
ibo: Kọmịshọna steetị Anambra na-ahụ maka ahụike, Dr Vincent Okpala kwuru na ministị ya na National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) ga-ejikọ aka ibuso mgbere ọgwụ na mkparị steeti ahụ.

en: Dr Okpala said this during a courtesy visit by newly appointed NDLEA Commander Anambra State Command, Mr Misbahu M Idris in his office at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.
ibo: Dr Okpala kwuru nke a n'oge nleta sitere n'aka onyeisi ọhụrụ nke NDLEA Anambra steeti, Maazị Misbahu M Idris n'ụlọ ọrụ ya na Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.

en: He said that the state drug control committee constituted by Gov. Willie Obiano would work closely with the agency to eliminate drug trafficking and abuses across the state.
ibo: O kwuru na kọmitii na-achịkwa ọgwụ nke Gov. Willie Obiano chịkọtara na ụlọọrụ ahụ ga-arụkọ ọrụ ọnụ iji kpochapụ ndị ahịa ọgwụ ọjọọ na mmebi iwu n'ofe steeti ahụ.

en: God bless Anambra State, the Light of the Nation! (MOI)
ibo: Chukwu gọzie Anambra Steeti, Ìhè nke ala! (MOI)

en: The commissioner noted that the purpose of drug control committee was to ensure that all parties involved, would work together to achieve the goals.
ibo: Kọmịshọna ahụ kwuru na ebumnuche kọmitii na-achịkwa ọgwụ bụ iji hụ na ndị niile o metụtara, ga-arụkọ ọrụ iji mezuo ebumnuche ha.

en: Health is diverse both in mental and physical health, we know that the agency is not relenting in this regard, which will make our job easier.
ibo: 'Ahụike dị iche ma ahụike uche na nke anụ ahụ, anyị maara na ndị otu ahu anaghị atụgharị na nke a, nke ga-eme ka ọrụ anyị dị mfe.

en: Mental health is where we must pay urgent attention with your agency.
ibo: 'Ahụike nke uche bụ ebe anyị na ndị ọrụ gị kwesiri ilebara anya.

en: I have seen that you (NDLEA) are very proactive because in less than two months, you have already effected 50 arrests and four convictions.
ibo: 'Ahụla m na ị (NDLEA) na-eme ihe ike nke ọma n’ihi na ihe na-erughi ọnwa abuo, i jidela mmadụ iri ise ma nwee ikpe anọ.

en: Dr Okpala commended him for the visit, assuring him of continued collaboration and support from the ministry as well as the government.
ibo: Dr Okpala jara ya mma maka nleta ahụ, na-emesi ya obi ike na mịnịstrị ahụ na gọọmentị ga-agbakọ aka ma kwado ya.

en: Earlier, Mr Idris said his visit was to seek for collaboration with the ministry of health in order to fight against drug trafficking and abuses.
ibo: Na mbụ, Maazị Idris kwuru na nleta ya bụ ịchọ maka nkwado na ngalaba mịnịstrị ahụike iji lụọ ọgụ megide ndị mgbere ọgwụ ọjọọ na mmebi iwu.

en: He noted that ministry of health was one of their major stakeholders, believing they would help them in the fight against drug abuses and trafficking in the state.
ibo: O kwuru na mịnịstrị ahụike bụ otu n'ime ndị nkenye ha, kwenye na ha ga-enyere ha aka n'ọgụ megide ọgwụ ọjọọ na ịtụ mgbere ya na steeti.

en: NDLEA cannot do it alone; the reason we have come to seek collaboration and cooperation for our ideas to be fully achieved and implemented.
ibo: NDLEA apụghị ime ya naanị; ihe kpatara anyị ji bịa ịchọ mmekọta na ime ka e mezuo ma mepụta echiche anyị.

en: We arrested 249 suspects, seized 426.5988kg of hard drugs and secured 37 convictions in 2019,' the commander said.
ibo: 'Anyị jidere mmadụ narị abụọ na iri anọ na itoolu ndị a na-enyo enyo, jidere ọgwụ ike dị kg 426.5988 ma nweta ikpe iri atọ na asaa na 2019,' ọchịagha ahụ kwuru.

en: Adinuba is Commissioner for Information & Public Enlightenment, Anambra State
ibo: Adinuba bụ kọmịshọna na-ahụ maka ozi a kpọrọ Information and Public Enlightenment, nke steeti Anambra

en: He applauded the state Government's support in the fight against insecurity, drug trafficking as well as the leadership style of the commissioner, urging him to remain committed.
ibo: o toro nkwado nke gọọmentị steeti ahụ n'ọgụ megide enweghi nchekwa, ịtụ mgbere ọgwụ ọjọọ yana ụdị ọchịchị kọmishọna ahụ, na-agba ya ume ịnọgide na-agba mbọ.

en: Bringing your health experience is something that is commendable and we are enjoying that your experience already,' he noted.
ibo: 'Iwetara ahụmịhe ahụike gị bụ ihe kwesiri ịja mma na anyị na-ekpori ndụ n' ahụmịhe gị ugbua,' o kwuru.

en: TAKE ADVANTAGE OF CURRENT DRY SEASON TO EXECUTE ROAD PROJECTS – GOVERNMENT URGES CONTRACTORS
ibo: JIRI ỌKỌCHỊ NA-AKPỌ UGBU A RỤỌ ỌRỤ OKPOROỤZỌ- GỌỌMENTỊ NA-AGWA NDỊ ỌRỤ NGO

en: Willie Obiano of Anambra has urged contractors handling different road projects in the state to take advantage of ongoing dry season to hasten road construction works.
ibo: Willie Obiano nke Anambra agwala ndị ọrụ ngo na-arụ ọrụ dị iche iche n'okporo ụzọ dị na steeti ahụ ka ha were oge ọkọchị na-aga n'ihu rụọ okporo ụzọ ngwa ngwa.

en: My administration is determined to complete every road awarded during the last raining season before the next season,' the governor said.
ibo: Gọvanọ ahụ kwuru, 'Ọchịchị m ekpebiela ịrụzu okporo ụzọ niile enyerela n'oge udu mmiri tupu udummiri ọzọ abịa.'

en: He said this while inspecting ongoing construction work at the 4.95km Ezinnaja-Oraukwu-Nimo roads.
ibo: O kwuru nke a mgbe ọ na-enyocha ọrụ na-aga n'ihu n'okporo ụzọ 4.95km Ezinnaja-Oraukwu-Nimo.

en: The roads, which were on contract finance basis, were being handled by a prominent individual, Mr Daniel Nkwonta in Oraukwu.
ibo: Okporoụzọ ndị ahụ, nke e kwekọrịtara n'ego, bụ nke otu onye a ma ama n'Oraukwu, Maazị Daniel Nkwonta, na-edozi.

en: Gov. Obiano, who commended efforts of Mr Nkwonta, noted that the state government would refund the cost of the jobs on any certificate raised on the roads.
ibo: Gov. Obiano, onye toro mbọ nke Maazị Nkwonta, kwuru na gọọmentị steeti ahụ ga-eweghachite ụgwọ ọbụla a kwụrụ maka okporo ụzọ.

en: He highlighted the importance of the roads, saying the construction would promote agriculture and help the evacuation of farm produce to other towns and states.
ibo: Ọ kọwapụtara mkpa okporo ụzọ ndị ahụ dị, na-ekwu na ọrụ ahụ ga-akwalite ọrụ ugbo ma nyere aka ibupụ ihe ubi n’obodo na steeti ndị ọzọ.

en: Oraukwu is known for agriculture, it is an agrarian community.
ibo: 'A maara Oraukwu maka ọrụ ugbo, ọ bụ obodo ọrụugbo.

en: About 80 per cent of vegetables we export are from Oraukwu.
ibo: Ihe dịka pacenti akwụkwọ nri iri asatọ ka e si Oraukwu ebupụ.

en: This road is important to us.
ibo: 'Okporoụzọ a dị anyi mkpa.

en: Market women and farmers will be transporting their goods to markets easily.
ibo: Ụmụnwaanyị ndị ahịa na ndị ọrụ ugbo ga na-eburu ngwaahịa ha gaa n'ahịa n'ụzọ dị mfe.

en: In addition to that, it will also decongest heavy traffic into Agulu and other neighbouring communities during festive seasons.
ibo: 'Na mgbakwụnye nke a, ọ ga-akụda mkpọchi ụgbọala n'okporo ụzọ dị n'Agulu na obodo ndị ọzọ gbara ya gburugburu n'oge mmemme.

en: INVEST AT HOME COMMISSIONER MBANEFO ENJOINS NDI ANAMBRA IN DIASPORA
ibo: TINYE EGO N'ỤLỌ, KỌMỊSHỌNA MBANEFO GWARA NDỊ ANAMBRA BI NA MBA ỌZỌ

en: The Governor called on Anambra citizens in The Diaspora to heed the 'Aku-luo-uno' policy and partner the state in any capacity.
ibo: Gọvanọ kpọrọ oku ka ụmụ amaala Anambra bi n'ofesi ka ha ṅaa ntị n'amụma 'Aku-luo-uno' ma ha na steeti ejikọọ n'ike ọbụla.

en: Commissioner for Works, Mr Marcel Ifejiofor said 70 per cent of works had been achieved at the site including sand filling and other major works.
ibo: Kọmịshọna na-ahụ maka ọrụ, Maazị Marcel Ifejiofor kwuru na arụpụtala ọrụ dị pasenti iri asaa na saịtị ahụ gụnyere ịgba aja na ọrụ ndị ọzọ dị mkpa.

en: Coordinating Contractor handling the project, Mr Morgan Ofodum noted they had done major works, such as diversion of water channels responsible for deep erosion during raining seasons and control of swampy areas in addition to construction of double culverts.
ibo: Onye na-ahazi ọrụ ngo ahụ, Maazị Morgan Ofodum kwuru na ha arụọla nnukwu ọrụ, dịka ntopute nke ọwa mmiri nke na-ebute oke mbize n’oge udummiri ma na-ejikwa ebe apịtị mmiri na-aga.

en: He promised to complete the project within 72 weeks, as contained in the agreement.
ibo: O kwere nkwa ịrụcha ọrụ ahụ n’ime izuụka iri asaa na abụọ, dịka nkwekọrịta ahụ si dị.

en: BE CONSCIOUS OF SENSITIVE ISSUES WHILE REPORTING, HOS URGES MEDIA PRACTITIONERS
ibo: KPACHARA ANYA BANYERE OKWU NDỊ DỊ AṄAA MGBE Ị NA-AKỌ AKỤKỌ, HOS NA-AGBA NDỊ NA-AGBASA OZI UME

en: Anambra State Head of Service (HOS), Barr. Harry Udu has urged media practitioners to always remain conscious of sensitivity over issues they report on.
ibo: Onyeisi ọrụ a kpọrọ 'Head of Service' (HOS) na Steeti Anambra, Barr. Harry Udu gbara ndị ọrụ mgbasa ozi ume ka ha mụrụ anya ma na-eche nche gbasara okwu ha na-akọ.

en: Udu gave the advice, when Anambra State Chapter of Nigeria Union of Journalists (NUJ) paid him courtesy visit in his office at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka on Jan.
ibo: Udu nyere ndụmọdụ ahụ, mgbe ngalaba ntaakụkọ n'Anambra State a kpọrọ Nigeria Union of Journalists (NUJ) gara leta ya n'ọfịs ya na Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka na Jan.

en: HOS commended their efforts, reminding them that they were first, government employees as well as members of the NUJ and as such ought to remain agents of good governance.
ibo: HOS toro mbọ ha, na-echetara ha na ha bụ ndị mbụ, ndị ọrụ gọọmentị yana ndị otu NUJ ma ha kwesiri ịnọgide bụrụ ndị nnọchi anya nke ezigbo ọchịchị.

en: Udu assured them that Anambra State Government would continue to support the development of the media in the state including welfare of its members.
ibo: Udu mere ka obi sie ha ike na Gọọmentị Anambra ga-aga n’ihu ịkwado mmepe mgbasa ozi na steeti ahụ gụnyere ọdịmma nke ndị otu ya.

en: The civil service boss said that Anambra State Broadcasting Service (ABS) had been digitised by Gov.
ibo: Onyeisi ndị ọrụ kwuru na Gov. agbanweela Anambra State Broadcasting Service (ABS).

en: Udu stressed that Anambra State Government had offset pension and gratuities of NUJ members, which he described as a demonstration of support.
ibo: Udu kwusiri ike na Gọọmentị Anambra akwụọla ụgwọ ezumike nka nke ndị otu NUJ, nke ọ kọwara dịka ngosipụta nke nkwado.

en: The state government from inception has demonstrated strong support for the media and welfare of media workers by offsetting salary and pension arrears,' HOS said.
ibo: 'Gọọmentị steeti na mbido egosipụtala nkwado siri ike maka ndị ọrụ mgbasa ozi na ọdịmma nke ndị ọrụ mgbasa ozi site n'ịkwụ ụgwọ ọnwa na ụgwọ ezumike nka,' HOS kwuru.

en: He called on them to remain agents of development and eschew reporting issues when the details were hazy as this could be detrimental to sensibilities of the masses.
ibo: Ọ kpọrọ oku ka ha ka bụrụ ndị nnọchi anya mmepe ma gbanarị ikwupụta nsogbu mgbe nkọwa ndị ahụ edoghi anya n'ihi na nke a nwere ike ibute ọha mmadụ nsogbu.

en: HOS, then, assured them of government's continued support, promising them synergised relationship and transformations with the state's print media; National Light Newspaper.
ibo: Ya mere, HOS mere ka obi ha sie ike na gọọmenti ga na-akwado, na-ekwe ha nkwa na mmekọrịta na mgbanwe site n'ụlọ ọrụ mgbasa ozi nke steeti ga-emegharị; akwụkwọ akụkọ National Light.

en: Earlier, Chairman NUJ, Anambra State chapter, Mr Emmanuel Ifesinachi commended Gov. Willie Obiano for supporting the group.
ibo: Na mbụ, Onyeisi oche NUJ, ngalaba nke steeti Anambra, Maazị Emmanuel Ifesinachi jara Gov. Willie Obiano mma maka ịkwado ndị otu a.

en: Ifesinachi described Gov. Obiano as the most media friendly governor in the country considering his immense effort at transforming the state media.
ibo: Ifesinachi kọwara Gov. Obiano dịka gọvanọ ya na ndị mgbasa ozi kachasị emekọrịta na mba ahụ na-atụle nnukwu mbọ ọ na-agba n'ịgbanwe mgbasa ozi steeti.

en: The chairman recounted payment of media workers salaries and pensioners' arrears offset by the current administration.
ibo: Onyeisi oche ahụ kwupụtara ụgwọ ndị ọrụ mgbasa ozi na ndị nọ ezumike nka nke ndị ọrụ gọọmentị na-akwụ ugbu a.

en: Ifesinachi, while assuring government of their continued loyalty, pleaded that digitisation of operations of the ABS be replicated at the National Light.
ibo: Ifesinachi, mgbe ọ na-ekwe gọọmentị nkwa na ha ga-erubere ya isi, rịọrọ ka e mepụtaghachi iji kọmputa arụ arụmọrụ nke ABS na National Light.

en: Chairman, Correspondent's Chapel of the NUJ, Mr Emmanuel Ndukuba thanked HOS for granting them audience.
ibo: Onyeisi oche, Correspondent's Chapel nke NUJ, Maazị Emmanuel Ndukuba kelere HOS maka ige ha ntị.

en: He pledging continued support, appealing to government to grant them more opportunities to participate in government activities. (MOI)
ibo: O kwere nkwa na ha ga-aga n’ihu, na-arịọ gọọmentị ka o nyekwuo ha ohere isonye n’ihe omume gọọmentị. (MOI)

en: GOVERNOR INSPECTS ANAMBRA AIRPORT DUAL-CARRIAGE WAY, PROMISES SPEEDY COMPLETION OF PROJECT By John Ndu :
ibo: GỌVANỌ NYOCHAA ỤZỌ ỌDỤ ỤGBỌELU ANAMBRA, NA-EKWE NKWA ỊRỤCHA YA NGWA NGWA Site n'aka John Ndu:

en: Awkuzu-Umunya (Oyi LGA), Jan. 24, 2020 (MOI) Gov. Willie Obiano has embarked on inspection tour of the ongoing construction of International Airport dual-carriage way.
ibo: Awkuzu-Umunya (Oyi LGA), Jenụwarị 24, 2020 (MOI) Gov. Willie Obiano ebidola njem nlegharị n'ihe owuwu nke ọdụ ụgbọelu nke na-aga n'ihu.

en: The 4.8 Km dual carriage is between Awkuzu and Umunya axis of the Enugu-Onitsha Expressway.
ibo: Ụzọ dị Km 4.8 dị n'agbata Awkuzu na Umunya nke dị n'okporo ụzọ Enugu-Onitsha.

en: Gov. Obiano assured that the road, which was being handled by a competent contractor, would be completed with the State-of-the-Art infrastructures.
ibo: Gov. Obiano kwere na ụzọ a, nke onye ọrụ ngo ya maara ihe ekwe na-akụ, bụ nke a ga-eji akụrụngwa 'State-of-the-Art' were rụcha.

en: According to him, we have three roads leading into the airport -- Nsugbe-Umueri axis, when coming from Onitsha and another from Nteje-Umueri axis for those within Nteje, Umueri and Aguleri axis.
ibo: Dịka o si kwuo, anyị nwere okporo ụzọ atọ na-eduga na ọdụ ụgbọelu- okporo ụzọ Nsugbe-Umueri, mgbe esi Onitsha abịa na ụzọ ọzọ si Nteje-Umueri maka ndị nọ na Nteje, ụzọ Umueri na Aguleri.

en: We have Awkuzu-Umunya axis, which was supposed to be the major highway into the Airport.
ibo: Anyị nwere ụzọ Awkuzu-Umunya, nke kwesiri ịbụ oke okporo ụzọ banyere n’ọdụ ụgbọ elu.

en: We are committed to ensuring that all these roads are completed with the best road infrastructures; we will finish it by the grace of God.
ibo: 'Anyị kpebisiri ike ịhụ na e ji akụrụngwa kachasị mma rụchaa ụzọ niile; anyị ga-arụcha ya site n’amara nke Chineke.

en: All these are geared toward ensuring that we do not have traffic congestion on the Airport Road, also to make it easily accessible to Ndi Anambra and Nigerians in general,' Obiano pointed out.
ibo: 'Ihe ndị a niile bụ ịgba mbọ hụ na anyị enweghi nkwokọ ụgbọala n' okporoụzọ ọdụ ụgbọelu, iji mee ka ọ dịrị ndị Anambra na ndị Naịjiria niile mfe.' Obiano rụtụrụ aka

en: The Governor also promised to deploy more sophisticated road facilities on major roads in the state.
ibo: Gọvanọ ahụ kwekwara nkwa iwebata ihe ndị bụ ọkaibe e ji arụ okporoụzọ n'isi okporo ụzọ na steeti ahụ.

en: Commissioner for Works, Mr Marcel Ifejiofor, commended the construction company handling the project for their efforts at achieving great physical structures within the short time the award was contracted.
ibo: Kọmịshọna na-ahụ maka ọrụ, Maazị Marcel Ifejiofor, toro ụlọọrụ na-ahụ maka iwu ihe owuwu ahụ jikwa ọrụ ahụ maka mbọ ha na-agba iji rụpụta ihe a na-ahụ anya n'ime obere oge e nwere nkwekọrịta ahụ.

en: Works Commissioner observed that of the 4.8Km, 2.5Km had been cleared and asphalted.
ibo: Kọmịshọna ọrụ ahụ chọpụtara na n'ime Km 4.8, e kpochapụla Km 2.5.

en: The coordinating contractor handling the project, Mr Jonny Nasa assured that the work would be delivered under 10 months once they were mobilised. (MOI)
ibo: Onye na-ahụ maka ọrụ ahụ, Maazị Jonny Nasa kwere nkwa na a ga-arụcha ọrụ ahụ n'ime ọnwa iri ozigbo a chịkọtara ha. (MOI)

en: SECCIMA HOLDS INVESTITURE/INSTALLATION OF SOUTH EASTERN GOVERNORS AS GRAND PATRONS
ibo: SECCIMA NA-AMALITE/ARỤNYE NDỊ GỌVANỌ ỌWỤWA ANYANWỤ DỊKA NDỊ AKA OCHIE

en: South East Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines and Agriculture (SECCIMA) plans inauguration/ installation of South East Governors as Grand Patrons of the Chamber.
ibo: Ndị South East Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines and Agriculture (SECCIMA) na-ezube ịmalite/nrụnye nke ndị gọvanọ ọwụwa anyanwụ dịka ndị aka ochie 'Grand Patrons' nke ụlọ ọrụ ahụ.

en: Some selected distinguished indigenous entrepreneurs will also be honoured as patrons.
ibo: Ụfọdụ ndị nta ego a ma ama a họpụtara ka a ga-akwanyekwara ugwu dịka ndị isi.

en: The event would be held on Feb. 19, at Anedo Hall, Nnewi, Anambra State under the Chairmanship of Dr Cletus M Ibeto (CON).
ibo: A ga-eme emume ahụ na Febrụwarị 19, n'Anedo Họọlụ, Nnewi, Anambra Steeti ebe Dr Cletus M Ibeto (CON) ga-abụ onyeisi oche.

en: The event would also feature inaugural economic lecture with theme: Sustainable Steps Towards The Economic Development of The South East Region'.
ibo: Ihe omume a ga-egosipụta okwu nkuzi akụnaụba nke isiokwu ya bụ: 'Nzọụkwụ Ga-adịgide Maka Mmepe Akụnaụba na Mpaghara Ọwụwa Anyanwụ.'

en: The Chamber, then, called for goodwill messages/adverts insertions for publication in the event's brochure.
ibo: Mgbe ahụ, chamber ahụ kpọrọ òkù maka ozi ekele/mgbasa ozi a ga-ebipụta n'ime akwụkwọ 'Brochure' emume ahụ

en: This it said could be sent as soft copies to the chambers' e-mail: seccima247@gmail.com or whatsApp: 08036758278.
ibo: Nke a ka e nwere ike izipụrụ na email nke ụlọọrụ ahụ: seccima247@gmail.com ma ọ bụ whatsApp: 08036758278.

en: All payment would be expected to be made in favour of SECCIMA: A/C No. 3906894017 (FCMB). (MOI)
ibo: A ga-atụ anya na ịkwụ ụgwọ niile ga-akwado SECCIMA: A/C No. 3906894017 (FCMB). (MOI)

en: ANAMBRA TO COMMENCE NEW MINIMUM WAGE IMPLEMENTATION THIS MONTH END By John Ndu
ibo: ANAMBRA GA-EBIDO MMEJUPỤTA ỤGWỌ ỌNWA OPEKEMPE NA NGWỤCHA ỌNWA A Site n'aka John Ndu.

en: Umunnachi (Dunukofia LGA), Jan. 24, 2020 (MOI) Anambra State Government has announced its readiness to commence payment of the new minimum wage, starting from Jan. 26.
ibo: Umunnachi (Dunukofia LGA), Jenụwarị 24, 2020 (MOI) Gọọmentị steeti Anambra ekwupụtala na ọ dị njikere ịmalite ịkwụ ụgwọ opekata mpe ọhụrụ, malite na Jenụwarị 26.

en: According to him, the new minimum wage implementation will improve socio-economic status of the state and boost the state's Internally Generated Revenue (IGR).
ibo: Dịka o si kwuo, mmejupụta ụgwọ ọnwa opekata mpe ga-emeziwanye ọnọdụ akụnaụba na steeti ahụ ma bulite 'Internally Generated Revenue' (IGR) nke steeti ahụ.

en: He stressed the economic importance of the implementation of the new minimum wage, pointing out that improved welfare of workers was top priority of his administration.
ibo: Ọ kwusiri ike mkpa akụnaụba nke mmejupụta ụgwọ opekempe ọhụụ dị, na-akọwapụta na ọdịmma ndị ọrụ bụ ihe kachasị mkpa na ọchịchị ya.

en: Gov. Obiano while inspecting the Eziowelle-Umunnachi-Afor Igwe roads, currently under construction, observed that some structures would be affected during the job execution.
ibo: Gov. Obiano mgbe ọ na-enyocha ụzọ Eziowelle-Umunnachi-Afor Igwe, nke a na-arụ ugbu a, chọpụtara na ụfọdụ ihe owuwu bụ nke a ga-emetụta n'oge a na-arụ ọrụ.

en: Gov. Obiano made the declaration while inspecting the 5.3Km Eziowelle-Umunnachi-Afor Igwe roads.
ibo: Gov. Obiano mere nkwupụta a mgbe ọ na-enyocha okporoụzọ Eziowelle-Umunnachi-Afor Igwe dị 5.3km.

en: He noted that traffic congestion on the old road would be reduced, especially during festive periods, when the construction of the road would have been completed.
ibo: Ọ chọpụtara na mkpọchi okporo ụzọ ochie ga-ebelata, ọkachasị n'oge mmemme, mgbe a ga-arụcha okporo ụzọ ahụ.

en: The Governor emphasised his administration's commitment to continue to link up communities through building of roads; urging the people of the area to support the contractors.
ibo: Gọvanọ ahụ kwenyesiri ike na ọchịchị ya ga-anọgide na-ejikọta obodo site n'ịrụ okporo ụzọ; na-agba ndị bi n'ógbè ahụ ume ka ha kwado ndị ọrụ ngo ahụ.

en: The contractor handling the project, Mr Daniel Ekene, said the project was awarded last year.
ibo: Onye na-ahụ maka ọrụ ngo ahụ, Maazị Daniel Ekene kwuru na e nyere ọrụ ahụ n'afọ gara aga.

en: Mr Ekene explained that they commenced with demolition of the existing drainage system, which usually caused flooding in the area, adding that they had done 1.5Km of drainage.
ibo: Maazị Ekene kọwara na ha ebidola ịkwatu usoro ọwa mmiri dịbu mbụ, bụ nke na-ebute ide mmiri na mpaghara ahụ, na-agbakwụnye na ha arụọla ọwa mmiri dị Km 1.5.

en: He assured the people that the project would be completed by May. (MOI)
ibo: O mere ka ndị mmadụ kwenyesie ike na a ga-arụsị ọrụ ahụ ruo n'ọnwa Mee. (MOI)

en: He explained that Lassa fever was an acute viral hemorrhagic fever (VHF) caused by Lassa virus.
ibo: Ọ kọwara na ọrịa Lassa bụ nnukwu ọrịa Viral Hemorrhagic Fever (VHF) nke nje Lassa kpatara.

en: The natural reservoir for the virus is the Mastomys natalensis rodent commonly known as the multimammate rat. Other rodents have also been identified to carry the virus,' he said.
ibo: 'Ebe nje oke ahụ si bụ 'Mastomys natalensis' nke a na-akpọkarị oke 'multimammate'. Achọpụtakwala na òké ndị ọzọ bu nje ahụ,' o kwuru.

en: The commissioner maintained that Lassa fever remained a major public health challenge in West Africa with Nigeria bearing the highest burden.
ibo: Kọmịshọna ahụ kwusiri ike na ọrịa Lassa fever ka bụ nnukwu nsogbu ahụike n'Ọdịda Anyanwụ Africa ebe Naịjiria nwere ọnụọgụgụ kachasị elu.

en: Lassa fever occurs throughout the year but more cases are recorded during dry season from Nov. to May, with 81 cases reported from six states,' Okpala said.
ibo: Ọrịa Lassa na-apụta n'afọ niile mana ọtụtụ okwu ka e depụtara n'oge ọkọchị site na Nọvemba ruo Mee, yana okwu iri asatọ na otu sitere na steeti isii,' Okpala kwuru.

en: Lassa fever is spread through direct contact with urine, faeces, saliva or blood of infected rats.
ibo: 'Ọrịa Lassa fever na-agbasa site na imetụta mamịrị, nsị, ọnụ mmiri maọbụ ọbara oke bu ya.

en: Contact with objects, household items and surfaces or eating food contaminated with urine, faeces, saliva or blood of infected rats.
ibo: 'Imetụ ihe, ihe di n’ime ụlọ maọbụ iri nri metụrụ mamịrị, nsị, ọnụ mmiri maọbụ ọbara oke bu ọrịa ahụ.

en: Awka, Jan. 28, 2020 (MOI) Anambra Commissioner for Health, Dr Vincent Okpala, has urged the people to maintain proper sanitary conditions in their environment to prevent the spread of Lassa fever.
ibo: Awka, Jenụwarị 28, 2020 (MOI) Kọmịshọna Ahụike nke Anambra, Dr Vincent Okpala, agbaala ndị ahụ ume ka ha debe ọnọdụ ịdị ọcha kwesịrị ekwesị na gburugburu ebe obibi ha iji gbochie mgbasa nke ọrịa Lassa.

en: The commissioner said this while addressing the newsmen in his office at the Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.
ibo: Kọmịshọna ahụ kwuru nke a mgbe ọ na-agwa ndị nta akụkọ okwu n'ọfịs ya na Jerome Udoji Secretariat Complex, Awka.

en: Dr Okpala said that there was no incidence of Lassa fever in the state and briefed the people on dangers of the disease in our society.
ibo: Dọkịta Okpala kwuru na enweghi ọrịa Lassa fever na steeti ahụ wee mee ka ndị mmadụ mara banyere ihe egwu dị n'ọrịa ahụ n'obodo anyị.

en: HEALTH COMMISSIONER ADVOCATES PROPER PERSONAL, ENVIRONMENTAL HYGIENE
ibo: KỌMỊSHỌNA AHỤIKE NA-AKWADO MAKA ỊDỊ ỌCHA DỊ MMA NKE ONWE, GBURUGBURU EBE OBIBI

en: The commissioner urged them to impact positively on the state's economy by investing at home.'
ibo: Kọmịshọna ahụ gbara ha ume ka ha na-emetụta akụnaụba steeti site n'itinye ego na steeti ha.

en: Chairman ASA Madrid, Mr Kenneth Nwose thanked the commissioner for her hospitality and efforts in promoting Igbo culture and values.
ibo: Onyeisi oche ASA Madrid, Maazị Kenneth Nwose kelere kọmishọna ahụ maka ile ọbịa ya na mbọ ya n'ịkwalite ọdịnaala na ụkpụrụ ndị Igbo.

en: He said that they would like to have a portion of land at the Diaspora estate when activated.
ibo: O kwuru na ha ga-achọ inweta ala na mpaghara ndị ọbịa mgbe enyere ha.

en: Mr Nwose commended the state governor for his good works in the state and pointed out that parents should be educated against child abuse.
ibo: Maazị Nwose toro gọvanọ steeti ahụ maka ọrụ ọma ọ na-arụ na steeti ahụ wee rụtụ aka na o kwesịrị ka a kụziere ndị nne na nna maka mmeso ọjọọ a na-emeso ụmụaka.

en: The chairman also urged government to look into and improve electricity power supply in the state. (MOI)
ibo: Onyeisi oche ahụ rịọkwara gọọmentị ka ha leba anya ma kwalite ọkụ eletrik na steeti ahụ. (Moi)

en: Hotels will be registered and a programme called 'Suwa kwa Igbo', will be initiated.
ibo: A ga-edebanye aha ụlọ ọrụ nkwariakụ 'hotel' ma tinye mmemme a kpọrọ 'Suwa kwa Igbo'.

en: The wife of the governor, through her pet project, Caring Family Initiative (CAFE)' has impacted positively on the lives of widows, children and the physically challenged in the state,' she said.
ibo: 'Nwunye gọvanọ ahụ, site n' ọrụ ya, 'Caring Family Initiative (CAFE)' emetụtala ndụ ụmụnwaanyị ajadu, ụmụaka na ndị ọrụsị na steeti ahụ,' ka o kwuru.

en: Fredrick Nwabufo
ibo: Fredrick Nwabufo

en: On June 12, 2018, Joshua Dariye, former Plateau State governor and senator, huddled in the dock awaiting the verdict of fate for pilfering N1.6bn public funds at a high court of the Federal Capital Territory.
ibo: Na June 12, 2018, Joshua Dariye, onye bụbu gọvanọ Plateau steeti na onye nnọchite anya na Sineti, gbakwụnyere n'ọdụ ụgbọ mmiri na-eche mkpebi nke akara aka maka ịkwụ ego N1.6bn ọha na eze n'ụlọ ikpe ukwu nke Federal Capital Territory.

en: Dariye was lachrymal, wiping hot tears from his eyes.
ibo: Dariye bu anyammiri, were na-ehichasị anyammiri ya n'anya.

en: Before the senator was handed a 14-year jail sentence by Adebukola Banjoko, the presiding judge, he begged for mercy – a luxury he did not accord to the people of Plateau who endured his troubled administration.
ibo: Tupu e nyefee Sịnetị ahụ akwụkwọ mkpọrọ afọ iri na anọ, Adebukola Banjoko, onye ọkaikpe n'ụlọ mkpọrọ, rịọrọ ka e meere ya ebere - okomoko o nyeghị ndị bi na Plateau onye nagidere nsogbu ọchịchị ya.

en: He was found guilty of 14 counts out of the 23 preferred against him by the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission.
ibo: A mara ya ikpe ugboro iri na anọ n'ime iri abụọ na atọ ahụ Kọmitii na-ahụ maka ego na mmefu ego (EFCC) kpebiiri ya.

en: Before the judge passed her judgment, Paul Eroko, counsel to Dariye, pleaded for a light sentence.
ibo: Tupu onye ọkaikpe ahụ kpebie ikpe ya, Paul Eroko, onye ndụmọdụ Dariye, rịọrọ ka a maa ya ikpe dị mfe.

en: 'Appeals to your judgement do not succeed; we will fall on your mercy. The prisons are congested,' Eroko said.
ibo: “Arịrịọ a na-arịọ ka ikpe gị ghara ịga nke ọma; anyị ga-emere gị ebere. Ụlọ mkpọrọ ahụ ejula.' Eroko kwuru.

en: 'They misled the governor, it is the bank; they said he didn't have to present anything.'
ibo: “Ha duhiere gọvanọ, ọ bụ ndị ụlọakụ; ha kwuru na ọ dịghị mkpa iwepụta ihe ọbụla.”

en: But Rotimi Jacobs, counsel to the EFCC, said Dariye did not deserve a light sentence because he 'did not show remorse'.
ibo: Mana Rotimi Jacobs, onye ndụmọdụ na EFCC, kwuru na Dariye ekwesighi inweta amamikpe dị mfe n'ihi na “o gosighi mmụọ nchegharị”.

en: At this point, weeping Dariye said he wanted to speak.
ibo: N'oge a, Dariye onye nke na-ébé ákwa kwuru na ya chọrọ ikwu okwu.

en: 'Have mercy, you are a Christian, your name is Jacob,' he said.
ibo: “Mee ebere, ị bụ onye ụka, aha gị bụ Jekọb,” o kwuru.

en: On Thursday, Orji Uzor Kalu, another former governor and senator, received the retribution of kismet.
ibo: Na Tọzdee, Orji Uzor Kalu, onye bụbu gọvanọ na sinetọ, natara nkwụghachi nke kismet.

en: Reality jarred Kalu out of the fantasy that he was going home to his bed after his conviction for money laundering by a federal high court in Lagos.
ibo: Eziokwu gbochiri Kalu n'echiche efu na ọ na-ala n'ụlọ ya mgbe o kwenyesịrị ikpe maka ego zuuru n' ụlọ ikpe dị elu na Lagos.

en: After Mohammad Idris, the presiding judge, pronounced a 12-year jail sentence and warders moved towards him with handcuffs, the Senate Chief Whip resorted to diplomacy.
ibo: Dịka Mohammad Idris mesịrị, ọkaikpe ahụ kpọpụtara, afọ iri na abụọ nke ịtụ mkpọrọ ma ndị nche mkpọrọ ahụ lutere ya na tụọ ya ịga n'aka, onyeisi Sịnetị maliteghachiri diplọma.

en: 'Where are you taking us to now? Please don't handcuff me. I will follow you,' he said.
ibo: “Ebee ka ị na-akpọga anyị ugbu a? Biko atụkwala m ịga n'aka. Aga m eso gị,” o kwuru.

en: Kalu's fall is louder than the crash of Jericho – being a trenchant mouthpiece of President Muhammadu Buhari in the South-East.
ibo: Ọdịda Kalu dara karịrị ọdịda mgbidi nke Jeriko - dịka onye bụ nkwupụta okwu nzuzo nke onyeisi ala Muhammadu Buhari na South-East.

en: But is his conviction a 'pass mark' for Buhari's much vaunted war against corruption? I do not think so.
ibo: Mana nkwenye ya, o ruru 'akara' maka agha dị oke egwu Buhari megide mpụ? Echeghị m otu ahụ.

en: First, the case is 12 years old. It was not actuated by this administration. And investigations were already concluded before this regime.
ibo: Nke mbu, ikpe ahụ gbara afọ iri na abụọ. Ndi ọchịchị a emeghi ya. E mechaala nyochaa ya tupu ọchịchị a.

en: Second, corruption cases recently initiated against certain individuals have not received oomph owing to the fact that they are in the 'Buhari fraternity'.
ibo: Nke abụọ, ikpe nrụrụ aka ebidola megide ụfọdụ mmadụ anabataghị 'oomph' n'ihi na ha nọ n' ọchịchị 'Buhari.'

en: For example, the case of Babachir Lawal, former Secretary to the Government of the Federation, is sputtering in court this despite his indictment by the government he served.
ibo: Ịmaatụ, okwu gbasara Babachir Lawal, onye bụbu onye ode akwụkwọ gọọmentị etiti, na-asọgharị n'ụlọ ikpe n'agbanyeghị ịma ikpe nke gọọmentị mere.

en: Also, there is a petition against Bola Tinubu, National Leader of the APC, for alleged money laundering at the EFCC. Tinubu admitted transporting cash in bullion vans on the eve of the 2019 election to his house. But the anti-graft agency has not moved a muscle to investigate the allegation.
ibo: Ọzọkwa, e nwere akwụkwọ mkpesa megide Bola Tinubu, Onye ndú nke APC maka ịdọrọ ego na EFCC. Tinubu kwenyere na o ji ụgbọala na-ebuga ego na mgbede ntuli aka nke 2019 n'ụlọ ya. Mana ụlọ ọrụ na-ahụ maka nke a amalitebeghi inyocha ebubo a.

en: When Ibrahim Magu, acting EFCC chairman, was asked about the petition against Jagaban by a journalist, he snubbed the inquiry, and said 'next question, please?'
ibo: mgbe a jụrụ onye na-elekọta otu EFCC bụ Ibrahim Magu ajụjụ maka arịrịọ onye ntaakụkọ rịọchitere Jagaban, ọ gbara ha nkịtị ma jụọ ha 'ajụjụ ọzọ, biko? '

en: As a matter of fact, there are other members of the APC and those in the Buhari fraternity who have corruption allegations hanging on their necks, but the EFCC is yet to crack up a case against them.
ibo: N'ezie, e nwere ndị otu APC na ndị na-enye Buhari nkwado bụ ndị aka ha dị n'aghụghọ, mana ndị EFCC ebidobeghi ime nnyocha ha.

en: I will not mention more names.
ibo: Agaghị m ekwu áhà ọzọ.

en: So, on what grounds should Buhari's anti-corruption war be toasted? If the regime is applauded for the jailing of Dariye and Orji Kalu, how about other cases it has failed to take up or conclude?
ibo: Yabụ, kedu ihe kpatara e kwesịrị ịtụkwasị agha Buhari na-ebu maka nrụrụaka obi? Ọ bụrụ na a na-eto gọọmentị maka mkpọrọ ọ tụrụ Dariye na Orji Kalu, kedu maka ikpe ndị ọzọ ọ dara mba ikwulite maọbụ kwubie?

en: The fact is, Buhari's anti-corruption war is still selective. And as Abubakar Tsav, former Lagos police commissioner, said, 'It has no impact on Nigerians.'
ibo: Eziokwu bụ, agha Buhari megidere nrụrụaka ka na-ahọta. Dịkwa ka Abubakar Tsav, onye bụbu onyeisi ndị uwe ojii (kọmịshọna) na Lagos kwuru, “Ọ nweghị ihe mmetụta ọbụla n'ebe ndị Naịjirịa nọ.”

en: However, I will commend the judiciary for not bending despite influences to have some cases of corruption compromised. The termination of Kalu's 12-year-old bout at the trial court is a big point for the institution. The hero here is this arm of government.
ibo: Otu o sila dị, a ga m aja ndị ụlọ ikpe ike maka na ha alaghachighị azụ n'okwu ha n’agbanyeghi ikike imegharị nrụrụaka ahụ. Nkagbu afọ iri na abụọ a kagbuuru Kalu n'ụlọ ikpe bụ nnukwu ihe maka ụlọ ọrụ ahụ. N'ébé a, dike bụ ogwe gọọmentị a.

en: But beyond this feat, we must look into another tragic offence against Nigerians. Why is a senator convicted of fraud still receiving allowances and salaries as a member of the Senate?
ibo: E mesịa, anyị ga-elebanye anya na iwu ọzọ jọgburu onwe ya megide ndị Naijirịa. Gịnị kpatara na onye omeiwu amara ikpe ígwù wàyó ka na-anata ụgwọ ọrụ na ụgwọ ọnwa dịka onye otu omeiwu?

en: As of December 2018, Dariye was paid N85.5m in prison, and as of May 2019 his allowances had risen to N171m. Obviously, the same immoral privilege will be accorded to Orji Kalu. Is this not troubling?
ibo: N'ọnwa Disemba 2018, a kwụrụ Dariye ụgwọ N85.5m n'ụlọ mkpọrọ, wee rue na May 2019, ụgwọ mmachi akpa ya agbagola N171m. N'ụzọ doro anya, a ga-enye Orji Kalu otu ikike a rụrụ arụ. Nke a ọ bụghị nsogbu?

en: What it means is that tax-payers will continue to fund the lifestyles of individuals who have been convicted of stealing from them.
ibo: Ihe ọ pụtara bụ na ndị na-atụ ụtụ isi ga-aga n'ihu na-akwado ndị ahụ a mara ikpe na ha zuru ọha na eze ohi.

en: Justice is not final when people, who have been declared vandals of the public purse, are still maintained by public money.
ibo: Ikpe ziri ezi abụghị ikpe mgbe ndị mmadụ, bụ ndị e kwupụtara na ha zuru ohi dị iche iche n’ihu ọha, ka na-ejide ego ọha na eze.

en: Fredrick Nwabufo is a writer and journalist… @FredrickNwabufo
ibo: Fredrick Nwabufo bụ odeakwụkwọ na onye ntaakụkọ… @FredrickNwabufo

en: Arsenal Sacks Emery Over Poor Performance
ibo: Arsenal chụrụ Emery maka arụmọrụ adịghị mma

en: During his time at the club, he oversaw a disastrous run of form that saw his side go seven games without a win for the first time since 1992.
ibo: N'oge ọ nọ na klọb ahụ, ọ lekọtara usoro dị egwu nke mere ka otu ya gaa egwuregwu asaa na-enweghị mmeri ọbụla na nke mbụ kemgbe 1992.

en: Unai Emery, has been sacked as manager of Arsenal.
ibo: A chụpụla Unai Emery, dịka onye njikwa nke Arsenal.

en: During his time at the club, he oversaw a disastrous run of form that saw his side go seven games without a win for the first time since 1992.
ibo: N'oge ọ nọ na klọb ahụ, ọ gara egwuregwu asaa na-enwetaghị mmeri kemgbe 1992.

en: Hailed in the past as saviour of the team, Emery, 48, was appointed in the summer of 2018 following the departure of Arsene Wenger.
ibo: Oge e were dịka onye nzọpụta nke otu ahụ, Emery, 48, bụ onye a họpụtara n'oge ọkọchị n'afọ 2018 tinyere ọpụpụ Arsene Wenger.

en: He guided the Gunners to fifth in his debut campaign, one point adrift of Spurs, before losing 4-1 to Chelsea in the Europa League final.
ibo: O duziri ndị Gunners ka ha banye n'ọgba nke ise, otu isi na-esote Spurs, tupu Chelsea e jiri ọkpụ anọ a sara naanị otu (4-1) merie ha na Europa League ikpeazụ.

en: His side also went 22 games unbeaten combined with a run of 11 straight defeats.
ibo: Ndị otu ya gbara egwuregwu iri abụọ na abụọ were turu ugo na ha tinyere egwuregwu iri na otu e meriri ha.

en: The final straw was the Europa League defeat at home to Frankfurt on Thursday.
ibo: Ihe ikpeazụ bụ mmeri ndị Frankfurt meriri ha na European League na Tọọzụde.

en: The club have asked Freddie Ljungberg to take responsibility for the first team as interim head coach.
ibo: Ndị klọb ahụ rịọrọ Freddie Ljungberg ka ọ rụọ ọrụ n'otu egwuregwu mbụ dịka onye isi ha.

en: ASUU Calls For Boycott As Varsites Begin IPPIS Today
ibo: ASUU kpọrọ oku maka ịkwụsị ọrụ dị ka ndị Varsites bidoro IPPIS Taa

en: The union said the Federal Government needs to test its own model of ensuring financial transparency rather than forcing its members captured on the Integrated Personnel Payroll and Information System, which opened on Monday.
ibo: Njikọ ahụ kwuru na Gọọmentị etiti kwesịrị ịnwale iji hụ na ego ahụ doro anya kama ịmanye ndị otu ya ihu ha dị na Integrated Personnel Payroll na Ụlọọrụ na-ahụ maka mgbasa ozi 'Information System', nke mepere na Mọnde.

en: The leadership of the Academic Staff Union of Universities has directed its members nationwide to disregard a circular from the Office of the Accountant-General of the Federation to enrol academic staff on the Integrated Payment and Personnel Information System from Monday.
ibo: Ndị ọchịchị na-ahụ maka ndị nkuzi mahadum a kpọrọ 'Academic Staff Union of Universities' agwala ndị otu ha nọ na mba niile ka ha leghara akwụkwọ sitere n'ụlọ ọrụ na-ahụ maka ego n'ala anyị anya iji debanye aha ndị ọrụ n'ime 'Integrated Payment and Personnel Information System' site n'ụbọchị Monday.

en: ASUU on Sunday stated that the same Accountant-General of the Federation had challenged the union to develop a template that accommodates the peculiarities of academic staff and present same to him.
ibo: N'ụbọchị Sunday, ndị otu ASUU kwuru na onyeisi ndị na-ahụ maka ego mara ndị otu ahụ aka ịmepụta ndebiri nke ga-anabata ndị ọrụ ma gosi ya.

en: The union said the Federal Government needs to test its own model of ensuring financial transparency rather than forcing its members captured on the Integrated Personnel Payroll and Information System, which opened on Monday, a report by PUNCH said.
ibo: Ndị otu ahụ kwuru na gọọmentị etiti kwesịrị ịnwale n'ụdị nke ya kama ịmanye ndị otu ya na ndị a ga-etinye na 'Integrated Personnel Payroll and Information System', nke mepere na Mọnde, nkwupụta nke Punch mere.

en: Prof Biodun Ogunyemi, ASUU National President, added that the enrollment of lecturers was like taking universities back to core civil service.
ibo: Prof Biodun Ogunyemi, onyeisi ndị ASUU, gbakwụnyere na idebanye aha ndị nkuzi dị ka iweghachi mahadum azụ dịka ọrụ ndị nkịtị.

en: Ogunyemi insisted that its members will not take part in the registration for the IPPIS, adding that such steps by the Federal Government would undermine the autonomy of Nigerian universities.
ibo: Ogunyemi siri ọnwụ na ndị otu ya agaghị etinye aka ná ndebanye aha maka IPPIS, na-agbakwụnye na usoro dị otu a ndị gọọmentị etiti chọrọ ime ga-emebi ọchịchị nke mahadum Naịjiria.

en: He said, 'We have proposed to the government that we have an alternative that will address all issues that the government had raised about universities.
ibo: O kwuru, 'Anyị gwara gọọmenti na anyị nwere nhọrọ ọzọ nke ga-edozi nsogbu niile gọọmenti welitere banyere mahadum'.

en: The government needs to test our own model rather than buying into a model that will take universities back to the core civil service.
ibo: Gọọmenti kwesịrị ịnwale ụdị nke anyị kama iweta ụdị ga-eweghachi mahadum azụ dịka ọrụ ndị nkịtị'.

en: With IPPIS, before a Vice Chancellor can employ an academic worker, the VC will have to get permission from the Head of the Civil Service of the Federation.
ibo: Site na IPPIS, tupu onyeisi mahadum ga-enwe onye ọrụ agụmakwụkwọ, onyeisi ahụ (VC) ga-enweta ikikere n'aka onyeisi ndị ọrụ n'ala anyị.

en: 'Universities cannot be run within the framework of civil service bureaucracy.
ibo: E nweghị ike ime e mahadum n'ime usoro ọrụ gọọmenti'.

en: 'Universities are universal cities of knowledge creation and they can perform best when they are allowed to operate their system based on the laws establishing them.
ibo: Mahadum bụ ebe ihe ọmụma ma ha nwere ike ime nke ọma mgbe e nyere ha oghere ịrụ n'usoro dị n'iwu ha'.

en: 'We signed a memorandum of action with government earlier this year and they promised that they will start visitation by March this year.
ibo: Anyị na gọọmentị debanyere akara ngosi ma ha kwere nkwa na ha ga-amalite nleta n'ọnwa Maachị afọ a.

en: Government didn't do anything.
ibo: Gọọmenti emeghị ihe ọbụla.

en: This is November.
ibo: Nke a bụ ọnwa Nọvemba.

en: When people say ASUU is encouraging corruption, it is cheap blackmail.
ibo: Mgbe ndị mmadụ na-ekwu na ASUU na-akwado nrụrụ aka, ọ bụ mmebi aha.

en: 'We will destroy Nigerian universities with IPPIS if government should go ahead and force people to enroll.
ibo: Anyị na IPPIS ga-emebi mahadum Naịjirịa ma ọ bụrụ na ndị a ga-aga n'ihu manye ndị mmadụ idebanye aha ha'.

en: 'You can't bring lecturers from all over the world and ask them to go and register in Abuja in the ministry.
ibo: Ị gaghị enwe ike ịkpọta ndị nkuzi n'akụkụ ụwa niile gwa ha ka ha debanye aha n'Abuja n'ozi ahụ.

en: It is ridiculous.
ibo: Ọ bụ ihe ọchị.

en: We have gone beyond that.
ibo: Anyị agafeela nke ahụ.

en: They are taking us many decades back.
ibo: Ha na-akpọghachi anyị azụ.

en: It is sad.'
ibo: Ọ bụ ihe mwute.

en: Banking Sector's Loss Is Entertainment Industry's Gain
ibo: Ọghọm ndị ụlọakụ bụ uru ndị ụlọ ntụrụndụ

en: The entertainment industry is emerging as the market that will absorbmuch of the loans the central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) is forcingcommercial banks to give.
ibo: Ụlọ ọrụ na-ahụ maka mmemme na-apụta dịka ahịa nke ga-anara mgbazinye ego nke Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) na-amanye ndị ụlọ akụ inye.

en: A report by Proshare indicates that banks are positioning themselves to attract clients from small and medium scale enterprises in themusic and movie space.
ibo: Akụkọ sitere n'aka Proshare na-egosi na ụlọ akụ na-etinye onwe ha n'ọrụ na-adọta ndị ahịa site n'obere ụlọ ọrụ.

en: However, analysts Sahara Reporters have spoken to and reports published by financial research firms, conclude that the increasedpressure on banks to lend much of their deposit, is negative for thefinance industry at this point.
ibo: N'agbanyeghị, ndị nnyocha Sahara Report agwala ma kọsaa akwụkwọ sitere n'ụlọ ọrụ nnyocha ego 'Financial Research Firm', kwubie na mmụba nke ụlọ akụ dị iche iche iji gbazinye ego, bụ ihe adịghị mma nye ụlọ ọrụ ego a n'oge a.

en: We believe this development — the 65 percent loan to deposit ratio islargely negative for the banking sector, which has only just recoveredfrom the weak asset quality issues prevalent since 2016,'Cardinalstone research said in a report.
ibo: Anyị kwenyere na nke a-ịgbazinye ego dị pacenti iri isii na ise bụ ihe adịghị mma maka ndị ụlọ akụ, nke nwetagoro nke ọma site na nsogbu nke jupụtara kemgbe afọ 2016, ndị nnyocha Cardinals Tone kwuru.

en: We also believe that the macro-environment is still too fragile tosupport strong growth in lending,' it added.
ibo: Anyị kwenyekwara na gburugburu ebe obibi esighi ike ịkwalite ùtó n'igbazinye ihe', ọ gbakwụnyere.

en: Adedayo Bakare, an analyst with Afrinvest gave Sahara Reporters a similar outlook.
ibo: Adedayo Bakare, onye nnyocha na Afrinvest nyere ndị Sahara Report echiche yiri nke ha.

en: True to Bakare's observation, two of the three-tier 1 lenders, Zenith and Guarantee Trust, are among the 12 lenders fined a combined total of over N499bn by the CBN for their inability to meet with the September 2019 target of borrowing 60 percent of their deposits to thereal sector.
ibo: N'ikwe n'ihe Bakare hụrụ, abụọ n'ime atọ ndị na-agba inye ego, Zenith na Guarantee Trust, so ná ndị mgbazinye ego iri na abụọ CBN dara nha karịrị #499bn maka enweghị ike izute ebumnuche maka ịgbazite ego dị pasenti iri isii nke Septemba 2019.

en: The third lender – Access bank, survived thanks to thehuge loan portfolio it inherited from Tier 2 Diamond bank.
ibo: Ndị mgbazinye nke atọ - ụlọ akụ Access, na-enye ego nke ha nwetara site n'ụlọ akụ Diamond.

en: Proshare is of the opinion that these lenders have looked to thesafety of the celebrity industry, to reduce the risk of borrowingfunds to the everyday farmer and small-time shoemaker.
ibo: Proshare kwuru na ndị a na-agbazi ego lebara anya n'ụlọ ọrụ a ma ama, iji belata nsogbu ibinye ndị ọrụ ugbo ego.

en: In a report published Thursday, it listed a series of creative packages Deposit Money Banks are adapting to build quality assets in the creative space.
ibo: N'ime akwụkwọ e bipụtara ụbọchị Tọzdee, o depụtara usoro nkepụta ego ndị Deposit Money Banks na-arụ iji wee rụpụta akụ dị mma.

en: The most audacious plan is Access bank's Creative Arts village in Ogun State.
ibo: Atụmatụ kachasị mma bụ nke ndị ụlọ akụ Access mere n'Ogun steeti.

en: Proshare notes that the village will help to 'address issueslike the location for movie production, capacity building forpractitioners, and deepening the ecosystem of the Arts and Entertainment industry in Nigeria.
ibo: Proshare kwuru na obodo ahụ ga-enye aka kọwaa nsogbu a na-enwe n' ebe a na-emepụta ihe nkiri, ikike maka ndị na-eme ihe na ịbawanye gburugburu ụlọ ọrụ ndị 'Arts na Entertainment' na Naịjiria.

en: Herbert Wigwe, the managing director of Access Bank, expects thevillage to create 2 to 3m jobs annually.
ibo: Herbert Wigwe, onyeisi njikwa nke ụlọ akụ Access, na-atụ anya n'aka ndị obodo ịmepụta ọrụ dị nde abụọ maọbụ atọ kwa afọ.

en: The size of Access bank's investment in Ogun State is indicative of the feeling in the industry.
ibo: Òtù ihe nnweta akụ ha n'Ogun steeti na-egosi mmetụta a na-enwe n'ụlọ akụ ahụ.

en: One of such strategies is the United Bank of Africa (UBA's) decision to make Wizkid its ambassador.
ibo: Otú n'ime ụdịrị ihe ndị a bụ mkpebi ụlọ akụ United Bank of Africa (UBA) mere Wizkid dịka onye nnọchite anya ya.

en: It had also hosted a discourse 'Stars and Suits: Afropop meets HighFinance,' that conference gave UBA the opportunity to build acollaboration between music stars and finance institutions.
ibo: Aghakwara okwu 'Stars na Suits' : Afropop zutere 'High Finance', ọgbakọ ahụ nyere ndị UBA ohere iwu mmekọrịta dị n'etiti ụlọ egwu na ụlọ ọrụ ego.

en: Zenith, ECOBank and GT are other banks that have and are building more partnerships with clientele in the creative industry.
ibo: Zenith, Eco na GTB bụ ụlọ akụ ndị ọzọ nwere ma na-ewu lite mmekọrịta ha na ndị ọkachamara n'ime ụlọ ọrụ ahụ.

en: Banky W Attacks Buhari's Government For Arresting Sowore
ibo: Banky W wakporo Gọọmentị Buhari maka ijide Sowore

en: Who go represent you?
ibo: Onye ga-anọchite anya gị?

ibo: Mgbe ha bara n’ọfịs, ha ga-enweta ego ha kwụrụ.

ibo: Nnukwu nsogbu ga-adịrị onye ọbụla.

en: Musician, Bankole Wellington better known as Banky W, has condemned the Nigerian Government for its gross human rights violation against citizens.
ibo: Onye na-eti egwu, Bankole Wellington a maara nke ọma dịka Banky W, akọtọọla gọọmentị Naịjirịa maka nnukwute oke iwu ndị nke megidere ụmụ amaala.

en: He also accused Nigerians of being too complacent in moments when they should act.
ibo: Ọ boro ndị Naijiria ebubo na ha na-eme na ihe zuuru ha n' ọnọdụ ọbụla mgbe ha kwesiri ime ihe.

en: Banky W made his position known in a music video posted on his Instagram page with hashtag #BetterChallenge.
ibo: Banky W mere ka a mara nke a na vidiyo egwu o gosipụtara n' Ịnstagramụ nke ọ kpọrọ #BetterChallenge.

en: He said, 'You see the story is the same old one, you want change but you won't vote?
ibo: Ọ sịrị, 'Unu hụrụ na akụkọ a na akụkọ ochie ahụ bụ otu ihe, unu chọrọ mgbanwe mana unu agaghị eme ntuliaka.

en: Then complaining is a not the thing.
ibo: Yabụ, mkpesa abaghị uru.

en: The video went on to show CCTV footage of Sowore's arrest by operatives of the Department of State Services in Lagos on August 3.
ibo: Ihe nkiri ahụ/vidiyo gara n'ihu gosipụta vidiyo CCTV ebe ndị ọrụ nke Ngalaba Ọchịchị (DSS) dị na Legoosụ jidere Sowore n'Ọgọstụ (August) 3.

en: He added, 'They arrest protestor and protect dishonourable senators.
ibo: Ọ gbakwụnyere, 'Ha jidere onye omeiwu na-eme ngagharị iwe ahụ.

en: Who be the meat, who be the hunter?
ibo: Onye bụ anụ ahụ, olee onye bụ dinta?

en: Too many days for the thief, one day for the owner.
ibo: Ọtụtụ ụbọchị bụ maka onye ohi, mana otu ụbọchị bụ maka onye nwe ihe.

en: They arrest the Protestor, and protect dishonourable Senators.
ibo: Ha jidere onye na-eme ngagharị iwe, ma na azọkwa onye Sinetọ ahụ enweghị ihere.
