en: Liverpool, Barcelona, Juventus Record Remarkable Wins As Arsenal's Misery Continues
ibo: Liverpool, Barcelona, ​​Juventus na-enweta ihe mmeri dị egwu ka ahụhụ Arsenal na - aga n'ihu

en: For example, in the widely followed English Premier League, table toppers – Liverpool – fought a resilient Crystal Palace team to walk away 2-1 winners at the end of 90 minutes to keep their title hopes alive.
ibo: Ọmụmaatụ, na mgbaso nke 'English Premier League' na-agbaso, ndị nke mbụ n'egwuregwu - Liverpool - lụrụ ọgụ na mgba ma were ọkpụ abụọ a sara naanị otu merie ndị Crystal Palace na njedebe nkeji iri itoolu iji nọgidesi ike n'ọkwa ha.

en: In major European football league matches played on Saturday, spectators and viewers around the world including in Nigeria were treated to all sorts of experience – good, bad and ugly.
ibo: N'egwuregwu European bọọlụ a na-eme na Satọde, ndị na-ekiri bọọlụ gburugburu ụwa gụnyere na Naịjiria bụ ndị e ji ụdị ahụmịhe niile - ihe ọma, ihe ọjọọ na nke jọrọ njọ were mesoo.

en: For example, in the widely followed English Premier League, table toppers – Liverpool – fought a resilient Crystal Palace team to walk away 2-1 winners at the end of 90 minutes to keep their title hopes alive.
ibo: Ọmụmaatụ, na mgbaso nke 'English Premier League' na-agbaso, ndị nke mbụ n'egwuregwu - Liverpool - lụrụ ọgụ na mgba ma were ọkpụ abụọ a sara naanị otu merie ndị Crystal Palace na njedebe nkeji iri itoolu iji nọgidesi ike n'ọkwa ha.

en: Goals from Sadio Mane and Roberto Firmino delivered the maximum points for Jurgen Klopp' side after Wilfried Zaha had scored an equaliser late in the second half.
ibo: Ọkpọ sitere n'aka Sadio Mane na Roberto Firmino nyere ndị Jurgen Klopp ogo kachasị elu mgbe Wilfried Zaha sachara n'ọkara nke abụọ.

en: In other parts of England, Leicester City where Nigeria's Wilfred Ndidi is an integral member of the team, thrashed Brighton & Hove Albion 2-0 courtesy of goals from Ayoze Perez and Jamie Vardy.
ibo: N’akụkụ ndị ọzọ nke England, Leicester City, ebe Wilfred Ndidi nke Naịjiria bụ onye otu ahụ, ji ọkpụ abụọ a sara otu merie Brighton & Hove Albion nke sitere n’aka Ayoze Perez na Jamie Vardy.

en: But it was a different story for Arsenal Football Club of London as their troubles on the pitch continued on Saturday after they were held to a draw at home by Southampton.
ibo: Mana ọ bụ akụkọ dị iche nyéré ndị Arsenal Football Club nke London ka nsogbu ha gara n'ihu n'ámá egwuregwu na Satọde mgbe ha na ndị Southampton e nyeghị onwe ha ọkpụ ka ha (Southampton) bịara be ha.

en: The result could have been worse for Unai Emery's side had the visitors converted all their chances inside the 18-yard box.
ibo: Rezọọtụ ahụ nwere ike ịka njọ n'akụkụ Unai Emery ma ọ bụrụ na ndị ọbịa ahụ gbanwere ohere ha niile n'ime '18-yard'.

en: It took the artistry of Alexandre Lacazette late in extra-time to score the equalising goal for Arsenal and grab a point for them.
ibo: O were Alexandre Lacazette oge iji gosi nkà ya n'obere oge e nyere iji mee ka ndị Arsenal sàá ọkpụ e nyere ha ma nweta akara.

en: Following the team's poor performance in recent times, Emery had come under intense pressure with many of the fans already losing faith in him and his ability to deliver long-awaited success after the departure of Arsene Wenger last season.
ibo: Ísò arụmọrụ adịghị mma nke otu ahụ n'oge ndị na-adịbeghị anya, Emery bụ onye a na-akwagide ebe ọtụtụ n'ime ndị na-eto ya enweghi okwukwe na ya na ikike ya iji mee nke ọma kemgbe Arsene Wenger pụrụchara.

en: In Spain and Italy, Barcelona and Juventus both ground out important wins away from home against Laganes and Atalanta respectively despite strong resistance from their opponents.
ibo: Na Spain na Italy, Barcelona na Juventus nwetara mmeri na mba ọzọ ebe ha meriri Laganes na Atalanta n'otu n'otu n'agbanyeghị nguzosi ike sitere n'aka ndị ha meriri.

en: Goals from Luis Suarez and Arturo Vidal gave Barcelona a 2-1 win over the host team while a double from Gonzalo Higuain and one from Paulo Dybala saw Juventus come from behind to emerge victorious.
ibo: Ọkpụ sitere n'aka Luis Suarez na Arturo Vidal mere ka Barcelona jiri ọkpụ abụọ a sara otu (2-1) merie ndị otu egwuregwu ahụ ha gbara bọọlụ na be ha, ebe ọkpụ abụọ sitere n'aka Gonzalo Higuain na otu ọkpụ si n'aka Paulo Dybala mere ka ndị Juventus si n'azụ nweta mmeri.

en: Most top sides in Europe's biggest football leagues were all busy on Saturday as a result of the resumption of the Champions League and Europa League between Tuesday and Thursday.
ibo: Ọtụtụ otu egwuregwu bọọlụ kachasị na Europe niile enweghị oghere na Satọdee n'ihi mmalite nke Champions League na European League dị n'etiti Tuzdee na Tọzdee.

en: Magu Urges Corps Members To Shun Fraud
ibo: Magu na-agba ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ume ka ha zeere wayo

en: Magu said rather than engaging in criminal activities that will always lead to regret, youths should focus on building a beautiful future and corrupt-free Nigeria
ibo: Magu kwuru kama itinye aka na mpụ ndị ga-eduga n'ịkwa ụta, ndị ntorobịa kwesịrị ilekwasị anya n'iwuli ọdịnihu dị mma na Naịjiria nke na-enweghị nrụrụ aka.

en: Acting Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission, Ibrahim Magu, has urged National Youth Service Corps members to shun acts of corruption especially cybercrime.
ibo: Onye na-arụ ka onyeisi oche Kọmitii na-ahụ maka ego na mmefu ego (Economic and Financial Crimes Commission), Ibrahim Magu, agbaala ndị otu ntorobịa ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ume ka ha zeere omume nrụrụ aka ọkachasị mpụ saịba 'cyber'.

en: Magu made the call on Tuesday at the Lagos State NYSC Orientation camp, Iyana Ipaja, during a sensitisation lecture.
ibo: Magu kpọrọ oku ahụ na Tuzdee na kampụ ndị ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha (NYSC) dị n'Iyana Ipaja, Legoosụ steeti, n'oge okwu nkuzi.

en: Represented by Public Affairs Director, Lagos Office, Dolapo Adeniran, Magu said rather than engaging in criminal activities that will always lead to regret, youths should focus on building a beautiful future and corrupt-free Nigeria by upholding hard work, integrity and discipline.
ibo: Onye nọchiri anya ya bụ onye nlekọta ọha na eze n'ụlọ ọrụ dị na Legoosụ, Dolapo. Magu agbaala ndị otu ntorobịa ji otu afọ efe ala nna ha ume ka ha zeere omume nrụrụ aka ọkachasị mpụ saịba 'cyber'site n'ịkwado ọrụ siri ike, iguzosi ike n'ezi ihe na ịdọ aka ná ntị.

en: Man Who Staged Wedding Without Reception Reveals How He Convinced Family To Support Idea
ibo: Nwoke nke gbara akwụkwọ n’akpọghị oriri na-ekpughe otu o siri kwenye ezinaụlọ iji kwado echiche

en: Speaking with SaharaReporters on Tuesday, Yusuf, said that the decision was one of the biggest he ever took in his life.
ibo: Mgbe ya na ndị SaharaReporters na-ekwu okwu na Tuzdee, Yusuf kwuru na mkpebi a bụ otu n'ime ihe kachasị ukwuu o kpebiri na ndụ ya.

en: A new groom, Adewale Yusuf, who recently shocked many Nigerians by indicating on his wedding invitation card that there would be no reception after the ceremony, has told SaharaReporters that it took him only two calls to convince his parents and other family members to buy into his idea.
ibo: Nwa okorobịa lụrụ nwunye ọhụrụ, Adewale Yusuf, onye nke tinyere ndị Naịjiria ụjọ site n’igosi na kaadị agbamakwụkwọ na a gaghị akpọ oriri mgbe e mechara emume a, agwala SaharaReporters na o were ya oku abụọ iji mee ka nne na nna ya na ndị ọzọ n’eme ka ha nabata echiche ya.

en: Though he said it was initially tough to persuade his bride, Blessing, to support the concept, he eventually won her over after a few debates on the issue.
ibo: N’agbanyeghi na o kwuru na o siiri ya ike ịkwagide nwunye ya bụ, Blessing, ikwado echiche a, o mechara merie ya mgbe ha rụchara ụka gbasara okwu a.

en: The new couple trended last weekend on the social media with many Nigerians applauding and also bashing their decision not to hold a reception for their guests.
ibo: Di na nwunye ọhụrụ a bụ ndị wuru ewu na ngwụcha izuụka gara aga na soshal midia ebe ọtụtụ ndị Naịjiria na-etiri ha mkpu ma na-agbagha mkpebi ha ịghara ịkpọ ndị ọbịa ha oriri.

en: Speaking with SaharaReporters on Tuesday, Yusuf, said that the decision was one of the biggest he ever took in his life.
ibo: Mgbe ya na ndị SaharaReporters na-ekwu okwu na Tuzdee, Yusuf kwuru na mkpebi a bụ otu n'ime ihe kachasị ukwuu o kpebiri na ndụ ya.

en: He said, 'When I first informed my parents of the idea not to have a reception after my wedding ceremony, they dropped the call on me.
ibo: O kwuru, sị, “Mgbe mbụ m gwara ndị mụrụ m na agaghị akpọ oriri ọbụla mgbe m gachara akwụkwọ, ha kwụsịrị oku ahụ.

en: Eventually, it took me about two more calls to be able to convince them to support my idea.
ibo: “N’ikpeazụ, ọ were m ihe ugboro abụọ ọzọ iji mee ka ha kweta ịkwado echiche m.

en: The truth is that I'm a man of my words. I'm a different person, I am not a loud type.
ibo: Eziokwu bụ na abụ m nwoke na-akwụ n'okwu m. A dị m iche, abụghị m onye a na-anụ olu ya.

en: Many people around me did not like the idea initially but I made sure to let them see reasons with me.
ibo: “Ọtụtụ ndị nọ m nso enweghị mmasị n'echiche ahụ na mbụ mana a gbara m mbọ mee ka ha mata ihe kpatara ya.'

en: At the end of the day, everyone appreciated my idea.'
ibo: 'Na ngwụsị ụbọchị ahụ, onye ọbụla ji echiche m kpọrọ ihe.”

en: But despite not staging a reception at their wedding, Yusuf told SaharaReporters that many of their guests didn't return home without having something to eat.
ibo: Mana n'agbanyeghị na ọ kpọghị oriri n'agbamakwụkwọ ha, Yusuf gwara SaharaReporters na ọtụtụ n'ime ndị ọ kpọrọ alaghị be ha n'enweghị ihe ha riri.

en: He added, 'We shared food for the few friends we invited. I made sure my friends that came from Ibadan went back that day.
ibo: Ọ gbakwụnyere, “Anyị nyere ndị enyi ole na ole anyị kpọrọ nri. A gbara mbọ hụ na ndị enyi m si Ibadan laghachiri n’ụbọchị ahụ.

en: 'One thing people should know is that there is nothing they want that they can't do as long as it makes them happy and fulfilled.
ibo: “Otu ihe ndị mmadụ kwesịrị ịma bụ na ọ nweghị ihe ha chọrọ ha agaghị emeli ma ọ bụrụhaala na ọ na-eme ha obi ụtọ.'

en: 'Having a loud reception after the wedding ceremony was unnecessary as far as I was concerned.'
ibo: 'Ịkpọ oriri dara ụda mgbe a gbachara akwụkwọ ekwesighi, ka m si chee.”

en: Mercy Becomes First Female To Win BBNaija

ibo: Ihe karịrị ndị Naịjiria nde iri ise sonyere na ntuli aka ịtụ vootu nke na-éwè opekata mpe naịra iri atọ kwa ederede ọbụla.

en: Mercy Eke, 26, made history on Saturday by becoming the first female to win BBNaija reality television show.

en: Eke defeated Mike in the final round of the contest, walking away with the coveted prize of N30m cash, N25m Sports Utility Vehicle, a trip for two to Dubai among other things.
ibo: Eke meriri Mike na ngwụcha asọmpi ahụ, were ego dị nde naịra iri atọ, nde naịra iri abụọ na ise maka ụgbọala a kpọrọ 'Sports Utility Vehicle', njem nke abụọ ịga Dubai na ihe ndị ọzọ.

en: Frodd, Omatshola and Seyi Awolowo were the other contestants that made it into the top five.
ibo: Frodd, Omatshola na Seyi Awolowo bụ ndị ọzọ so sọọ mpi ma turu ugo na mmadụ ise kachasị elu.

en: Over 50 million Nigerians participated in the voting process that cost at least N30 per text message.
ibo: Ihe karịrị ndị Naịjiria nde iri ise sonyere na ntuli aka ịtụ vootu nke na-éwè opekata mpe naịra iri atọ kwa ederede ọbụla.

en: Eke's victory brings to end the three-month long widely followed show.
ibo: Mmeri nke Eke wetara njedebe ihe nkiri a gbasoro ọnwa atọ.

en: Ministerial Clutching At Straws By Barnabas Igho
ibo: Ịchọpụta olileanya nke ndị Mịnịsta nke sitere n’aka Banabas Igho

en: For now, let him know that his take-off was very bad and turbulent and everything boils down to his poor piloting skills, and not the army of imaginary saboteurs and enemies his aides are busy conjuring up for him.
ibo: Ka ọ dị ugbu a, mee ka ọ mata na nṅomi ya bụ ihe ọjọọ ma bụrụkwa ọgbaghara na ihe niile gbadara n'ihe banyere ikike ya na ọ bụghị ndị ụgha ndị echiche ha adịghị mma na ndị iro na-enyere ya aka

en: If you are supervising an important ministry like that of communication even without the recent fancy addition of 'digital economy' to its name, and you still need a spokesperson to pen almost 2,000 words of polemics in order to project your image, then your self-inflicted trouble is just starting in my reckoning.
ibo: Ma ọ bụrụ na ị na-elekọta ụlọ ọrụ Mịnịstrị dị mkpa dịka nke nkwukọrịta, ọbụlagodi mgbe agbakwunyeghi 'akụ na ụba dijitaalụ' n'aha ya, ị ka ga-achọkwa onye na-ekwuchite ọnụ ga-edetu ihe dịka okwu puku abụọ iji gosipụta ihe oyiyi gị, mgbe ahụ, nsogbu gị na-amalite n'ikpe m ga-ekpe.

en: Before her latest outburst in the media, thoughtlessly blaming imaginary saboteurs for trying to stop her 'unstoppable boss', Uwa Suleman had issued a disconcerting diatribe in form of a press release, accusing all critical stakeholders of the ministry her principal supervises including the media, of ganging up against him because he was the 'best thing' that happened to the industry since its liberalisation in the year 2000.
ibo: Tupu óké iwe ya na mgbasa ozi, na-ata ụta n'echiche echeghị maka ịgbalị ịkwụsị 'onyeisi nchịkwa ya', Uwa Suleman ewepụtala ekwumekwu na-akatọ mmadụ n'ụdị mgbasa ozi, na-ebo ndị ụlọọrụ Mịnịstrị ahụ gụnyere ndị mgbasa ozi, banyere ịkpa nkata megide ya n'ihi na ọ bụ 'ihe kachasị mma' nke meere ụlọọrụ ahụ kemgbe ọnụnọ ya n'afọ 2000.

en: This prompted ripostes of some respected columnists like Mr Sanya Oni of The Nation newspaper, who eloquently summed up the minister's tragedy as a case of exaggerated notion of the office that he occupies as 'he obviously didn't think that his remit stops at formulating and implementing policies for the digital economy; as he wants to play the regulator'.
ibo: Nke a kpaliri ọsịsa ụfọdụ ndị ntaakụkọ dịka Maazị Sanya Oni nke akwụkwọ akụkọ 'The Nation', onye chịkọtara ọdachi ahụ dakwasịrị mịnịsta ahụ dịka banyere ikwubiga okwu ókè banyere ọrụ ọ na-arụ dịka 'o doro anya na o cheghị na ọrụ ya kwụsịrị na nhazi na mmejupụta atụmatụ maka akụ na ụba dijitalụ; dịka ọ chọrọ ịrụ ka onye nhazi”.

en: Since his assuming office in August this year, Mr Pantami has indeed found it difficult to adjust from the regulatory role he used to enjoy at National Information Technology Development Agency to his new titular position as per regulating the industry is concerned, and his unconstitutional attempts to dabble into it has invited the resistance of major actors in the industry like Association of Licensed Telecoms Operators of Nigeria as well as that of the Association of Telecoms Companies of Nigeria.
ibo: Kemgbe ọ malitere ọkwá n'ọnwa Ọgọst afọ a, Maazị Pantami achọpụtala na o siri ike ịgbanwe ọrụ nchịkwa o jibu n'ụlọ ọrụ 'National Information Technology Development Agency' na ọkwa ọhụrụ ya, na ịgba mbọ ya o sonyere nke ịkpọ oku nguzogide nke ndị isi ụlọ ọrụ ahụ dịka 'Association of Licensed Telecoms Operators of Nigeria' yana nke 'Association of Telecoms of Nigeria.'

en: Coming back to Uwa's latest invectives however, there are some fundamental half-truths she raised in her slay-queen styled article, like ridiculous claim that South Africa and other countries are busy copying and pasting the minister's example of his failed data price reduction directive.
ibo: Na-alaghachi na okwu ọjọọ Uwa kwuru, e nwere ụfọdụ eziokwu nke o welitere n'edemede ya, dịka mkparị na-ekwu na South Africa na mba ndị ọzọ nọ na-arụsi ọrụ ike iwere ihe ịmaatụ nke minista ahụ banyere mbenata ọnụahịa 'data'.

en: While this, to say the least, is very disrespectful to the authorities in South Africa, who have never impliedly referred to Nigeria in taking their decisions, it's obviously not the actual representation of the truth of the matter.
ibo: Ebe nke a, akwanyeghị ndị ọchịchị nọ na South Africa ugwu, bụ ndị ezigabeghị Naịjiria na mkpebi ha, o doro anya na ọ bụghị ihe nnọchite nke eziokwu okwu ahụ.

en: Someone should wake Uwa up and hand over a mug of coffee to her together with the contrasting news of India's example that hiked data prices to as much as 40 per cent.
ibo: Mmadụ kwesịrị ịkpọte Uwa ma nyefee ya iko kọfị ma kọọ akụkọ dị iche iche banyere etu ndị India si mee ka ọnụ ahịa ruo pasenti iri anọ.

en: We don't know how this is ignored as a copy and pasting of what the policy of the man she obsequiously describes in ludicrous adjectives that late Idi Amin of Uganda would have rejected.
ibo: Anyị amataghị etu e si leghara nke a anya ma gosipụta ihe iwu banyere nwoke ọ kọwara n'ụzọ ọjọọ na Idi Amin nke Uganda gaara ịjụ.

en: To cut the story short, India used to enjoy the cheapest data in the world, but the industry could no longer sustain it without risking losing in further investment to support the telecom infrastructure in the country.
ibo: Iji bie akụkọ a nkenke, India na-enwebu 'data' adịbughị ọnụ n'ụwa, mana ụlọ ọrụ ahụ enweghị ike ịkwado ya na-etinyekwughi ego iji kwado akụrụngwa telecom na mba ahụ.

en: This still happened within the 21-day coincidence Uwa claimed to have provided the copy and paste effect in South Africa.
ibo: Nke a ka mere n'ime mkpụrụ ụbọchị iri abụọ na otu Uwa kwuru na ọ nyere nwepụghachi mpụtara na South Africa.

en: Still, what Uwa hasn't told us was that South Africa used to be among the top three in terms of the cost of data and even with 50 per cent reduction, it wouldn't come down to the level of Nigeria despite the fact that the challenges the telcos face and cost of production in Nigeria are clearly on a different scale.
ibo: N'agbanyeghị nke ahụ, ihe Uwa agwabeghị anyị bụ na South Africa na-anọkarị n'etiti ndị atọ kachasị elu n'ihe gbasara ọnụahịa 'data' yana n'agbanyeghị mbelata pasenti iri ise, ọ gaghị agbadata n'ọkwa nke Naịjiria n'agbanyeghị ihe ịma aka chere 'telcos' ihu na ọnụahịa mmepụta na Naịjirịa dị iche.

en: Even on the strength of TheCable report that Pantami quoted in the past, it put Nigeria and South Africa, with the average of $2.22 and $7.19 per 1GB respectively.
ibo: N'agbanyeghị akụkọ ndị otu 'Cable' nke kwuru na Pantami n'oge gara aga, tinyere Naịjiria na South Africa, were nwee ihe nkezi $2.22 na $7.19 kwa 1GB n'otu n'otu.

en: And one can forgive Uwa for her poor grasp of the issue as she embarrassingly attributed the directive in South Africa to the country's telecom regulator, while a little search on Google on the matter would have told her that the decision emanated from South Africa Competition Regulatory Authority, not the Independent Communications Authority of South Africa and the decision must have been scientifically based, not jejune subjective populist directive.
ibo: Mmadụ pụrụ ịgbaghara Uwa maka amaghị ihe na ihe ọmụma a dị na South Africa dị n’aka onyeisi ndị 'telecom', ebe obere ihe ọchịchọ n’igwe 'Google' banyere okwu a gaala agwa ya na mkpebi a sitere n'iwu asọmpi nke South Africa a kpọrọ 'South Africa Competition Regulatory Authority', na ọ bụghị Independent Communications Authority of South Africa na mkpebi ahụ kwesiri idabere na sayensị.

en: But such kinds of faux pas are understandable as Uwa and co in the new mandate are trying to learn the rope.
ibo: Mana ụdị ọnọdụ a ka a ga-aghọta dị ka Uwa na ndị ọzọ n'iwu ọhụrụ ahụ na-anwa ịmụta ya.

en: And they should be reminded of the fact that before their arrival on the scene, the industry had already matured.
ibo: Ha kwesiri ka e chetara ha na tupu ha abịa ebe a, ndị ọrụ ahụ adịrịla.

en: There were over 70 million Nigerians on the high-speed Internet, millions of active subscriber base as well as numerous sensational story in the industry, which has been on this sustained trajectory for long.
ibo: E nwere ihe karịrị nde ndị Naịjirịa iri asaa nọ n'ịntaneetị, ọtụtụ nde ndị na-edebanye aha na ọtụtụ akụkọ n'ụlọ ọrụ ahụ, bụ nke nọworo na-adigide ogologo oge a.

en: Hence, accusing both the providers and regulator of connivance is not only reckless but cheap as both the stakeholders collaboratively built the industry from the scratch.
ibo: N'ihi ya, ibo ma ndị na-eweta ya na ndị na-achịkwa nkwekọrịta abụghị naanị ihe enweghị isi kama ọ dị ọnụ ala ebe ndị ọrụ mpaghara ahụ rụkọtara ọrụ ọnụ wee rụpụta ụlọ ọrụ ahụ.

en: Some years ago, we saw how the regulator, NCC fined a major MNO over N1trn. Pray what kind of compromised regulator would dare?
ibo: Afọ ụfọdụ gara aga, anyị hụrụ ka onyeisi nchịkwa, NCC siri daa nnukwu onye MNO nha ihe karịrị N1trn. Kedu ụdị onye nchịkwa nke ga-eme ya.

en: It's not too late for the minister however, to curb himself of this seduction to 'populism' and court the important stakeholders of the ministry by beginning to put the cart before the horse – addressing industry issues – if he wants to succeed.
ibo: Oge agabeghị minista a igbochi onwe ya n'ụdị ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị a ma rịọ ndị ọrụ ozi dị mkpa n'ụlọ ọrụ ahụ - na-akọwa okwu metụtara ụlọ ọrụ a - ma ọ bụrụ na ọ chọrọ ime nke ọma.

en: Omobola Johnson was very effective as a minster because she fully understood the job and how to manage a delicate industry like telecommunications.
ibo: Omobola Johnson gbara ezigbo mbọ dịka onye mịnịsta n’ihi na ọ ghọtara ọrụ ahụ nke ọma yana otu esi ejikwa ụlọ ọrụ dịka nke telekọmunikeshọn.

en: If Mr Pantami wants to succeed, he needs all the regulators and operators on his side, and he can't achieve that by constantly pitching them against the consumers thereby making his narcissistic self-good and everybody that has contributed to the development of the industry bad.
ibo: Ọ bụrụ na Maazị Pantami chọrọ ime nke ọma, o nwee ndị niile na-ahụ maka nchịkwa na ndị na-arụ ọrụ n'akụkụ ya, ọ gaghị enwe ike imezu nke ahụ site n'imegide ha n'ebe ndị na-azụ ahịa nọ si otu ahụ na-eme ka a hụ ya dịka onye dị mma ebe onye ọbụla n'ụlọ ọrụ ahụ bụ onye ọjọọ.

en: For now, let him know that his take-off was very bad and turbulent and everything boils down to his poor piloting skills, and not the army of imaginary saboteurs and enemies his aides are busy conjuring up for him.

en: Igho, a telecoms engineer cum public affairs analyst, writes from Lagos.
ibo: Igho, onye injinia ndị 'telecoms' yana onye nyocha ihe gbasara ọha na eze, si na Legoosụ dee.

en: If you are supervising an important ministry like that of communication even without the recent fancy addition of 'digital economy' to its name, and you still need a spokesperson to pen almost 2,000 words of polemics in order to project your image, then your self-inflicted trouble is just starting in my reckoning.
ibo: Ma ọ bụrụ na ị na-elekọta ụlọ ọrụ Mịnịstrị dị mkpa dịka nke nkwukọrịta, ọbụlagodi mgbe agbakwunyeghi 'akụ na ụba dijitaalụ' n'aha ya, ị ka ga-achọkwa onye na-ekwuchite ọnụ ga-edetu ihe dịka okwu puku abụọ iji gosipụta ihe oyiyi gị, mgbe ahụ, nsogbu gị na-amalite n'ikpe m ga-ekpe.

en: Before her latest outburst in the media, thoughtlessly blaming imaginary saboteurs for trying to stop her 'unstoppable boss', Uwa Suleman had issued a disconcerting diatribe in form of a press release, accusing all critical stakeholders of the ministry her principal supervises including the media, of ganging up against him because he was the 'best thing' that happened to the industry since its liberalisation in the year 2000.

ibo: A nwụchiri nwoke ahụ ebe o ji okpokoro isi mmadụ na ihe ndị ọzọ.

en: There was pandemonium on Thursday at the Otokutu Bridge in Ughelli South Local Government Area of Delta State following the arrest of a middle-aged man suspected to be a ritualist.
ibo: E nwere ọgbaghara na Tọzdee n'àkwà mmiri Otokutu dị n'okpuru ọchịchị Ughelli South nke Delta State mgbe e jidere otu nwoke katagoro ahụ a na-enyo enyo na ọ bụ onye ọgwụ ego.

en: The man was caught with a human skull and other items in his possession.
ibo: A nwụchiri nwoke ahụ ebe o ji okpokoro isi mmadụ na ihe ndị ọzọ.

en: The suspected ritualist, who was said to have been caught by the vigilante group in the area, was set ablaze by an angry mob few minutes after his arrest.
ibo: Nwoke ahụ a na-enyo enyo na-agwọ ọgwụ ego, bụ onye e kwuru na ìgwè ndị nche jidere na mpaghara ahụ, bụ onye ndị mmadụ iwe na-ewe mụrụ ọkụ obere oge e jidere ya.

en: The incident, it was learnt, caused gridlock on the popular DSC Expressway as commuters and vehicle owners making use of that route spent several hours on top of the bridge.
ibo: Ihe ahụ merenụ, dịka a nụrụ, mere ka ọtụtụ ụgbọala dị n'okporo ụzọ DSC dịka ndị na-eme njem na ndị ọkwọ ụgbọala na-agba ụzọ ahụ nọrọ ọtụtụ awa n’elu àkwà ahụ.

en: Narrating the incident to our correspondent, a lady who witnessed the scenario, said the suspect had been acting like a deranged person around the bridge for the past months before he was discovered on Thursday when he tried to attack a motorcycle rider.
ibo: Nwaanyị nọ ka ihe mere na-akọwara onye nta akụkọ anyị ihe mere, kwuru na onye a na-enyo enyo na-eme dị ka onye isi mebiri na akụkụ àkwà ahụ ọnwa ole na ole tupu a chọpụta ya na Tọzdee mgbe ọ nwara ịwakpo onye na-agba ọgba tumtum.

en: The woman said, 'The ritualist who has been pretending to be a mad man for several months was about to attack and kill an Okada man who went close to the Otokutu Bridge when he was discovered.
ibo: Nwanyị ahụ kwuru, 'Onye ahụ na-agwọ ọgwụ ego nke mere ka ọ na-agba ara kemgbe ọtụtụ ọnwa na-achọ ịwakpo ma gbuo nwoke ọgba tumtum nke gara nso n'Osimiri Otokutu mgbe a chọpụtara ya. '

en: 'But as God will have it, the Okada rider escaped from the ritualist and he went to town and informed youths in the area.
ibo: “Mana dị ka Chukwu siri chọọ ya, onye ọgba tumtum gbanarịrị onye ọgwụ ego ahụ, ọ gara n'obodo ma kọọrọ ndị ntorobịa nọ n'ógbè ahụ.

en: On getting to the place, the mob saw the mad man making a call with a phone and upon sighting the people, he immediately threw the phone into a nearby river. The youths and the vigilante conducted a search and a human skull suspected to be that of a lady and other handsets were found with him.
ibo: Mgbe e rutere ebe ahụ, igwe mmadụ ahụ hụrụ nwoke onye ara ahụ ka o ji ekwentị akpọ oku ma mgbe ọ hụrụ ndị mmadụ, ọ tụbara ekwentị ozigbo n'otu osimiri dị nso. Ndị ntorobịa na ndị nche mere nyocha ma hụ okpokoro isi mmadụ nke e chere na ọ bụ nke nwanyị na ụfọdụ ekwentị ọzọ ka a hụrụ.

en: 'Upon questioning him, he confessed to belonging to a notorious ritualist gang but declined to give more details and at this point, a mob poured him fuel and set him ablaze.'
ibo: Mgbe a na-agba ya ajụjụ ọnụ, o kwupụtara na o so n'ótù òtù ndị ọgwụ ego a ma ama ma ọ jụrụ ịkọwapụta nke ọma, ndị mmadụ nọ ebe ahụ wụ̀rụ̀ ya mmanụ e ji ányà ụgbọala ma mụnye ya ọkụ.

en: It was gathered that despite the presence of policemen at the scene, the mob succeeded in setting ablaze the suspected ritualist.'
ibo: E nwetara ozi na n'agbanyeghị na ndị uweojii nọ n'ebe ahụ, ìgwè mmadụ ahụ gara n'ihi mụnye onye ahụ a na-enyo enyo na ọ bụ onye ọgwụ ego ọkụ.”

en: Calls and messages to the spokesperson for the police in the state, Onome Onovwakpoyeya, were not responded to.
ibo: Oku na ozi e zigaara onye nkwuchite ọnụ ndị uwe ojii na steeti ahụ, Onome Onovwakpoyeya, bụ nke azaghị ha.

en: Monkey Chants, Racist Abuse Make Players Abandon English FA Match
ibo: Mkparị ndị isi ojii n'aka ndị isi ọcha, mkpagbu ịkpa oke agbụrụ na-eme ka ndị egwuregwu hapụ egwuregwu English FA.

en: The incident during the match in the fourth qualifying round came just five days after England players endured racist abuse during their Euro 2020 qualifier against Bulgaria in Sofia.
ibo: Ihe ahụ mere n'oge egwuregwu ahụ n'agba nke anọ bịara naanị ụbọchị ise ka ndị egwuregwu England dìrì mkpagbu ịkpa oke agbụrụ n'oge egwuregwu Euro 2020 ha na ndị Bulgaria gbara na Sofia.

en: An FA Cup qualifying match between Haringey Borough and Yeovil Town was abandoned on Saturday after allegations that players were racially abused and spat on.
ibo: Egwuregwu isonye n'iko FA dị n'etiti Haringey Borough na Yeovil Town bụ nke a hapụrụ na Satọdee mgbe e boro ndị na-agba bọọlụ ebubo megide agbụrụ ha.

en: The players of seventh-tier outfit Haringey walked off the field with about 25 minutes to go, shortly after Yeovil had scored a penalty.
ibo: Ndị egwuregwu bọọlụ nke Haringey pụrụ n'ámá egwuregwu ka egwuregwu ahụ fọrọ ihe dịka nkeji iri abụọ na ise ka ọ kwụsị, obere oge Yeovil gbachara 'penalty' ma nye ọkpụ.

en: The incident during the match in the fourth qualifying round came just five days after England players endured racist abuse during their Euro 2020 qualifier against Bulgaria in Sofia.
ibo: Ihe ahụ mere n'oge egwuregwu ahụ n'agba nke anọ bịara naanị ụbọchị ise ka ndị egwuregwu England dìrì mkpagbu ịkpa oke agbụrụ n'oge egwuregwu Euro 2020 ha na ndị Bulgaria gbara na Sofia.

en: Haringey manager Tom Loizou said defender Coby Rowe suffered racial abuse while Cameroonian goalkeeper Douglas Pajetat was also spat at, prompting him to take his players off the pitch.
ibo: Onye njikwa Haringey, Tom Loizou kwuru na onye na-agbachi bọọlụ Coby Rowe tara ahụhụ maka mkpagbu/mkparị agbụrụ ebe onye Cameroon, Douglas Pajetat ka a gbụrụ asọ, na-akpali ya ịkpọpụta ndị egwuregwu ya n'ámá egwuregwu ahụ.

en: 'Early into the second half, we got a corner and a couple of the players said to me there was monkey chants,' Loizou told Sky News.
ibo: Lotizou gwara Sky News, 'N'oge a batara n'ọkara nke abụọ, anyị nwetara ịgba kọna 'corner', ụfọdụ n'ime ndị egwuregwu gwara m na e nwere mkparị ndị isi ojii site n'aka ndị isi ọcha.'

en: 'We got over that, we carried on playing. They got a penalty and my goalkeeper was spat at and had missiles thrown at him.
ibo: Anyị meriri nke ahụ, anyị gara n'ihu n'egwuregwu. Ha nwetara ịgba 'penalty' ebe onye na-echere m bọọlụ bụ onye a gbụrụ asọ ma tụọkwa ya ihe.

en: 'The referee halted the game briefly, they scored the penalty, one of players went to pick the ball out of the back of the net and Coby Rowe was racially abused.'
ibo: Onye na-egbu bọọlụ ahụ kwụsịrị egwuregwu ahụ obere oge, ha gbanyere ya n'ụgbụ, otu n'ime ndị egwuregwu gara ịtụtụrụ bọọlụ ahụ n'azụ ụgbụ ahụ ma a kparịrị Coby Rowe.

en: Loizou said he had to take his players off.
ibo: Loizou kwuru na ọ ghapụrụ ndị egwuregwu ya.

en: 'I looked at a couple of our players' faces and I was distraught myself, just to see their faces.
ibo: “Ahụrụ m ihu ndị egwuregwu anyị ụfọdụ, ọ na-ewutekwa m, naanị ịhụ ihu ha.

en: I gave it a couple of minutes and I went on the pitch and pulled my players off,' he said.
ibo: Enyere m ya nkeji ole na ole ma m gara n'ámá egwuregwu ahụ ma dọkpụrụ ndị egwuregwu m,' o kwuru.

en: 'There was no way that two or three of those players could have continued playing.
ibo: “O nweghị ụzọ mmadụ abụọ maọbụ atọ ga-esi gaa n'ihu na-egwu egwu.

en: What they heard was disgusting, they looked frightened.
ibo: Ihe ha nụrụ bụ ihe arụ, ha na-atụ ụjọ.

en: 'I can't sit down and watch young players being abused by a minority.'
ibo: 'Enweghị m ike ịnọdụ ala na-ele ebe ndị dị nta na-emegbu na-eto eto.”

en: Rowe later posted on Twitter: 'Can't believe I'm tweeting this and it's 2019 but today I was a victim of racism, in what was supposed to be a great day for @HaringeyBoroFC.
ibo: Rowe mechara zipu ozi na Twitter: 'Ekweghị na m ga-ede na tweeter, nke a bụ 2019 mana taa a bụụrụ m onye a na-akpagbu n'ihi agbụrụ, n'ihe ga-abụ nnukwu ụbọchị maka @HaringeyBoroFC.

en: Another game of football ruined by racists.'
ibo: Ndị na-akpa ókè agbụrụ emebiela egwuregwu bọọlụ ọzọ.”

en: Anti-discrimination charity Kick It Out praised the 'swift and decisive action' taken by Loizou and his players.
ibo: Ndị ọrụ na-egbochi ikpa oke ebere 'Kick It Out' toro “mkpebi ngwa ngwa na nke siri ike” nke Loizou na ndị egwuregwu ya wetaea.

en: The FA said it was looking into the incident 'as a matter of urgency'.
ibo: Ndị FA kwuru na ọ na-eleba anya na ihe a merenụ 'dịka ọ dị oke mkpa'.

en: In a statement, Yeovil said: 'We are aware that there are allegations that racist comments were made in the crowd and this allegation will be a key part of any investigation.
ibo: Na nkwupụta, Yeovil kwuru, “Anyị maara na e nwere ebubo na e kwuru okwu ịkpa ókè agbụrụ n'igwe mmadụ ma ebubo a ga-abụ ihe dị mkpa na nyocha ọbụla.

en: 'Irrespective of the outcome of any investigations, we would like to make it clear that the club will not accept racism or discrimination in any form.'
ibo: 'Agbanyeghị mepụtara nyocha ọbụla, anyị ga-achọ ịme ka o doo anya na otu klọb ahụ agaghị anabata ịkpa ókè agbụrụ maọbụ ịkpa ókè n'ụzọ ọbụla.

en: England players endured monkey chants and apparent Nazi salutes in Bulgaria.
ibo: Ndị egwuregwu England nagidere nkatọ ahụ na ekele nke Nazi na Bulgaria.

en: That match was stopped twice as England players made their feelings known to UEFA officials before the tie was eventually completed.
ibo: A kwụsịrị egwuregwu ahụ ugboro abụọ ka ndị egwuregwu England mere ka ndị ọrụ UEFA mara obi ha tupu emechaa ihe niile.

en: Aston Villa's Tyrone Mings, who made his international debut that night and was singled out by the Bulgarian crowd, applauded Haringey for 'taking a stance' against racism.
ibo: Teone Mings nke Aston Villa, gbara bọọlụ mbụ ya n'abalị ahụ, ìgwè ndị Bulgarian wepụtara ya, kụọlọ Haringey aka maka ikwu uche ya megide ịkpa ókè agbụrụ.

en: 'Sometimes it can get brushed off in lower leagues but everyone stands with you,' he tweeted. 'Our country isn't perfect either.'
ibo: “Mgbe ụfọdụ, ọ nwere ike sie ike n'obere egwuregwu mana onye ọbụla nọnywere gị,” ọ dere na tweeter. 'Ala anyị ezughịkwa òkè.'

ibo: Anyị esighi ike ma ndị nna anyị aka n'oge ha, ha nwere obi ike ma kpebie ịlụ ọgụ nke ha.

ibo: Aisha Omolola

en: These are the controversial queries that filled the social media airwaves after the mysterious suicide action taken by Aisha Omolola, a 300 level student of Ahmadu Bello University, Zaria in her apartment at Samaru, Kaduna State.
ibo: Ajụjụ ndị a na-ese okwu jupụtara na soshal midia mgbe ihe omimi igbu onwe ya nke Aisha Omolola, nwa akwụkwọ (300L) nke Mahadum Ahmadu Bello, Zaria n'ụlọ ya na Samaru, Kaduna State.

en: Omolola was said to have committed suicide by drinking insecticide.
ibo: Omolola ka e kwuru na o gburu onwe ya site na ịṅụ ọgwụ ahụhụ.

en: She also reportedly dropped a note, stating why she took her life.
ibo: A kọrọ na o deturu akwụkwọ, na-ekwu ihe mere o jiri gbuo onwe ya.

en: According to the note, she wrote that her family should be held responsible for her suicide, especially her mother and father.
ibo: N'ederede ahụ, o dere na e kwesiri ijide ndị ezinaụlọ ya maka onwe ya o gburu, ọkachasị nne na nna ya.

en: She said the duo made life miserable for her and thus, killing herself was the only way she could save herself from the family's frustration.
ibo: O kwuru na ha mere ka ndụ ghara ịtọ ya ụtọ, yabụ igbu onwe ya bụ naanị ụzọ ọ ga-esi chebe onwe ya na ndakpọ ezinụlọ.

en: The letter reads below:
ibo: Ngụpụta edemede leta

en: Just like I said, if I am no more, please hold my family especially my mum and dad responsible.
ibo: Dịka m kwuru, ọ bụrụ na anọghịzi m, biko jide ezinaụlọ m ọkachasị nne na nna m.

en: I have tried to be the best I can be, stayed away from them just because they blame me for their mistakes and they can't love, help and take care of me like their own.
ibo: Agbalịala m ịdị mma, zeere ha n'ihi na ha na-ata m ụta maka mmehie ha na ha enweghị ike hụ m n'anya, nyere m aka ma lekọta m anya dịka nke ha.

en: My mum has made life a living hell for me only because she is bipolar and frustrated; accusing me of being a witch, trying to kill her and being a cursed child even though my brother is responsible for my education and upkeep.
ibo: Nne m emeela ka ndụ m bụrụ ọkụ ala mmụọ naanị n'ihi na obi agbawaala ya; na-ebo m ebubo ịbụ amoosu, na-achọ igbu ya na ịbụ onye a bụrụ ọnụ n'agbanyeghị na nwanne m nwoke na-ahụ maka agụmakwụkwọ na nlekọta m.

en: The only thing she helps me with is my feeding money.
ibo: Naanị ihe ọ na-enyere m aka bụ ego m ji enweta nri.

en: I have gone out of my way to take care of my mum by giving her food and money but I still end up being her problem.
ibo: A gara m n'ihu ilekọta nne m site n'inye ya nri na ego mana a ka m bụụrụ ya nsogbu.

en: My brother can't stick to his promise anymore because he feels I am not his responsibility and I have my own family.
ibo: Nwanne m enweghi ike imezu nkwa ya ike n'ihi na ọ na-eche na abụghị m ọrụ ya, enwekwara m ezinụlọ nke m.

en: I hope and believe that now that I am gone, it will bring them relief and happiness.
ibo: E nwere m olile anya ma kwere na ugbu a m nwụrụ, ọ ga-ewetara obi ụtọ.

en: I am so sorry Collins, I had to leave you this way, Maryam Olayemi you have [been] more than a bestie to me.

en: However, the picture attached to the Facebook post, showing Aisha in the hospital receiving treatment is the first fact that falsifies the rumours.
ibo: Otu o sila dị, foto a bụ nke e tinyere na 'Facebook', na-egosi Aisha n'ụlọ ọgwụ ebe ọ na-anata ọgwụgwọ bụ eziokwu mbụ gosiri na asịrị ahụ bụ ụgha.

en: This is because the said picture was posted on Twitter sometime in October 2018, when Aisha was said to have had an accident.

en: I was the main friend that carried her dead body the very day she died at the Jamaa hospital in Samaru.
